story:
Latitude 53: New Location, New Patio

Latitude 53 is Edmonton’s oldest artist run gallery, and we’re celebrating our 40th anniversary this year! We have recently moved into a new location (just next door to the old one) that brings Latitude 53 down to street level. This makes the gallery more visible and more accessible to everyone.

Many people are asking “WHAT ABOUT THE PATIO?!!?11” – and this campaign is the answer.  Latitude 53 is planning to build a brand new patio out front of the new gallery space that reaches right up to the sidewalk, and this is where all of our patio events will take place.

Some awesome features of the new patio:

  • It’s right on street level, so everyone can see when a party is happening. 
  • No stairs! No need to climb up 3 flights of stairs to join the fun.
  • Garage door access: It will no longer be difficult to move between inside and outside – the new patio will be an extension of the gallery spaces.

The patio is a place for our community to gather, have great conversations, and most importantly it gives everyone the perfect reason to come out and be involved with amazing contemporary art. It is important for Latitude 53 to reinvent this space for the future and this is what we are asking you to help us achieve. 

We are looking to raise $3000 or more over the next month in order to help with the costs of having the actual deck built for the patio. Board by board we will build this new space, and we are asking you to be a part of it by making a contribution to this campaign. Every bit makes a difference, and the big reward (besides the perks that you get!) is that there will be a new unique place to hang out in downtown Edmonton.  

We can't wait to see all of you out this summer! The patio series begins on Thursday June 13.

Don’t forget to link the campaign to all your social networks!

The next step...

We’ve been amazed with the reception to our Patio construction fundraising campaign—not even halfway through, and we’ve already passed $3000—but we think we can do better! If we can raise $6000 with this campaign, we'll be able to stock our bar and kitchen, pour concrete to replace the old, unlevel tiles next to the deck, and make sure the patio is inviting and beautiful in time for the season's start.

Meanwhile, we’re making plans to start the deck construction soon. Mark your calendar for the first Patio on June 13!

story:
Our Story

Exploiting the Earth’s resources for energy is part of what humans do. Recently, horizontal drilling and hydraulic fracturing technologies have demonstrated great promise in extracting natural gas from deep underground. These technologies rupture deep rock formations with the high-pressure injection of a mixture of water, sand and chemical additives, liberating the gas within. Fracturing these layers of rock is commonly called Hydrofracking or Fracking.

As with most energy extraction methods, controversy flourishes with hydrofracking. We need the energy… people need jobs & money… there are dangers… humans take shortcuts… tycoons abandon played out sites… etc. Fracking is no different, and has plenty of arguments coming from many perspectives.

Oil City, PA is in the middle of a large shale field being fracked called Marcellus. Because of our geography the local art community felt it was appropriate to invite artists to display their ideas on Fracking. We want art to facilitate a public discourse, and we call the show Frackin’ Art.

We invite work from artists reflecting their view on hydrofracking – the benefits, the dangers, the future, the fears, or any other inspiration. There are many national and international sites where hydrofracking is an issue and artists from any locale are invited.
 

What We Need & What You Get

There are a several things that a donation to the Frackin' Art Exhibit will support.

 

1)  We'd like to honor three of the entrants (chosen by the exhibit judges) with monetary prizes.  Ideally, we'd like to end up with a minimum of one $250, $150, and $100 cash prizes.

 

2)  We've already been lucky enough to have a local Oil City business negotiate a special arrangement to waive the entry fee ($25) for Oil City artists.  This business believes the Frackin’ Art Exhibit is an important forum for debate over an issue important everyone in Oil City. Their intent is to remove any financial barrier that might interfere with participation from any Oil City artists.  Wouldn't it be great to remove this barrier for all artists?  If enough money is raised, we can waive or lower the fee for everyone.

 

3) We'd love for this to turn into a dialog beyond the actual exhibit, and with enough support we can invite guest speakers/presenters to attend and cover any honorarium/travel fees that might be associated.

 

What do you get from supporting Frackin' Art?

 

In addition to our gratitude and showing your support for the arts, we have arranged some incentives for various giving levels.

 

$10 - A handwritten thank you card.

$25 - In addition to the above, recognition on our website and exhibit program.

$50 - In addition to the above, recognition on our Facebook page, and a exhibit program. 

$100 - In addition to the above, an invitation to a cocktail party with the exhibit curator, guest artists, and other donors (after the opening reception).

$500 - In addition to the above, lunch and/or a tour of Oil City with the exhibit curator. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford a donation?  You can always unleash your inner artist and join the dialog by submitting a piece of art.  Not artistic?  There are other ways you can help!  Spread the word by sharing this with others (both artists and potential funders), and if you are in the Oil City area, make sure you stop by to see the exhibit!

story:
So what's this all about?

My nephew, Liam, is severely autistic. It was a hard fact to face when he was diagnosed, but once that obstacle was overcome his family has been dilligently working on giving him a promising future. At 8 1/2 years old he is finally starting to communicate with his family. My sister and her family have been working hard to get him this far, he is finally starting to toilet train and he can - sort of - communicate what he needs. 

Liam struggles with unexplainable frustration due to his problems with communicating. He has fits, which thankfully have decreased both in frequency and duration. Despite what life has thrown him,  Liam is happy, sweet, affectionate, and very connected boy, especially with his brother Noah. 

Of course we all want more for him.  We want to hear him talk.  Really talk.  I can’t tell you how hard it is to see him upset or incredibly anxious trying to express his needs. More than anything, we all want him to have more options for his future than his current condition allows.  He has a great support team, and he has come a long way, but there’s still a long way to go.   

 Since Liam’s diagnosis at 3 ½ my sister and her family have tried many different avenues, from dietary changes (we’re all gluten-free), supplementations, B12 shots, autism conferences, etc. Some with great success, but all at a great cost. They have exhausted their resources entirely. 

What do i want and what do you get?

So this is where I come in. I have always wished I could financially assist my nephew and his family. We do what we can but we know it is not enough. What I do have a lot of on the other hand, is art. I had my art featured at a Universal Studios movie gallery this year, Snow White and The Huntsman. I have a statue in Vancouver Airport, one in the Burnaby Casino, and over 400 peices of artwork sold worldwide. 

So in addition to the warm-all-over glowy feeling that you will get from supporting my nephew, you will get the warm glowy feeling of making an excellent art purchase.

I am very much a commercial artist as well as an artsy one, so I am willing to work with YOU to make a custom piece for your home that you love.

I will be giving the proceeds to my sister's family to pay for special therapies, and training and support for Liam that the government can't/won't pay for. After I started this campaign, I got a call from my sister insisting that I don't produce the artwork out of pocket. I use part of the proceeds to pay for the artwork, shipping and some of my time. So the remainder will be going to Liam. 

 

The Impact

I am a roller derby player, derby designer, and artist, and mom. I feel like one of the luckiest people in the world to live the life I do. If I can somehow use my gifts to help my nephew have a better life, how unbelievably amazing that would be. And if you can help me to do that, you are also unbelievably amazing, and thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, believe me I understand. But please feel free to pass on this campaign, and spread the word. And otherwise if you can just put some healing thoughts out for Liam, I would appreciate it greatly. He can beat this, I see it in him. Thank you for taking the time to watch my campaign. 

 

Other Ways to find my work

http://www.derbyspotlight.com/blog_QnA_LucyDynamite.html

http://pinterest.com/missketo/

story:
Pre-Order Information

In an ideal world without the constraints of capitalism, we would handmake each book and give them as gifts to every single one of you. However, we are bound by a very very dismal budget. In an effort to make the book available to those who wish to own a copy, we have set up this pre-order page. 

 

How to order your personal copy

Please select the "GET PERK" option on this page.  Leave us your name & email, shipping address (if applicable), and payment to secure a copy. There are three options.

  1. UChicago pick-up ($19.00)
  2. Shipping within the US ($19.00 + $3.00 shipping)
  3. PDF of the book ($5)

We will send you a confirmation email requesting your pick-up/shipping/email details. All costs will go directly towards the production & shipping of books. 

 

When will I receive my book?

All handmade books will either be delivered over the summer (all shipped orders) or be available for pick-up beginning of fall quarter on the University of Chicago campus (all UChicago pick-up). Please be patient with us as we print, bind, and ship each individual gift-wrapped book along with a handwritten note of thanks. 

All PDF books will be sent to your e-mail by early June 2017.

 

Can I just give a donation? I love you guys.

Absolutely. We are making a whopping total of $0 from this project. Any additional funding would be more than welcome. Please indicate you are donating and would not like an actual copy of the book.

story:
Short Summary

Seattle’s 2000 ProParks Levy identified 2.5 acres at 2400 S Massachusetts St for development as a neighborhood park.  A park plan was generated in 2004 and an initial budget included grading, infrastructure improvements, lawn, pathways and two parking lots.  The improvements were completed in 2006.  Inspired by the music and legacy of Jimi Hendrix, a community led petition to name the park for this iconic Seattle native was supported by the Seattle City Council and approved by the Seattle Parks and Recreation Department.

Jimi Hendrix Park is located next to the Northwest African American Museum in Seattle’s vibrant Central District, a thriving multi-cultural community rich in heritage.  Friends of Jimi Hendrix Park, a dedicated group of community members and park users, and the Jimi Hendrix Park Foundation, have come together since 2009 to lead a public process that brings to life an open green space that will be welcoming and provides an experience that clearly defines its namesake.

The Friends of Jimi Hendrix Park's mission, is to guide community collaboration, create enthusiasm and lead a fundraising effort to accomplish the goal for completing improvements to the park that are sustainable, original and influenced by the artistry of Jimi Hendrix.

Community Involvement

Public brainstorming sessions to solicit community input for park improvements was conducted by consulting landscape architects, Murase Associates. Three conceptual designs emerged incorporating  popular ideas  that when combined with the legacy of rock legend Jimi Hendrix are imaginative, neighborhood friendly and create diverse use.  

The design process funded by the Department of Neighborhoods Large Project Matching Fund produced a preferred plan and design narrative in 2011 that was approved by the Seattle Parks and Recreation Department.  The design is bold, colorful and electrifying as the park’s namesake and transforms an empty grassy space into a multi-use location which includes:  

• Interpretative walkways

• Two rain gardens

• Central shelter and other picnic stations

• Sculptural seating shelters

• Enhanced landscaping

• Sound wave wall tribute

What We Need & What You Get

Following a year-long public design process, the Friends of Jimi Hendrix Park in partnership with the Jimi Hendrix Park Foundation, announced the launch of a capital fund-raising campaign to finance construction of the park that will celebrate the life, music and legend of Seattle’s hometown icon, James Marshall Hendrix.  The non-profit foundation, with the assistance of the Friends of Jimi Hendrix Park, aims to raise $1.5 million in private funding to supplement a $500,000 Seattle Parks and Recreation's Parks & Green Spaces Levy Opportunity Fund.

Now, we need your help to fund the iconic Sound Wave Wall in Jimi's image. Celebrating sound waves, the Sound Wave Wall is a curved colored steel wall with cut outs of notable figures of Jimi Hendrix performing. As the sun passes over the wall, people can walk past his long shadows.

The height of the wall will vary from 4’to 10’ high, and openings will be sited to allow for great views along the path, which connects Jimi Hendrix Park to Sam Smith Park, our gateway. The wall will be oriented for maximum visibility from the street. In addition to the large cut-outs, there will be perforations in the steel to allow for screened images and patterns to form when looked at from varying distances.

The Impact

The park is a hub that will strengthen the cultural pulse of the Emerald City as it creates a cohesive link between Sam Smith Park and the I-90 Trail, Colman Playground and the Seattle Children’s PlayGarden. Jimi Hendrix Park will become a community gathering space that reflects a musical theme with elements that present a variety of activities to include, walking, active sports, performance, environmental education and history. The development of the park will have global appeal and most importantly will attract citywide intergenerational use and provide wide interest for neighbors and school groups.

Because we are a volunteer organization, every dollar raised would go to the Park. We deeply appreciate your support.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions to the Jimi Hendrix Park Foundation are tax-deductible. For more information or to support the cause, visit www.jimihendrixparkfoundation.org.

or send a check payable to:

Jimi Hendrix Park Foundation

 P.O. Box 58152

Seattle, Washington 98138

 

Share this campaign! Please forward this to a friend, post it on your social media sites, and encourage others to contribute. Help us Create An Experience!

story:
The Gist!

  • My name is Dylan Holden. I am a freelance artist living in Los Angeles, CA. I have a passion for art ranging from the fine arts to animation. 
  • This campaign is important to me for a few reasons. One its face to face. It gets me out into the audience with the clients. I would be on the street sharing my time and my talent with real people, learning their names and..their birthdays. I'm feeling an urge to create a unique opportunity rather than seek out opportunities offered by larger sources. 
  • Not only would your contribution help make this possible in regards to literally being out there. It would also show me that there is more to be enjoyed through my art and that my talent can be less about me and more about the people. 

Giving and Receiving!

  • I felt 300 was the required amount I would need to fund this goal. 500 seems to be the minimum required to start a goal however. This would still overall benefit the project. I would be using funds to purchase materials (newsprint, markers, an easel, boombox/speakers for a more involved experience, street performance license, bus pass, business cards.)

      Goodies!

  • $10 will state your claim to a digital birthday sketch. This personal sketch would be delivered to you by e-mail.
  • $25 will state your claim to 2 digital birthday sketches. One for yourself and maybe a loved one? Also delivered by e-mail.
  • $100 will provide you with a black & white digital portrait of you in addition to 2 digital birthday sketches. All 3 delivered by e-mail in hi-res printable format. 
  • $200 will provide you with a full color digital portrait of you in addition to 2 digital birthday sketches. All 3 delivered by e-mail in hi-res printable format.
  • $300 Birthday Bananza: The big prize. Featuring the hand drawn original dragon sketch from the promo video, framed. Full color digital portrait of you in addition to 2 digital birthday sketches. Digital products delivered by e-mail, framed drawing by mail...unless you know of a faster way 0_0 !!!
  • Here is a link to my portraiture work to give you all rest that I will do my best to knock your socks off. http://www.dylanholden.com/

The Impact!

  • I feel this project is valuable to you because all of it is personal. Birthdays are personal as are our own faces. While I will benefit financially from this project if it takes off on the streets, my main hope is that those involved will take something home that means more to them than just any other sketch. It puts the artist (me :D) back in the streets and out of the office. I'm looking for people to relate to and share my heart with. Less screens and more friends. 
  • I have never used this platform before but I can already see the amount of trust required and thats what I'm looking for. There is a lot of fear in this world and I'm looking to push back against it and take a leap of faith into something out of my comfort zone. I hope you'll jump with me. 

Push and Plug the Gist

If you can't help monetarily I feel ya. Thats why I'm on here because money is thin these days. Even just sharing this goal would mean a lot to me. So post and plug away if that is within your grasp and its something you feel lead to do!

I would be on the street sharing my time and my talent with real people, learning their names and..their birthdays. I'm feeling an urge to create a unique opportunity rather than seek out opportunities offered by larger sources. 
Not only would your contribution help make this possible in regards to literally being out there. It would also show me that there is more to be enjoyed through my art and that my talent can be less about me and more about the people. 



Giving and Receiving!

I felt 300 was the required amount I would need to fund this goal. 500 seems to be the minimum required to start a goal however. This would still overall benefit the project. I would be using funds to purchase materials (newsprint, markers, an easel, boombox/speakers for a more involved experience, street performance license, bus pass, business cards.)

      Goodies!

$10 will state your claim to a digital birthday sketch. This personal sketch would be delivered to you by e-mail.
$25 will state your claim to 2 digital birthday sketches. One for yourself and maybe a loved one? Also delivered by e-mail.
$100 will provide you with a black & white digital portrait of you in addition to 2 digital birthday sketches. All 3 delivered by e-mail in hi-res printable format. 
$200 will provide you with a full color digital portrait of you in addition to 2 digital birthday sketches. All 3 delivered by e-mail in hi-res printable format.
$300 Birthday Bananza: The big prize. Featuring the hand drawn original dragon sketch from the promo video, framed. Full color digital portrait of you in addition to 2 digital birthday sketches. Digital products delivered by e-mail, framed drawing by mail...unless you know of a faster way 0_0 !!!
Here is a link to my portraiture work to give you all rest that I will do my best to knock your socks off. http://www.dylanholden.com/




The Impact!

I feel this project is valuable to you because all of it is personal. Birthdays are personal as are our own faces. While I will benefit financially from this project if it takes off on the streets, my main hope is that those involved will take something home that means more to them than just any other sketch. It puts the artist (me :D) back in the streets and out of the office. I'm looking for people to relate to and share my heart with. Less screens and more friends. 
I have never used this platform before but I can already see the amount of trust required and thats what I'm looking for. There is a lot of fear in this world and I'm looking to push back against it and take a leap of faith into something out of my comfort zone. I hope you'll jump with me. 



Push and Plug the Gist
If you can't help monetarily I feel ya. Thats why I'm on here because money is thin these days. Even just sharing this goal would mean a lot to me. So post and plug away if that is within your grasp and its something you feel lead to do!

story:
DIE MASSNAHME - BRECHT/EISLER        

Fast 300 Laien-SängerInnen mit Orchester und Schauspielern zeigen das Lehrstück "Die Maßnahme" zum ersten Mal seit den 30-er Jahren wieder in der umfassenden Besetzung, in der Brecht und Eisler es erarbeiteten und in der  die ArbeitersängerInnen-Bewegung es sang. 

Die Vorstellung findet am 8. April 2016 um 20 Uhr im Kammermusiksaal der Philharmonie statt. Karten gibt es an allen bekannten Vorverkaufsstellen.

Brecht und Eisler dachten nach Straßenschlachten im Blutmai 1929 über das Verhältnis von Ich und Wir nach. Ihr Weg nach einer "besseren Möglichkeit" zu fragen war damals skandalös und ist es bis heute.

„Die Maßnahme“ ist eine der bedeutendsten Kompositionen Eislers und der stärksten Stücke Brechts. Trotzdem ist das konkrete Kunstwerk fast vollständig in Vergessenheit geraten. Die ArbeitersängerInnen-Bewegung wurde zwischen 1933-45 vernichtet. Das Singen der Arbeiterlieder ist seit 2014 immaterielles Kulturerbe. "Die Maßnahme" ist eine künstlerische Weiterentwicklung dieser Lieder. 


SUCHE

Die Sachosten von „Die Maßnahme" sind zu einem großen Teil schon über Eintrittsgelder und eine Förderung durch die Rosa Luxemburg Stiftung abgedeckt. 

  1. Es fehlen 14.000 Euro:
  2. • Urheberrechtslizenzen Suhrkamp                               2800 Euro 
  3. • Miete für Endproben im Russischen Haus                  900 Euro
  4. • Miete für die Schlaginstrumente/Klavier                    900 Euro
  5. • 10 InstrumentalistInnen                                                  5600 Euro
  6. • Öffentlichkeitsarbeit                                                           600 Euro
  7. • Mitarbeit der Projektleitung u Abendspielleitung    550 Euro 
  8. • Leihgebühr für die Noten                                                1250 Euro
  9. • GebärdendolmetscherIn (Gebärdenchor)                   300 Euro

Im Fall dass darüber hinaus Einnahmen übrig bleiben bekommen die drei Hauptverantwortlichen ein Honorar. Die Eintrittspreise haben wir so gering wie möglich gehalten, um einen niedrig-schwelligen Zugang zu ermöglichen. 

Über den Link rechts auf dieser Seite werden Spenden direkt online eingereicht. 

Der Transfer funktioniert mit PayPal.

Wenn Sie kein PayPal Konto haben, gibt es die Möglichkeit auf folgendes Konto zu überweisen. 

Kontodaten:

Kontoinhaberin: Fabiane Kemmann

Kontoverwendungszweck: Die Maßnahme

IBAN: DE58 4306 0967 1156 0708 00

GLS Gemeinschaftsbank

Verwendungszweck: <, Name, emailadresse>

Auf Wunsch machen wir die Transaktion auf Indiegogo für Sie. Schreiben Sie Ihre Emailadresse und Ihren Namen in den Verwendungszweck - und zusätzlich `anonym` wenn Ihr Name nicht bei Indiegogo erscheinen soll - wenn Sie die Möglichkeit geben wollen, dass wir Sie kontaktieren.


LEST ES UND GEBT ES WEITER

Erzählen Sie Freunden, Verwandten, Bekannten, Kontakten von "Die Maßnahme",  linken Sie die Information. Kennen Sie Vereine, Stiftungen oder Gruppen, die an ähnlichen Inhalten arbeiten? Stellen Sie uns vor. Wenn Sie schreiben freuen wir uns wenn Sie über "Die Maßnahme" berichten. Auf unserer Internetseite erfahren Sie mehr über "Die Maßnahme".


KVV

CTS Eventim, an allen bekannten VVK-Kassen und über:

http://www.eventim.de/Tickets.html?affiliate=TUG&doc=artistPages%2Ftickets&fun=artist&action=tickets&erid=1622034&includeOnlybookable=true&xtmc=Die_Maßnahme&xtnp=1&xtcr=1


INHALT

Wozu sind wir zusammen und wie? Wie kommt eine Diskussion in Gang? "Die Maßnahme" ist kein Repertoiretheater im bekannten Sinne sondern eine Versuchsanordnung für Fragen - Übung sozialer Fantasie. Entlang der Figur des Jungen Genossen wird mit Ich-Stärke, Widerstand und kollektivem Handeln heute experimentiert. In den Fragen des Meisterwerks und Lehrstücks scheinen die Erfahrungen der Menschen im geteilten und wiedervereinten Berlin auf. Letztendlich geht es darum "nach einer besseren Möglichkeit" zu fragen.


INITIATIVE                           

Frühjahr 2013: Beginn der Inititiative zur ersten Wiederaufführung von "Die Maßnahme" in der ursprünglichen Form des Meisterwerks. 

2013-2015: Vorbereitung und Aufbau in diversen Skizzen mit Barbara Nicolier (die das Projekt einer Wiederaufführung ins Leben rief/künstlerische Begleitung), Fabiane Kemmann (szenische Leitung und Projektleitung), Marcus Crome (musikalischer Leiter). Seitdem ist die Initiative vielstimmig geworden.


Für Fragen stehen wir zur Verfügung.

Ihre

Initiative "Die Maßnahme"

story:
***UPDATE***


Thank you so much to all who have donated thus far! We want to give you the chance to be among the VERY FIRST to see our new store!

We will be hosting a sneak peek event the evening of Friday, October 16th for everyone who donates $250 or more to our campaign.

New donors, simply donate $250 or more and you'll be on the list. Already donated at that level? FANTASTIC! We'll be in touch with you with more details. 

Already donated to the campaign in an amount less than $250, but still want to attend the sneak peek? Simply make an additional contribution with the difference to bring your total to $250.

Remember, even if you are unable to donate $250 or more, every contribution is an enormous help and we still want to thank you for it. Any donation amount will grant you early access to our new store on the morning of Saturday, October 17th. 


A New Decade at Read
Between the Lynes

This past July, Read Between the Lynes celebrated our 10th year in business in the small but tight-knit community of Woodstock, IL. After the financial crisis hit bookstores everywhere hard, we're proud to not only still be here, but to be expanding in a larger location in October.


87 Steps Down the Street

Our new location is a historic storefront that has housed many well-loved local businesses over the years. We're excited to honor that history while adding our own spin on the future. We'll continue to serve:

  • Coffee
  • Ice cream
  • Candies
  • Specialty food products
All of which have been a popular part of the storefront for many years. But we remain at our heart a bookstore, and the larger location will allow us to expand our inventory in a number of areas, including:

  • A wider selection of books in the Children's and Young Adult sections
  • Children's products, including puppets and educational toys
  • Graphic Novels
  • Puzzles
  • Stationery and Journals
  • Local Woodstock souvenirs highlighting the history of being typewriter capital of the world


Keeping it Local

Read Between the Lynes is committed to a sense of community, and we strive to support other local businesses as much as possible. We source our coffee and ice cream locally, and both the Woodstock souvenirs and your perks are designed by Woodstock residents and their companies. For a number of years we have sold Jaci's Cookies in our store, and we will now be able to offer a storefront to even more local businesses, including farms like Prairie Pure Cheese that do not have regular hours or a central location.


A Truly Independent Bookstore

We love being a part of the community and giving back to it. Now we're asking for your help in return. Your faithful service and steady support (plus, your smiles!) have kept us open through the hardships of these past 10 years. Walk with us as we move into our next great adventure, and help us anchor the future of Read Between the Lynes as both a sustainable business and a vital heart of Woodstock on our beloved Square.

In order to make that happen, we need your involvement and investment. Although we are doing as much as possible to reduce costs, moving and expanding a bookstore is still expensive.  Will $65,000 cover it? Not even close. Our ultimate goal is to raise $200,000 over the course of 18 months to cover all moving costs, and keeping us from accruing future debt. This Indiegogo campaign will help with our initial costs so we can get our feet under us. The funds will go toward:

  • New inventory. We have all our awesome new products scheduled to arrive at the beginning of October.
  • Buildout. We're not building from scratch, but we still need to do some construction in order to install our bookcases and light fixtures.
  • Moving and storage of our bookcases. It may only be 87 steps from front door to front door, but our bookcases had to take an extended journey so they could stay safe during the transition time.
  • New computers and systems. Technology has come a long way in 10 years, and we need to upgrade and add more systems in order to adequately serve our customers.


What You Get

You get to know that you have been a part of creating a sustainable future for our store and enabling Read Between the Lynes to be a literary hub in Woodstock for years to come.

But as we mentioned earlier, we love giving back to you. You're not only helping us move to a new location, you're becoming a part of a wider "Book Movement."  As a thank you for believing in the value of reading, the importance of exchanging ideas, and the presence of an independent bookstore in Woodstock, we're offering you a number of perks.

  • Show that you're part of our Book Movement with a mug, tote, or t-shirt.
  • Enjoy some coffee on us.
  • Be the movement by hosting a book club.
***UPDATE***
T-shirts will be available in THREE different colors: black, white, or RBTL purple. All donors who select this perk will be contacted at the end of the campaign to select the size and color of their t-shirt.

Can't donate?

You are just as important a part of our Book Movement. Share this page with friends, family, and strangers via Facebook, Twitter, or word of mouth. Help us spread the word! Then, come visit us when we re-open in October. Tell us how you shared and we'll thank you just as profusely.

You are all a part of the Book Movement. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

Happy reading,
Arlene, Keith, Leslie, Shawn, & Rachel

You are just as important a part of our Book Movement. Share this page with friends, family, and strangers via Facebook, Twitter, or word of mouth. Help us spread the word! Then, come visit us when we re-open in October. Tell us how you shared and we'll thank you just as profusely.

story:
We are 22 ﬁnal year photography degree students; creative minds of various ages, backgrounds and styles. 2016 is our final of three years intense and rewarding study at UCS culminating in two degree exhibitions - one in Ipswich, Suffolk (where UCS is based) and one in Hoxton, east London which will be entirely funded by ourselves. The Ipswich show will also form part of the much-anticipated Photo East festival, thus increasing audience numbers for our work still further. 

These shows are critical to our chances of future success in what is a highly competitive field of the arts. We are producing innovative and thought-provoking work and now we need to show it to the world!

So, we humbly ask your help to raise £3000 in total which will cover gallery hire, catalogue production, advertising, transport, pa hire, packaging, refreshments and more. This will enable us to put on a London exhibition of the professional standards to which we aspire.

In return for donations we will give you a reward (known here as a 'perk') including postcards and hand made prints of your choice. 

Even if you can't donate, please do share this on social media and spread the word amongst friends and family. It all helps us!

Your donations are hugely appreciated - they will absolutely and positively influence the success of our future practice.

story:
About me

My name is Matt McNellan. I am a Seattle based graphic designer & illustrator. I have always had a passion for illustration, community, and the natural world. I graduated from Front Range Community College with an AA in Graphic Design in 2017. Ever Since I have been working with clients on creative projects. Presently, I am designing a piece of art that can be used as an operational deck of playing cards in hopes of bringing people together.

 

About the project

This project is going to be designed in efforts to help support King County Communities. 10% of the pledged money will be donated to Ballard Food Bank.  This organization helps bring food and hope to people in Seattle, because there can be enough for everyone. The reason that I chose this nonprofit organization is because I believe that supporting local food organizations is one of the solutions that can help us shape a better future. For more information on this nonprofit organization you can follow the link below.

www.ballardfoodbank.org 

I am designing an illustrative piece of art that can be used as an operational deck of playing cards with unique illustrations on each card. I like the idea of creating artwork that can be used for something practical, and helps bring people together. This project falls in line with the many goals I have for the future as a graphic designer & illustrator. I create all of my artwork with passion and purpose in hopes that it inspires others to follow their dreams and come together to help make a better world.

These playing cards have 3 themes

• The 4 Seasons, each season has been matched with a suit in the card deck

• Day / Night which correspond with black or red cards

• The natural world which is represented in the illustrations of Plants & Animals

Reaching the goal

This project has a goal of $1000. This goal is a rough estimate of what it will cost me to produce and distribute these card decks. 10% of all the pledged money with be donated to Ballard Food Bank, a nonprofit organization that helps bring food to people in need. 

I have set that goal in hopes of raising funding for this organization and to cover the costs that come with making this project into a reality. There are also plenty of things that won't cost me any money but will require a lot of donated time and high attention to detail. There will be a lot of hours spent on planning and drafting this project, designing the cards and box, as well as doing research about different topics involved. 

Here are a few things that I have to consider when taking on a project like this:

• Printing costs 

• Shipping costs (I can ship anywhere in the USA)

• Which printing companies are the most eco friendly (what materials they use & practices) 

• How long will this project take to complete (putting time into designing, printing, shipping)

• How can this project bring people together and give back to the community

• Can I do this all by myself or will I need help from other people 

• What are some of the problems that I might I encounter along the way 

 If this project exceeds its goal of $1000 then the money will be used to print more copies of the deck and a second version of the deck may be considered for the future.

 Your support helps produce these card decks and helps bring people together!

This final project will be featured in my portfolio which can be found here

Updates can be found on my instagram account here

Risks and challenges

Every project comes with risks and challenges. This project may have unforeseen challenges that I am not even thinking about. Here are the challenges that I know I will have to overcome divided into 3 categories:

Printing challenges 
• Which printing companies are the most eco friendly (what materials they use & practices) 
• Which printing companies will have the best price for the number of decks I am making 
• Estimating how many decks I will need to print 
• Time estimating, how long will I need to budget in order to meet the deadline

Shipping challenges 
• Finding out which shipping company will have the best price 
• Time estimating, how long will i need to budget in order to meet the deadline 
• Taking the time to box & ship

Design challenges 
• File Management 
• Drafting & conceptualizing design ideas 
• Designing a system for these playing cards that adheres to the theme 
• Designing each card 
• Designing the box
story_txt:
About me
My name is Matt McNellan. I am a Seattle based graphic designer & illustrator. I have always had a passion for illustration, community, and the natural world. I graduated from Front Range Community College with an AA in Graphic Design in 2017. Ever Since I have been working with clients on creative projects. Presently, I am designing a piece of art that can be used as an operational deck of playing cards in hopes of bringing people together.
 
About the project
This project is going to be designed in efforts to help support King County Communities. 10% of the pledged money will be donated to Ballard Food Bank.  This organization helps bring food and hope to people in Seattle, because there can be enough for everyone. The reason that I chose this nonprofit organization is because I believe that supporting local food organizations is one of the solutions that can help us shape a better future. For more information on this nonprofit organization you can follow the link below.
www.ballardfoodbank.org 
I am designing an illustrative piece of art that can be used as an operational deck of playing cards with unique illustrations on each card. I like the idea of creating artwork that can be used for something practical, and helps bring people together. This project falls in line with the many goals I have for the future as a graphic designer & illustrator. I create all of my artwork with passion and purpose in hopes that it inspires others to follow their dreams and come together to help make a better world.
These playing cards have 3 themes
• The 4 Seasons, each season has been matched with a suit in the card deck
• Day / Night which correspond with black or red cards
• The natural world which is represented in the illustrations of Plants & Animals
Reaching the goal
This project has a goal of $1000. This goal is a rough estimate of what it will cost me to produce and distribute these card decks. 10% of all the pledged money with be donated to Ballard Food Bank, a nonprofit organization that helps bring food to people in need. 
I have set that goal in hopes of raising funding for this organization and to cover the costs that come with making this project into a reality. There are also plenty of things that won't cost me any money but will require a lot of donated time and high attention to detail. There will be a lot of hours spent on planning and drafting this project, designing the cards and box, as well as doing research about different topics involved. 
Here are a few things that I have to consider when taking on a project like this:
• Printing costs 
• Shipping costs (I can ship anywhere in the USA)
• Which printing companies are the most eco friendly (what materials they use & practices) 
• How long will this project take to complete (putting time into designing, printing, shipping)
• How can this project bring people together and give back to the community
• Can I do this all by myself or will I need help from other people 
• What are some of the problems that I might I encounter along the way 
 If this project exceeds its goal of $1000 then the money will be used to print more copies of the deck and a second version of the deck may be considered for the future.
 Your support helps produce these card decks and helps bring people together!
This final project will be featured in my portfolio which can be found here
Updates can be found on my instagram account here
Risks and challenges
Every project comes with risks and challenges. This project may have unforeseen challenges that I am not even thinking about. Here are the challenges that I know I will have to overcome divided into 3 categories:
Printing challenges • Which printing companies are the most eco friendly (what materials they use & practices) • Which printing companies will have the best price for the number of decks I am making • Estimating how many decks I will need to print • Time estimating, how long will I need to budget in order to meet the deadline
Shipping challenges • Finding out which shipping company will have the best price • Time estimating, how long will i need to budget in order to meet the deadline • Taking the time to box & ship
Design challenges • File Management • Drafting & conceptualizing design ideas • Designing a system for these playing cards that adheres to the theme • Designing each card • Designing the box

story:
Black/Inside, past and future

Currently almost a million black people are locked up in prisons and jails across the U.S. Millions more are under some form of correctional supervision. How did we get here? Is it possible to reverse course?

Understanding the history of black criminalization & incarceration in the U.S. is critical to answering these and other questions. Black/Inside: A History of Captivity & Confinement in the U.S.c onsiders how a system of criminalizing & imprisoning Black men and women has been sustained from colonial times to the present. The exhibition illustrates the historical roots of black confinement and provides insights into how the U.S. became a Prison Nation, detaining & incarcerating over 2.3 million people.

Black/Inside features original vintage photographs and postcards of black prisoners on chain gangs, black activists who used jail-ins during the civil rights movement to demand change and justice, newspaper articles exposing the brutality of the convict lease system, artifacts from black political prisoners like George Jackson and Angela Davis, artifacts from prison uprisings like Attica and much more…


See our blog and project site here. Listen to public radio rave about us. And check out some of the other work created by Project NIA.


We recently took the exhibit down after a very popular run that was extended by a month based on popular demand. And now...

We need you to help us take Black/Inside on the road!

We have been overwhelmed with support and attention for this exhibit, and several groups already want us to bring the exhibit to them. However, we've done everything on a shoestring with many, many hours of volunteer labor and donated materials. Most of the collection comes from Mariame Kaba's personal archive, which she has painstakingly compiled over the years.

We need funds to turn this show into something that can travel while preserving its rare archival contents. We also need cash to help transport the show to its next location - and hopefully to the next, and the next. Every dime you donate will go to something immediate and practical, not staffing, overhead, or paperwork.


Keeping Black/Inside alive and traveling supports our larger goal of helping to take the movement against mass incarceration to the next level. We believe that our lack of historical perspective about the origins of mass incarceration limits our ability to develop viable solutions. We hope to engage youth and adults to consider the root causes and impacts of the criminal legal system and mass incarceration on the lives of black people. Ultimately, we want to mobilize a new generation of activists and organizers to work towards dismantling the prison industrial complex.

What else you can do

Want Black/Inside to come to your city, town, community center, or school? Well, first spread the word about this fundraiser (unless you've got a grant in your back pocket...), and then contact us immediately! We'd love to work with you.

story:
Short Summary

Hi!

My name is Jenna Moran (author of the Nobilis RPG, the Hitherby Dragons web serial, An Unclean Legacy, Fable of the Swan, the Invasion picture book illustrated by Elizabeth Sherry, and a lot of miscellaneous RPG-type stuff) and I've written a new trilogy:

  • Enemies Endure, Book I: Stomping the World Round
  • Enemies Endure, Book II: The Storm that Saw Itself
  • Enemies Endure, Book III: Vidar's Boot

I'm serializing the completed draft on http://books.hitherby.com.

I'm looking to do four more things with this and I need your help with them:

  • obtain professional editing services
  • fund cover art for the books
  • cover the site cost and miscellaneous expenses
  • obtain Tony Damiani's beautiful and thematic website art for http://books.hitherby.com for the remainder of the books' run.

I'll be releasing a print-on-demand version as well, which sponsors at the $15+ level will be able to pick up at cost.

 

Current Goal! Covers by award-winning art nouveau artist Echo Chernik. She's worked on campaigns and promotion for Disney, BBC America, Camel Cigarettes, the Miller Brewing Company, Keystone, the State of Illinois, Sears, and Arlo Guthrie, and more; not to mention contributing to Shadowrun, books for Penguin, Random House, and Llewellyn Worldwide, and creating at least one poster alluring enough to tempt even ordinary, God-fearing citizens into the wicked abyss of theft.

More importantly, . . . look. I missed my window to commission covers from Alphonse Mucha. I was born tragically too late. But she's a worthy successor to the art nouveau style; she makes cupcake Cthulhu illustrations on the side . . .

And she's in for the three covers of the Enemies Endure series if you can help us get there!

 

What You're Contributing

Here's a little more about where the funds are going. The first $8000 has paid for this:

  • Neall Price, editor for Nobilis: the Essentials, has agreed to edit the three novels.
  • Anthony Damiani, artist, will be providing art for the website serialization over the course of 2012 and 2013.
  • I'll be covering various miscellaneous expenses (site costs, paypal costs, fulfillment costs for the postcard thing, and indiegogo costs).
  • Echo Chernik is doing covers for two of these books.
  • I have a small fund set aside for cover art for the third book.
 
Funds from $8,000 to $8,800 . . . will go to bulking up my fund for the third cover, site expenses, and unexpected expenses!
 
What if we land between $8,800 and $9,500? . . . this is where I'll be focused on a little extra polish on the short story collection, the site, little things like that.
 
What if we land between $9,500 and $10,000? . . . this is where I'll be focused on a nice omnibus edition, a cool artbook with the site art from books.hitherby.com, seeing about planning for covers for the imago.hitherby.com story collections I want to do someday, and the like! 
 
What if we land between $10,000 and $11,000? . . . eek! That's such a hard place to know what happens! A single unexpected expense in here could change everything! See, around $10,100 I can afford a third Echo Chernik cover if there are no unplanned costs. But will I actually be able to do that? What if the people who got me here actually wanted that extra polish that I mentioned previously? What if there's an extra expense? I don't know what I'm doing! Something! Something that will help you! But I don't know what and so I'm not promising anything in PARTICULAR that I haven't already promised. ^_^
 
What about $11,000? . . . bam! A third Echo Chernik cover. Everything is pretty groovy for me at that point. Total success and all is sweet. ^_^
 
What if we land between $11,000 and $12,000? . . . three Echo Chernik covers, plus extra stuff.
 
What about $12,000+? I've completed my goals for the project, put together a few extras, and I can use any dollars after this to pay myself a little! Then a little more for my artists and helpers. Then a bit more for me. And so forth!
 

What You Get

What you get is an amazing series of books.

Even without contributing, you'll get:

  • Access to the illustrated, unedited version of this story as serialized on books.hitherby.com over the course of 2012, 2013, and possibly early 2014.

 

At the $5 level: . . . 3 books!

  • Stomping the World Round (ePub, mobi, PDF)
  • My previous novel, An Unclean Legacy (ePub, mobi, PDF) and
  • My never-before-released short novel, Jack o'Lantern Girl (ePub, mobi, PDF)

 

At the $7 level: . . . 4 books plus!

  • Stomping the World Round (ePub, mobi, PDF)
  • The Storm that Saw Itself (ePub, mobi, PDF)
  • A small collection of my existing short stories (ePub, mobi, PDF)
  • Four short stories, original to this project, purchased by our donors. (ePub, mobi, PDF) 
  • My previous novel, An Unclean Legacy (ePub, mobi, PDF) and
  • My never-before-released short novel, Jack o'Lantern Girl (ePub, mobi, PDF)

 

At the $9 level: . . . 6 books plus!

  • Stomping the World Round (ePub, mobi, PDF)
  • The Storm that Saw Itself (ePub, mobi, PDF)
  • Vidar's Boot (ePub, mobi, PDF)
  • A small collection of my existing short stories (ePub, mobi, PDF)
  • Four short stories, original to this project, purchased by our donors. (ePub, mobi, PDF) 
  • My previous novel, An Unclean Legacy (ePub, mobi, PDF)
  • My previous novel, Fable of the Swan (ePub, mobi, PDF) and
  • My never-before-released short novel, Jack o'Lantern Girl (ePub, mobi, PDF)

 

At the $15 level, in addition to all of the above, you'll be listed on the website as one of the project's sponsors and you'll have the option to purchase the print-on-demand release at cost. Plus, under the conditions mentioned below, you'll get a postcard

 

The Impact

Listen. I want to tell a story. Not this story exactly---this is a pretty weird sidetrack to that story---but I want to tell the story that people are good.

I need help to do that. I need . . . well, I need visibility.

Probably writing novels and RPGs isn't the best way to spread this message, but you've got to do what you love, even if it's not a good idea.

So please, whether you can contribute or not, help me get the word out about this project!

 

New Reward!

Strange Encounters.

I can't write you into the book itself, since it's written and can be a pretty scary place anyway, but your Lethal Magnet Professor certainly can have an interesting or perplexing encounter with an extremely sharp goat, Jane, Martin, or, well, whatever! Perhaps this is a cartoon and caption. Perhaps it is a few paragraphs of story. A bit of slice of life, in short, of your avatar in this world.

If a bunch of these sell, I'll make them a *thing,* with a new one appearing each month, and with the sidebar link going to the latest instead of to a sponsor. If not many sell, maybe I'll just expand your bit of the sponsors page. We'll see!

If you want this reward but don't want to give up an existing perk, just talk to me; our short story purchasers will be able to obtain this at their request, and arranging for a strange encounter with our Dean is on my task list. ^_^


 

Stretch Goals!

Let's get this party started. ^_^

$3000: Achieved!
 
We got to $3000! I’ll start planning the print-on-demand release of these books with the intention of making them available at cost to Sponsors ($15+ contributors) and at a reasonable cost to other donors and the general public.
 
 
$3500: Achieved!

We got to $3500! I’ll add a small collection of short stories—-existing work, but not previously available from me in an organized, edited ePub form—-to the rewards at the $7+ level. I’ll assemble them, get them edited, get a simple cover for them, and bundle them in. ^_^

 

$4000: Achieved!

We got to $4000! I'm adding the electronic version of my novel An Unclean Legacy to the rewards at the $5+ level.

What is An Unclean Legacy?

It's a fairy tale about an enchanted princess, a deathless sorcerer, a fallen knight, a man of God, a bad house, a soulless girl, the Devil's child, a madman, a witch, and Santa Claus. It's a story of redemption.

I hesitated about this because I bet a lot of my contributors have already read An Unclean Legacy. It's been out for a while and it's recently been on sale.

But I'm so proud of this book. I have to include this at some stretch goal!

 

$4500: Achieved!

We got to $4500! I'm adding the electronic version of my latest novel Fable of the Swan to the rewards at the $9+ level.

Fable of the Swan is a young adult fantasy novel with surrealist overtones. I think it's pretty cool but it was written this year so I don't have an objective opinion on it yet. ^_^

 

$5000: Achieved!

This is exciting!

So, listen. Listen. Listen. A while back I started on what was going to be my happiest and best project ever, a series of "Hitherby Dragons" novels, not related stories like Enemies Endure but the heart of the thing; only the publisher I was working with flaked hard and the artist I was working with flaked hard and suddenly I was sitting there holding one and a half of the favorite books of mine I've ever written and nothing to do with it.

And 'cause I'm pretty easy to throw into despair; and because it's a short novel and not a full novel and so hard to throw into regular publication channels; and because pulling together my current RPG project is the most genuinely incredible amount of work I've ever had to do on anything, I wound up just kind of sitting on this thing.

But you guys have restored my faith.

I love you all, and you have given me some faith here, so I'll tell you what. We hit $5000, so . . .
 
I'm going to release that first short novel, Jack o'Lantern Girl, and introduce people who maybe aren't so much into reading fiction blogs to the story of Hitherby Dragons; and tell those of you who are into reading fiction blogs a lot more about what happened on the firewood world; and move finishing the second book, Firewood Boy, up a lot higher on my priority queue;

And, of course, include Jack o'Lantern Girl in the list of books available at the $5 level plus.

 

$5200: Achieved!

Sample of Echo's art - not an actual cover for this project!

And now . . .

It looks like Echo Chernik is available to do the covers for these books! At this level I can afford to bring her in for the first such cover.

Details pending!

IT IS ACTUALLY HAPPENING SQUEEEEE

Update! Details still pending but she has like double-extra confirmed.

 
$7000: Achieved!
 
 
Postcards! Postcards postcards postcards!
 
Thanks to our generous donors, it's time for the Lethal Magnet Professors and staff to step up to the plate and mentor some of the students from this school!
 
This is the level where:
  • if you've donated $15+;
  • are in the continental U.S.;
  • are interested and can get me an address and stuff,

you'll receive your very own postcard from one of the students attending or interested in attending the Lethal Magnet School for Wayward Youth and looking for your wise advice! Or, at the $15 level or if you just prefer it, a cheerful postcard thank you note from me!

I am told that the postcard that Martin sent a collaborator of mine in the States is quite a fine thing, so I'm looking forward to these. ^_^


$8000: Achieved!

This is just a sample, but . . .

. . . at this level I can get covers from Echo Chernik for two of these books. That's a weird stretch goal so I reserve the right to adjust this a little, including bumping up the numbers if I add a stretch goal with costly fulfillment in here somewhere. ^_^

 

$11,000: Coming Soon?


OMG OMG OMG we are almost there!

Sample

And at this level I can have Echo Chernik do the covers for all three volumes of Enemies Endure. (Again I might bump this up a bit if I add a stretch goal with costly fulfillment before this point.)

 

A final example of her art.

 

$12,000: Pending

If there's an omnibus edition or an art book with the art from the website then I want to make the print-on-demand available at cost to sponsors who've paid $15+. And if there's an ePub I want to send it to them.

At this point I can guarantee that at least one of these things will exist.

I don't expect this to excite you. But it excites ME, and this is actually the first level where I can completely guarantee it. ^_^ So I'm listing it as the ULTIMATE STRETCH GOAL.

Can we get here? That's 50 hours for another $4,000 from a 28-day $8000 start! I love you all.

$5000: Achieved!This is exciting!
So, listen. Listen. Listen. A while back I started on what was going to be my happiest and best project ever, a series of "Hitherby Dragons" novels, not related stories like Enemies Endure but the heart of the thing; only the publisher I was working with flaked hard and the artist I was working with flaked hard and suddenly I was sitting there holding one and a half of the favorite books of mine I've ever written and nothing to do with it.
And 'cause I'm pretty easy to throw into despair; and because it's a short novel and not a full novel and so hard to throw into regular publication channels; and because pulling together my current RPG project is the most genuinely incredible amount of work I've ever had to do on anything, I wound up just kind of sitting on this thing.
But you guys have restored my faith.
I love you all, and you have given me some faith here, so I'll tell you what. We hit $5000, so . . .
 
I'm going to release that first short novel, Jack o'Lantern Girl, and introduce people who maybe aren't so much into reading fiction blogs to the story of Hitherby Dragons; and tell those of you who are into reading fiction blogs a lot more about what happened on the firewood world; and move finishing the second book, Firewood Boy, up a lot higher on my priority queue;
And, of course, include Jack o'Lantern Girl in the list of books available at the $5 level plus.
 
$5200: Achieved!



Sample of Echo's art - not an actual cover for this project!
And now . . .
It looks like Echo Chernik is available to do the covers for these books! At this level I can afford to bring her in for the first such cover.
Details pending!
IT IS ACTUALLY HAPPENING SQUEEEEE
Update! Details still pending but she has like double-extra confirmed.

 
$7000: Achieved!
 
 
Postcards! Postcards postcards postcards!
 
Thanks to our generous donors, it's time for the Lethal Magnet Professors and staff to step up to the plate and mentor some of the students from this school!
 
This is the level where:


if you've donated $15+;
are in the continental U.S.;
are interested and can get me an address and stuff,


you'll receive your very own postcard from one of the students attending or interested in attending the Lethal Magnet School for Wayward Youth and looking for your wise advice! Or, at the $15 level or if you just prefer it, a cheerful postcard thank you note from me!
I am told that the postcard that Martin sent a collaborator of mine in the States is quite a fine thing, so I'm looking forward to these. ^_^

$8000: Achieved!

This is just a sample, but . . .
. . . at this level I can get covers from Echo Chernik for two of these books. That's a weird stretch goal so I reserve the right to adjust this a little, including bumping up the numbers if I add a stretch goal with costly fulfillment in here somewhere. ^_^
 
$11,000: Coming Soon?
OMG OMG OMG we are almost there!

Sample
And at this level I can have Echo Chernik do the covers for all three volumes of Enemies Endure. (Again I might bump this up a bit if I add a stretch goal with costly fulfillment before this point.)
 

A final example of her art.
 
$12,000: Pending
If there's an omnibus edition or an art book with the art from the website then I want to make the print-on-demand available at cost to sponsors who've paid $15+. And if there's an ePub I want to send it to them.
At this point I can guarantee that at least one of these things will exist.
I don't expect this to excite you. But it excites ME, and this is actually the first level where I can completely guarantee it. ^_^ So I'm listing it as the ULTIMATE STRETCH GOAL.
Can we get here? That's 50 hours for another $4,000 from a 28-day $8000 start! I love you all.

story:
20 years of Backjumps  -Festival of urban communication in Berlin!

Backjumps, the platform for urban communication and aesthetics, turns 20 this year. We want to celebrate this awesome anniversary with you by throwing an truly unique festival in Berlin and for Berlin! 


Our plan: We want to invite as many artists from all over the world to Berlin, create a great variety of workshops, tours and art exhibitions - and thus present a unique mix and showing which is free and accessible to anyone. 

We need your support to organize 20 years of Backjumps - Festival of urban communication in Berlin!


What is Backjumps?

"What started out as a fanzine covering the aerosol painting scene went on to become - through "The Live Issue" - the reference point for group exhibitions, covering the art that we see all around our cities.


Adrian Nabi has been at the genesis of this project. He is more than just a street art trendsetter: by bringing influential artists like Banksy, Os Gemeos or Shepard Fairey to Berlin, his shows and exhibitions became milestones in the ever-evolving urban communications scene.


Backjumps is an indoor, outdoor and interactive event, spanning the connections between visual art, digital and interactive installations, as well as performance art in the form of dance for example. Artwork has been produced within gallery walls as well as chosen sites in the surrounding neighborhood of Kreuzberg.

Though he may have been shunned and overlooked by the players who jumped on the bandwagon, you can ask anybody in the who's who of the scene and they will confirm the importance and relevance that Backjumps has had. The Kunstraum Kreuzberg, in the heart of Berlin, has been the venue for all of the six Live Issue events from 2003 until 2012 as well as a special Tokyo installment in 2005, which Adrian curated in celebration of the year of German culture.

Here are just some of the prominent names which have been part of either the magazine, subsequent fanzine or of the group shows:

Banksy, Blu, Brad Downey, Delta, Futura, Jay One, JR, Henry Chalfant, Martha Cooper, NUG & Pike, Os Gemeos, Rammellzee, Shepard Fairey, Skki, Swoon, Zevs

These are just some of the more well known names, though there are obviously many more from Berlin, Europe, and the rest of the world." 

--- Mode2, 2014

What is going to happen?

There will be a 8 week art show from 30th of august until 26th of october at Kunstraum Kreuzberg/Bethanien.


Invited artists include:


Since we celebrate the 20th anniversary, we will also take the chance to take a unique look back on the past years and shows by featuring selected pieces and stories from the extensive Backsjumps archive.


Next to the major exhibition at the Kustraum Kreuzberg/Bethanien,we have ample plans for more events, workshops, exhibitions, screenings, performance art we want to bring to the streets of Berlin - and they can only be realised with your help!


What you will support!

Our goal is to create a never seen before festival celebrating the art of urban communication which will be free for anybody. We will need your support for the following events and actions:


1. More space for more artists

We have a multitude of great artists on our invitation list, but to actually show all them, we will need more space. This includes:

  •  actions outside on the streets of Kreuzberg as well as 
  • showcases inside exhibition spaces 
  • workshops, performances, panels, etc.


You will help us finance the rent, gallery attendants and travel/accommodation/material for the artists.

2. Screening of Stylewars 1&2



We want to invite you to a screening of Stylewars, the iconic documentary of New York street culture and subway art, and - as a Berlin premiere - Stylewars 2 in an open air cinema next to Kunstraum Kreuzberg/Bethanien. We also aim to bring the directors of Stylewars 2, Veli and Amos, to Berlin for a panel discussion. 


You will help us to cover the rent for the cinema and travel/accomodation for the directors.


3. Ghetto Wrestling 3


We want to organize the next round of the glorious "Ghetto Wrestling" event by Flavie Guerrand and Dave the Chimp. The motto is: “Catch Ghetto Wrestling is about Fun, not Fighting”. Carnival-like, the participants create their own characters with costumes, a profile, signature moves and their own charisma in the ring in their attempt to win the hearts of the crowd.


You will support us with renting the venue, supplying loud music and a great atmosphere for a truly unforgettable show.

4. Exhibition catalogue

And last but not least we want to print a catalogue accompanying documenting the main exhibitions for everyone to keep as a memory. 


Your support will cover the printing costs.

5. Mural paintings in Berlin city



For Backjumps it has always been important to communicate on the streets as well. As part of „The Live Issues“ 2005 and 2007 Backjumps a set of murals (like the above "Astronaut" by Victor Ash) in Kreuzberg which by now have become internationally well-known landmarks of the city. For the 20th anniversary we would like to again invite artists to paint murals on house facades in the city of Berlin and create more iconiclandmarks.

 
You will support the financing of the equipment/construction needed to paint the walls.

6. Junior Lab

The great and fun and successful experience with „The Junior Issues“ in the last 3 years motivated us to found the JUNIOR LAB - an experimental workshop for kids and young people to work with artists on the topics of urban reality and life in cities by enabling them to learn new artistic expressions and develop the thought of „Do it Yourself“.

You will support rent of the workshop space and working materials.


What we have for you!

We went through the extensive Backjumps archive and put together a nice selection of prints, collectibles, posters, magazines or DVDs featuring work from artists like Mode2, Wermke/Leinkauf, Dave the Chimp,The Wa, Amok and others. You can find images of the items below.


+++ PLS CHECK THE GALLERY FOR HIGH RES IMAGES OF THE PERKS+++

+++ PLS MAKE SURE, YOU ADD THE RIGHT SHIPPING COSTS 

        (SEE FAQ BELOW) MANUALLY TO YOUR ORDER, TOO+++



+++PLS CHECK THE GALLERY FOR HIGH RES IMAGES OF THE PERKS+++


FAQs

How do I pay my shipping costs?

When you have selected a perk, please manually increase the amount according to the shipping costs for your country:

1. Shipping & handling within Germany, please add: 7 Euro 

2. Shipping & handling within the EU, please add: 10 Euro

3. Shipping & handling  world wide, please add: 17 Euro


If you raise more than you need, what will you do with the money?

As you may have noticed, the amount of money is calculated quite optimistic for the scope we plan to present. For now, we have only calculated a base plan of activities to make things happen. Simply put: More money means more projects and an even greater festival. We would for example invest any additional budget into a color print of the catalogue or paint more murals. The motto thus is: The more you give us, the more we can make happen!


Can I pick more than one perk?

Yes, of course! But you must pay for them separately so that we can keep track of what you chose.


Can I contribute more money when I select a particular package?

Yes, if you chose a perk that is €100 and you want to donate €150, just enter the number manually upon checkout. A virtual high five from our side will be your guaranteed reward!


If I don't want a perk, can I still contribute?

Sure, just click on the "contribute" button, enter the sum you want to donate and choose "No perk, I just want to donate". Two virtual high fives (left and right!) and our eternal gratitude will be your reward!


Can I help without donating?

If you can not or do not want to give us money, there are still ways to support us. Spread the word, share the video and the link to the crowdfunding campaign with your friends. Via Facebook, Twitter, Email and a phone call to your grandma. Let as many people as possible know about the project and help us organize a great festival. Thank you in advance!


Contact:

m.gerstemann@backjumps.info

Click here to reach the homepages of Backjumps and theKunstraum Kreuzberg/Bethanien as well as theFacebook page of Backjumps.

story:
Around Town: Native American Art Show

For the third year in a row, the Lander Art Center and local Native American artists are teaming up for a unique exhibit showcasing Native American art works. This is the only show of its kind, featuring Native artists in multiple disciplines in multiple locations Around Town. We need your help for this show to succeed. 

Contributions will help us provide catering for the opening, cover film screening fees, offer prizes to artists, help with shipping and promotion. Your support helps honor the important contribution of Native artists in our community. 


What We Need:

We need $1,000 for prize money, $400 for catering, $300 for film screening fees, $300 for promotion, $500 for hanging and artist expenses. 

If we don't reach our entire funding goal, we will still benefit from whatever we raise. If we can offer catering for the opening and not prize money for artists, that is ok too!

The Impact

Last year, the audience for Around Town tripled. This show gives Native artists important visibility in our community. Breaking new ground this year, we are also showcasing performance artists with a live show of spoken word, hip hop, poetry and dance. We hope to highlight Native American film makers with a special film screening. 

Around Town runs November 6th  through December 19th at the Lander Art Center and the Middle Fork Restaurant in Lander, WY.

Art Opening, November 6, 6 pm @ the Lander Art Center & the Middle Fork. 

Performance Art Opening, November 6,  7:30 @ the Middle Fork. 

The Lander Art Center is honored to showcase these artists’ work and be a part of a national recognition of the first Americans during Native American Heritage Month.

Other Ways You Can Help (if you can't donate)

Share the word about Around Town. Help post flyers. Drop by the Lander Art Center to volunteer for the show. Invite your friends to see Around Town. Attend the opening.

story:
Hello!

Hi there! We're illustration students at Edinburgh College of Art trying to find a way to the D&AD New Blood Exhibition in London. Our final year is coming to an end and we are hard at work making stuff we are both excited by and very proud of, and we want to share it with the world! Take a look at our profiles if you want to find out more about our work.

                                                           


By funding this campaign you are transporting 8 of us from cold windy Edinburgh to warm smokey London, and allowing us to exhibit at D&AD 2015. Your contribution will directly go towards the cost of exhibiting. 
It breaks down like this -

  • Exhibition fees
  • Transportation of us & our work
  • Printing and presentation costs
There's a lot of people exhibiting at D&AD, and we want to stand out! It's an amazing opportunity for us as illustrators to get noticed by the big dogs. It costs a surprising amount to print, frame and mount work appropriately and it's a lot of money for a little group of students to raise!

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Keep people in the loop! We will be eternally grateful. 

thanks 

the illustrators 

 x

story:
The Show

My name is Alice Walter and having graduated from the University of Brighton this year studying Fine Art Painting, I made it onto Airspace Gallery's six month graduate residency scheme. It ends in January with a culminating solo show - an invaluable opportunity to realise my work in a really interesting, large space and also as part of a professional gallery setting. To make the show clear and professional I need help covering costs for preparing the exhibition - so for printing a written art piece, framing paintings that are on clay and then making backings, supports and structures for various works as they are considered spatially in the space. In return for your support I am offering pieces of my work as well as other rewards.

My Work

In my work I want to articulate the sensible but that which seems non-sensible within a system of language. Like a weird dream or the way a thought is formed, the inescapably sentimental, bruised or strange is not glossed over, and neither is the seeming dumbness of honesty or humour or that which can be too quiet to seem exciting. The vague suggestions and connotations in each work seek to act as pathways in which I hope conjure a different way of seeing, or an understanding that different ways of seeing can be pursued in the medium of painting, or painting even as solely a mindset.

Rewards

Below are specific images of the current rewards and the amounts I am offering them for, though feel free to donate how ever much you wish; I'll also be updating this page over the following 20 days that this campaign is running with updated rewards that I have to offer.

  £5.00 

 A postcard of my work along with a signed invite to the private view on the back of a reproduced drawing. (This reward is included in all of the other amounts donated, see below)

                               

£10

A signed copy of written work to be included in the show. ALSO, A little drawing. 

                                                                          

             

£20

A 'cafédrawing' PLUS a free tea/ coffee with a full English breakfast courtesy of Café Retreat, Hanley, Stoke-on-Trent- so it's Stokies only for that one I'm afraid. Also, there's ONLY ONE OF THESE!

                                   


OR 

A different drawing.

                                         

                               

                                                           

                                       


                                              

                                 

 


                                           



£30

A professionally printed photograph.

                                                

OR a small painted work on paper,

                                                          (left: actual size)

                                       

     

                                             

                                

£50-£150

A selection of oil paintings variable in size.
