story:
And 'Live from The Workshop':

New Video!

Day 23:  Working on the Dragon....


More videos can be found in The Gallery


Day 23:  The carving and Finessing of the Figurehead 


The ash has been a hard piece of wood to master, but you can now see shapes emerging and the dragon coming through.

See 'The Gallery' at the top for more boat progress pictures! 


VIKINGS AHOY!

ArtiPeeps invites you to help us fund an important element in our latest large-scale combined arts project The Nine Realms.

From today, for the next 30 days, woodcarver Mark Crowley will be LIVE CARVING a Viking boat made from mahogany and oak, which will act as the focal point and heart of a 5-day Norse-inspired Interactive Combined Arts experience to be held between 11th-15th September 2015 in Hanse House, King's Lynn, Norfolk, UK.  Our project is  a continuation of  the  '2015 Year of the Hanse' celebrations and the National Heritage Open Day in Norfolk and England.  It is our intention to take the whole experience (and the boat) on tour: locally, nationally and internationally.

Bringing to life the 9 realms of Norse mythology,  The Nine Realms pulls together 45 talented creatives from around the UK and the world who have worked together online for over 9 months celebrating the myths, characters and stories from the 13th century Icelandic Norse Sagas through poetry, writing, art and music.

Please donate to help ArtiPeeps fully fund this project and cover Mark's woodcarving commission costs, and in so doing contribute to the creation of a unique art piece that will travel the world.

Stop Press! Exciting News! 


We had some exciting news on the 8th April:  we have been partially funded by Arts Council England and Norfolk County Council.  We need your help for the last funding push! 

      


What's going to happen over the next 30 Days:

Every 4 days (or less) Mark will be sending us live updates from his studio in Newcastle, UK. We will be posting up the sculpture's progress with new photographs and videos. Together we will see our boat emerge from the beautiful piece of mahogany from which he has chosen to carve the boat and the ash from which he is carving the prow.

The boat's shape and movement will be inspired by the project poetry. Poetry will be carved on to the boat's surface and organically inform the whole creative process. As Mark put it: 'It's a poem about a boat, made from a boat!'
Throughout the course of the 30 days we will be witnessing the creation of a unique piece of art, which acts as a physical reminder of the oral tradition of the Norse Sagas. 

In a very real way our boat will be the heart of the regular participatory poetry readings and realm tours we will run for the 1000+ members of the general public across the 5 days;  and for the pupils attending our project Schools' day.    Our boat is also a symbol of connectivity as participants meet for the first time. It is a celebration of a powerful virtual global collaborative process which is now coming to fruition in real-time.  We'd like to invite you into this celebration.


When and Where: 


11th-15th September, Hanse House, South Quay, King's Lynn, Norfolk, with Special Schools Day and Workshops (poetry and art). 
And: 
14th September, Participant lead Open Mic Poetry reading at The Norfolk and Norwich Millennium Library , Norwich.
nb. In between times our boat will reside at Hanse House on public display.

Featuring: 

19 poets and writers, 23 artists and 3 musicians 
  • Poets and Artists biographies
Premieres: 

  • 36 new poems and writings,  19 new diverse realm artworks (from Asgard to Alfheim)
  • 9 new specially commissioned pieces of realm music
  • Bespoke 9 Realms Viking Minecraft World  Designed by Adam Clarke responsible for #TateWorlds for Tate Modern
  • 4 page Ragnarök comic created by two American artists from Washington and Florida in the USA
  • Soundcloud Playlist of Realm Poetry- (from Asgard to Alfheim)

EDUCATIONAL IMPACT:

          

    Wonderful engagement, Pictures, of last year's Schools' Day, 2014

All the large-scale projects that ArtiPeeps runs feed off our online initiatives and have an educational remit. We aim to provide a vibrant variety of access points to epic pieces of literature like the Norse Sagas through the combined arts. Enhancing audience enjoyment through the use of comics, music, Minecraft and active participation.  Music and Minecraft are the final two elements of a combined arts template we wish to use in all our projects to come. 

We believe in the importance of lifelong learning and in the value of interaction and expression- hence our emphasis on participatory poetry reading, and our first-time use of Minecraft. We want to involve and inspire the public, pupils and schools with whom we work.  The 13th century Icelandic Norse Sagas, particularly The Prose and Poetic Eddas, have played a vital role in the way we tell stories today ,and in our poetic traditions.  We hope that through the new poetry, art and music we have created that these historic myths and characters can be re-imagined for new audiences.

Across the Schools' Day, and at the beginning of each poetry reading throughout the 5 days, people will gather around our Viking boat  as an initial meeting point. We want to create a magical multi-sensory experience, so there will be a starry sky above and the Northern lights falling across 'The Gallery' floor too.
From the end of April Millfield School Somerset pupils will be creating Norse inspired poetry, which will be posted out on ArtiPeeps and go on our multimedia DVD, supporting young poets too.

Two local schools will be attending our Schools' Day.
'Many thanks for your email. ArtiPeeps looks like a very impressive venture! I’ve had a good look at the website and am blown away by the variety and quality of the work on it. I’d love our pupils to be able to showcase some of their work on your site,' 

James Baddock, Millfield School, Somerset, Head of English, Drama & Media   www.millfieldschool.com


ARTIPEEPS:

    

                   

ArtiPeeps is a collaborative creativity and well-being not-for-profit organisation and website which was started in 2012. We specialise in the facilitation of large-scale projects which showcase global poets, artists and musicians, and introduce epic pieces of literature to new audiences and schools. Our purpose is to nurture creativity and well-being through collaboration. We also run a variety of individual online and collaborative showcasing initiatives. We also have an interest in mental health which underpins everything we do. 

Core values:  Respect, Collaboration, Communication, Integrity, Care

Our last project, Transformations (inspired by Ovid's Metamorphoses), was also co-funded by Arts Council England and Norfolk County Council.

  • https://artipeeps.wordpress.com

"Creativity generates well-being. Within nearly twelve months of collaborating with various writers & visual artists, ArtiPeeps has provided a formidable platform for allowing both inner spirit & work to explore new corners and connect with kindred spirits. So far, it has been both a challenging and highly enjoyable adventure!"  Nat Hall, participating poet  about 'Transformations'. 
With the introduction of the elements of Minecraft and Music, The Nine Realms, represents the combined arts template we hope to use in all our future ArtiPeeps projects. With the belief that through a unique sensory mix of art forms  we can create a variety of imaginative access points to complex material for all age ranges. One that moves people away from merely 'attending' to 'participating'.

OUR PARTNERS

        

                         1.                                                   2.                                        3.                                                 

Partner Links:

1.  Hanse House
The only existing hanseatic warehouse in England.

2.   Future Radio 
An award winning, Norfolk Community Radio Station, with a 25,000 per week listenership (broadcasting our open mic session and interviews with Viking participants).

 3. The Norfolk and Norwich Millennium Library, Norwich
 The most popular library in the UK where we are hosting a special poetry reading and open mic session, lead by the projects poets and artists in person.

VIA OUR ACTIVITY WE WANT TO:

* Magic the Norse World to life for everyone through the combined arts/ Minecraft.

* Encourage lifelong learning, active participation, connection  and enjoyment.

* Provide an original showcasing environment for emerging creatives.


OUR PERKS:


Are created 100% from within the project and by the creatives involved.

The name of every backer from Vanaheim perk onwards will:

  •  be included in our collaborative backers' Wordle, displayed in 'The Gallery'. 

  • become a Friend of ArtiPeeps, and be listed on our Sponsors' Page for perpetuity. 

  • Receive a 'The Nine Realms' Interactive PDF containing the poetry, art and music from the experience. Contains 2 unique introductions by art critic Anna McNay and Norse Expert Caitlin Ellis from Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge. 


                                          Last year's Wordle 


* Add £3 to any Perk Tier and receive a download of our bespoke Viking Minecraft world which includes all the artwork, poetry and music from our event plus poetry and art from participating schools. 

* Add £6 to any Perk Tier and receive an exclusive event Multimedia DVD with all the event material on it: the poetry, audios from participants and pupils , the 19 art pieces and the 9 pieces of realm music. The DVD will be in a bespoke slipcase, featuring our logo designed by illustrator Gary Caldwell. 

JOTUNHEIM (Realm of the Giants)  Greetings Cards 

https://soundcloud.com/committen/nifelheim-by-tom-murphy

All the other realm art is due in on Thursday 30th April, so we will choose the other two poetry-art pairings then, and release them here!


 NIDAVELLIR (Realm of the Dwarves)         Caricature


RyanAtkinsArt.com

    NIFELHEIM (Realm of the Dead)                  Initials 

    


HELHEIM (the Realm through which all men must pass to die)                                                        Rune Poem 

          


Featuring poets Rebecca Audra Smith, Jim C. Mackintosh, Lenka Monk, Richard Biddle , Nat Hall and Kate Garrett

   MUSPELHEIM (Realm of Fire)              Medallion 

             

Add ons: Pack of 3 poetry art cards, Experience Interactive PDF and Minecraft download.


MIDGARD (Realm of the People) 

  Commission an exclusive A4 painting from an artist of your choice       

    

Commission an  exclusive A4 painting from one of the above Viking artists of your choice (James Mackenzie, Deborah Sheehy, Ieuan Edwards (linocut art) and Raymond Bentley) around the themes of: The Elements, Battle, Magic and Northern Lights. You can include a specific element of your choice too if you like. The painting will be turned into a high quality giclee fine art print.  Plus add ons:  Event DVD and Pack of Poetry-art greetings cards


ALFHEIM (Realm of the Light Elves)  Song


'Simon is a writer and musician based in Sussex. He has been writing music for many years , but only began recording it in 2009, firstly with the acoustic roots band, in cahoots, for which he writes most of the songs and tunes. Since then he has recorded two band albums 'Work for idle hands', and 'Newtimber'. In 2013 he released his first solo album 'A short stay in longevity'- a collection of 18 original songs, tunes and spoken word poems put to music.'

 See:  http://www.ashortstay.co.uk/ 

and http://simonbeavis.bandcamp.com/releases


FUNDING

The financing of our Viking boat is the final piece in our funding jigsaw and your support in covering Mark's commissioning fees will mean that we can 'Magic the Norse World to life' for the general public and schools nationally and internationally.  You would also be assisting a project that supports global creatives and creativity. 

THANK YOU very much indeed for your interest, and the support of our collective endeavour!  Any help in spreading the word about our campaign would be very much appreciated. The Campaign Link is:

                  http://igg.me/at/the9realms


Watch out for 4 competitions we are running on Twitter with the #9realms!

* Add £6 to any Perk Tier and receive an exclusive event Multimedia DVD with all the event material on it: the poetry, audios from participants and pupils , the 19 art pieces and the 9 pieces of realm music. The DVD will be in a bespoke slipcase, featuring our logo designed by illustrator Gary Caldwell. 

JOTUNHEIM (Realm of the Giants)  Greetings Cards 




https://soundcloud.com/committen/nifelheim-by-tom-murphy
All the other realm art is due in on Thursday 30th April, so we will choose the other two poetry-art pairings then, and release them here!


 NIDAVELLIR (Realm of the Dwarves)         Caricature


RyanAtkinsArt.com


    NIFELHEIM (Realm of the Dead)                  Initials 

    

HELHEIM
(the Realm through which all men must pass to die)                                                        Rune Poem 

          
Featuring poets Rebecca Audra Smith, Jim C. Mackintosh, Lenka Monk, Richard Biddle , Nat Hall and Kate Garrett


   MUSPELHEIM
(Realm of Fire)              Medallion 
             
Add ons: Pack of 3 poetry art cards, Experience Interactive PDF and Minecraft download.

MIDGARD (Realm of the People) 
  Commission an exclusive A4 painting from an artist of your choice       
    Commission an  exclusive A4 painting from one of the above Viking artists of your choice (James Mackenzie, Deborah Sheehy, Ieuan Edwards (linocut art) and Raymond Bentley) around the themes of: The Elements, Battle, Magic and Northern Lights. You can include a specific element of your choice too if you like. The painting will be turned into a high quality giclee fine art print.  Plus add ons:  Event DVD and Pack of Poetry-art greetings cards


ALFHEIM (Realm of the Light Elves)  Song



'Simon
is a writer and musician based in Sussex. He has been writing music
for many years , but only began recording it in 2009, firstly with
the acoustic roots band, in cahoots, for which he writes most of the
songs and tunes. Since then he has recorded two band albums 'Work for
idle hands', and 'Newtimber'. In 2013 he released his first solo
album 'A short stay in longevity'- a collection of 18 original songs,
tunes and spoken word poems put to music.'
 See:  http://www.ashortstay.co.uk/ 
and http://simonbeavis.bandcamp.com/releases


FUNDING
The financing of our Viking boat is the final piece in our funding jigsaw and your support in covering Mark's commissioning fees will mean that we can 'Magic the Norse World to life' for the general public and schools nationally and internationally.  You would also be assisting a project that supports global creatives and creativity. 
THANK YOU very much indeed for your interest, and the support of our collective endeavour!  Any help in spreading the word about our campaign would be very much appreciated. The Campaign Link is:
                  http://igg.me/at/the9realms

Watch
out for 4 competitions we are running on Twitter with the
#9realms!

story:
The Apis Inlusio needs your help to get to Burning Man 2014!  Please help us with our last-ditch funding effort. We only have a few days to raise money for new audio equipment, transportation, and fuel!

The Apis is a beautiful, elegant, fierce bumblebee-styled art car, built by beeCharge camp for Burning Man 2013. After eight months of intense, non-stop work in the summer of 2013, the Apis rolled out on to the Playa and absolutely delighted everyone we encountered! People were struck by the Apis' organic, elegant curvature. They admired the impressive craftsmanship of the dozens of volunteer builders.  The interior was comfortable and inviting and random burners could easily board on the four leg-ladders and rear tail-stair. The sound system BOOMED (until we blew it out). The bright, blinking eyes and massive, roaring fireballs from the antennae thrilled everyone within a hundred yards. The glowing yellow and black stripes were recognizable from across the Playa. The engine, controls, and electrical systems worked mostly flawlessly all week. 

The Apis led the bee swarm procession to the Man. We joined in the Space Cowboy's annual Hoe Down. We gave hundreds upon hundreds of magical rides to weary burners. We even ferried a few injured folks to the med tents.

After the Playa, the Apis was invited to Decompression, where we rocked a stage with the Janky Barge and the Airpusher DJ crew. We brought the Apis to the New Bohemia party at the SF Armory on New Year's Eve. We paraded through the streets of San Leandro for their Cherry Festival Parade, by invitation of the mayor himself!

Next year, we will take the Apis even further. Maker Faire, more music festivals, Earth Day, Carnaval, you name it!

But to do all of this and more, we need a little money for audio equipment, transportation, mechanical repairs, propane, lighting, safety equipment, and innumerable other expenses. Please donate now and help us rock the Play again in 2014! Tell your friends. 'Like' and comment on the Facebook post so it will be seen by more people. Post a story about your experience on the Apis. Please also contribute even if we hit our goal. Any extra will go toward even more Apis improvements and activities.

Thank you all trememdously for your support and we hope to see you on Playa and beyond!


Aaron Cutchin, Captain, Apis Inlusio

acutchin@gmail.com

story:
National Ride for Reading Week is an annual nationwide effort in which volunteer cyclists host book deliveries to schools in their communities. This year, with over 16 cities confirmed, Ride for Reading approximates that more than 30,000 books will be delivered. Delivery cities include Las Vegas, Nashville, Memphis, Philadelphia and Detroit. National Week will be hosted from September 13th to the 19th. 

Let's Start with a Book is  our annual fundraising initiative to keep Ride for Reading rolling. 100% of the funds generated by this initiative go toward programs committed to making the organization sustainable. Without your support, Ride for Reading will be unable to continue its mission of promoting literacy and healthy living among children in low income communities.

Over 45 million adults are considered to be functionally illiterate in the United States and 85% of juvenile delinquents have difficulties reading. These statistics take an annual 20 billion dollar toll on the economy.

We have found that there is a gap between school and home when it comes to literacy. A lot of students don’t have books at home, much less age-appropriate ones, and this affects the progress that is made during the school day. We want to make sure that every child has the tools necessary to succeed as we work to decrease, and ultimately eliminate, illiteracy rates.

All contributions are tax deductible. 



(Source: National Institute for Literacy, National Center for Adult Literacy, The Literacy Company, U.S. Census Bureau)

About Ride for Reading

Established in 2008, Ride for Reading’s mission is to help children in low-income areas become healthy and literate. Highlighted by their unique way to get books into the hands of children, Ride for Reading has donated over 250,000 books to children of low-income families nationally. The organization has been featured  in  The  Tennessean,  Nashville  Parent, International  Mountain Bike  Magazine,  Bicycle  Times,  Mountain  Bike  Action and many more. 


Perks
Take a look at our perks! Every donation you make will go towards improving our annual National Ride For Reading Week. 

Together we can ensure we impact more schools and communities across the nation.

story:
Forgotten Iowa was started by Cody Weber in March of 2015, born from a combination of curiosity and a personal love for his home state. The project is dedicated to the every day minutia of typical Iowan life, and makes a centerpiece of the backdrops that illustrate the landscape of our collective existence. Though many view this state as largely in decline, Weber insists that the magic is still there hiding in the hundreds of small communities peppered throughout the state. When you get beyond the fields of corn, he says, there is a subtle electricity that still carries in the breeze. It's that very lightning that he and partner Kathleen hope to bottle precisely 99 times as they travel through the state and all of its towns. Weber sees Iowans, specifically the small-towners, as largely unrepresented and rarely talked about in popular media. It is his central purpose to illuminate those lives, to bring attention to the historical architecture, and tell the stories of the countless individuals that he encounters in his travels.

What has been completed thus far:

Counties that this campaign is designed to complete:

What this campaign will pay for:

  • Fuel Costs.  Each county ranges between $50.00 and $100.00 round trip to traverse through each county and return home.
  • Hotel Rooms.  From where we are presently (Jefferson County), it can take several hours just to reach the first town of whatever county we tackle.  As we venture westward, it will become highly unlikely that we can travel to a county, photograph it, and return home in a single day.  A hotel room will insure a multiple day visit and yield more variety in photographs.
  • Car Upkeep.  We recently had to replace the entire exhaust in our trust Ford Taurus.  It will need regular tune-ups and oil changes.

story:
Якщо ви живете в Україні, то явно помітили, що останнім часом фестивалів стає все менше. Чимало славетних опен-ейрів, що проходили роками, вже пішло в історію. Якщо ж ви живете в центрі України, то ви явно помітили, що фестивальний рух тут майже вмер. Причин цьому багато і про це можна довго плести язиком. Але від балачок нічого не зміниться, потрібні реальні дії. І ми вирішили діяти!

Відправляємось разом у яскраву дводенну подорож на острів незабутніх пригод! На нас чекають більше сотні артистів, десятки виставок, концертів, перфомансів, інтерактивних івентів, майстер-класів. Унікальний нелінійний сценарій зробить персональне свято для кожного. І компот!

Ми відриваємось від сірих буднів та стандартних кліше на власний острів та будуємо ціле місто культури, креативу та самовираження - Артмісто!


Твій власний фестиваль.





Годі чекати поки хтось нарешті привезе улюбленого виконавця чи влаштує бажаний івент, ми самі можемо зробити це! Так, гарне свято, добре й коштує. Але, якщо кожен дасть свою невеличку частинку, разом ми зробимо набагато більше, ніж кожен собі думав.

Нашу підготовку поділено на певні етапи, кожен з яких потребує певних ресурсів. Десь потрібні гроші, десь - певні речі, а десь - проста дружня допомога. Як тільки ми реалізуємо певний етап, наше свято стає ще більш яскравим!

Ідею спільного фестивалю поділяють й наші улюблені виконавці. Кожен з них з радістю приїде, як тільки ми зберемо певні кошти. Ще більше артистів приєднуються кожного дня! Але й зволікати теж не можна - артисти вільні в своєму графіку і можна просто не встигнути запросити їх на дні нашого свята. Тож не баримося, кличемо друзів і поспішаємо зробити лайнап фестиваля зі своїх улюблених гуртів!

Дізнайся більше про ідею краудфандінгу.


Концепція «Новий плей-лист»





Що може бути краще за концерт улюбленої супер-зірки! Але ж й вони колись вперше вийшли на сцену. Нікому невідомі, з купою каверів та парою власних пісень. Їх почули, полюбили й надихнули на нові хіти. Фестивалі — це детонатори для нових імен, нової музики, свіжих та сміливих поглядів. Якщо в твоєму плей-листі лише «дух старої школи», то настав час це змінити!

Артмісто надає перевагу надталановитим, але (поки що ) маловідомим виконацям. Приготуйся бути враженим надпотужним звуком від колективів, що грають рок, джаз та електро. Гарантуємо — це будуть два неймовірно приємних дні.

Дізнайся більше про концепцію «Новий плей-лист».


Спільнота самовираження





Чисто музичний фестиваль — це просто великий концерт. Маршрут сцена-фудкорт-сцена — вибір для людей без фантазії. Але не для тебе!

Артмісто - це фестиваль культури та інновацій. Тим, хто шукає справжніх вражень, любить щось нове, прагне самовираження ми готуємо ще п'ять дивовижних локацій:

- Лаундж зона, де окрім музики будуть проходити літературні читання, майстер-класи, інтерактивні івенти з розвитку особистості;
- Зона візуального мистецтва з виставками, стріт-арт батлами, мітингами;
- Кіно під зірками та з цікавими лайфхаками для тих, хто хоче гарно знімати власноруч;
- Love-made майдан. Наші митці роблять дивовижні речі, що несуть тепло та любов. Теж маєш хобі та щось майструєш? Приєднуйся до нашої елітної групи авторів!
- Спорт та активний відпочинок. Справжнє життя — це нестримна енергія. Спробуй себе на нашому спеціальному майданчику, або насолодись виступами справжніх профі екстримального спорту.

Маєш що сказати? Займаєшься якоюсь творчістю а працюєш у сфері культури? Стань нашим авторомта розкрий себе світу!


Black Rock





Монастирський острів має свою секретну локацію, що доступна тільки обраним. Ті, хто робить по-справжньому величезний внесок у розвиток Артміста, отримують неймовірні вигоди. Знижки, дарунки, відзнаки та доступ у секретну локацію на закриту вечірку зі спеціальними гостями. А ще — можливістьобрати головного хедлайнера фестивалю!


Назад у майбутнє



Колись Марті Макфлай літав на машині часу у 2015 рік. Сьогодні ми заводимо свою власну машину. Ми беремо найкращі фестивальні здобутки та започатковуємо новий яскравий світ що зробить свій внесок в майбутнє української культури. Ми бажаємо зробити фестиваль, який стане символом позитивних емоцій і який буде ставати все краще з кожним роком. На нас чекає чимало пригод, та ми віримо, що з вашою участю ми обов'язково доб'ємося успіху!

Тим, хто шукає справжніх вражень, любить щось нове, прагне самовираження ми готуємо ще п'ять дивовижних локацій:- Лаундж зона, де окрім музики будуть проходити літературні читання, майстер-класи, інтерактивні івенти з розвитку особистості;- Зона візуального мистецтва з виставками, стріт-арт батлами, мітингами;- Кіно під зірками та з цікавими лайфхаками для тих, хто хоче гарно знімати власноруч;- Love-made майдан. Наші митці роблять дивовижні речі, що несуть тепло та любов. Теж маєш хобі та щось майструєш? Приєднуйся до нашої елітної групи авторів!- Спорт та активний відпочинок. Справжнє життя — це нестримна енергія. Спробуй себе на нашому спеціальному майданчику, або насолодись виступами справжніх профі екстримального спорту.Маєш що сказати? Займаєшься якоюсь творчістю а працюєш у сфері культури? Стань нашим авторомта розкрий себе світу!Black RockМонастирський острів має свою секретну локацію, що доступна тільки обраним. Ті, хто робить по-справжньому величезний внесок у розвиток Артміста, отримують неймовірні вигоди. Знижки, дарунки, відзнаки та доступ у секретну локацію на закриту вечірку зі спеціальними гостями. А ще — можливістьобрати головного хедлайнера фестивалю!Назад у майбутнє

Колись Марті Макфлай літав на машині часу у 2015 рік. Сьогодні ми заводимо свою власну машину. Ми беремо найкращі фестивальні здобутки та започатковуємо новий яскравий світ що зробить свій внесок в майбутнє української культури. Ми бажаємо зробити фестиваль, який стане символом позитивних емоцій і який буде ставати все краще з кожним роком. На нас чекає чимало пригод, та ми віримо, що з вашою участю ми обов'язково доб'ємося успіху!

story:
WHO? WHY?

Proceeds from this campaign benefit the oldest API multidisciplinary Arts non-profit in the U.S., Kearny Street Workshop. 

Our commitment to our community and existence depends on our fundraising initiatives.  We're crossing our fingers that you can help us meet our mid-year fundraising goal.  Our goal is ambitious, but with your generous help we can raise 2K! 

WHO WE ARE: Founded in 1972, during the height of the Asian American Movement, Kearny Street Workshop is the oldest Asian Pacific American multidisciplinary arts organization in the country.

WHAT WE DO:  Offering classes and workshops, salons and student presentations, as well as professionally curated and produced exhibitions, performances, readings and screenings, KSW makes artists out of community members and community members out of artists. For the past 43 years, KSW has nurtured creative spirit, offered an important platform for new voices to be heard, and connected artists with community.

MISSION:  Our mission is to present, produce, and promote art that empowers Asian Pacific American artists and communities.

VISION: We envision a more just society that fully incorporates APA voices informed by our cultural values, historical roots, and contemporary issues.

---

WHAT! & HOW YOU BENEFIT?

Fan favorite and finalist of Season 13 Project Runway and Kearny Street Workshop's Celebrate Your Body featured designer, Kini Zamora, has kindly donated the 2 piece outfit below to help us meet our fundraising goal.

***All donors will be put into a drawing to win Kini Zamora's stunning creation below.  The more you donate the higher your chances.  So why not give yourself the chance to be the lucky winner of this beauty!  And when you're bombarded with endless compliments and requests of, "Where did you get your gorgeous outfit from?" you'll have a meaningful story to share.



The oversized cropped top is a size M-XL, depending if you want to wear it oversized as seen in the image above or fitted.  It is made out of the innovative material known as neoprene.  The highwaisted pleated denim skirt is a size M.  It is complimented with genuine black leather trims at the high-waist band and at the natural waistband.  Ahem...Mr. Zamora is famous for his expertise crafting of denim.  The photos do not do the quality construction and beauty of this outfit justice.  You'll know what we're talking about if you're the lucky owner of this masterpiece. 


STYLE TIP ON STYLE TIP ON STYLE TIP!

Gorgeously wear this thoughtfully hand-crafted outfit as illustrated in the image or you may mix and match each piece with many other items in your wardrobe.  We're here to help you get the most mileage for your generous investment.

The Magic of the Top

1.  The top would also be perfect with a vegan leather pencil skirt or skinny pants or worn over your dresses for a creatively stylish layered look. 

2.  For a polished uptown chic aesthetic, pair it with highwaisted wide-leg trousers, culottes, or a midi skirt. 

3.  For a downtown chic outfit, wear it with palazzo pants. 

4.  For an effortless weekend outfit, pair it with your favorite jeans or cut-off shorts.  

The Genius of the Skirt

1.  The denim skirt would make a stylishly casual statement worn with a simple white t-shirt or your favorite vintage band t-shirt. 

2.  For a beautiful feminine look, pair it with a classic white button-up and tie the bottom ends into a knot around the most narrow part of your waist. 

3.  For our fashion forward fashionistas, rock it with a bandeau or bustier

4.  For our chili weather fashion mavens, wear it with a cropped chunky knit sweater.

Talk about versatility!  Your outfit options really are endless with these statement pieces.  

Thank you for caring.  We cannot meet our fundraising goal without you and the generosity of Kini Zamora. 

Please help us spread the work by forwarding and posting this onto your social media.  Please use this bit.ly link when sharing: bit.ly/1tee30days


Deepest gratitude,
The KSW Community
kearnystreet.org
kinizamora.org

story:
PART DUEX RELAUNCHED:

My Initial Indiegogo to send my SPLITS ART, ART WORK to hang inside the EIFFEL TOWER raised enough money to make it happen!  NOW, I'm looking for some more magical support to send ME to PARIS to see my art hanging!!! This is such an amazing opportunity, and I want to be there to see it and network with the BEST artists in the world, curators, critics, buyers and the host of the night Salvador Dali's son Jose Dali!!!! 

I have the funding set at the minimum requirement of $500, but I do need more than that, I'm just trying to get the least % amount deducted from my campaign.  The money I raise will go to my flight, accommodations, travel expenses and doing a LIVE SPLITS ART SHOW in PARIS!! I'm so grateful to everyone who has helped out and been a part of my Dreams Coming True!!!  BIG VIRTUAL HUGS TO ALL!!


ORIGINAL CAMPAIGN LINK:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/l-art-de-splits-a-la-tour-eiffel/x/8400503


WHY AM I ON INDIEGOGO?

Hello! Bonjour! My name is...excuse moi, ah-hem...Je m'applle Erin Barylski, but most people know me as my nom de plume, SPLITS ART.  SPLITS ART is my unique style of painting, where I use my entire body as my paintbrush! After years of dedication to stretching canvases and my body, I have been invited to show my art, at the “Gustave Eiffel Hall” inside the Eiffel Tower, Paris, France during the international show “La Grande Exposition Universelle”.

I am honored to show you a clipping from the invitation: 

“Dear Erin,

I want to invite you to participate at the most prestigious art event in the world: Exposition at the Eiffel Tower.

The most important artists in the world will be invited to participate at "La Grande Exposition Universelle" to be held inside the Eiffel Tower, “Gustave Eiffel” Hall.

In one of the most visited monuments all over the world, after 125 years from the great universal exhibition of Paris, some artists of different nationalities, will be the protagonists of the event with their artworks. The great figurative masters will be placed side by side to those of informal and abstract art.

The Tour Eiffel, once again will receive new proofs of creativity, visual stories of artists intended to go down in history.”      

!!!WOW!!!  That is some pretty amazing recognition, right?!

My dream is coming true to go down in Art History!  Considering it is the 21st century, doing something that is uniquely new was not an easy feat...but it is in my soul to expand upon the creative limitless possibilities in my performance art creations of SPLITS ART.  Growing up, even finger painting wasn’t vast nor freeing enough, especially with a smock on; now, I create larger than life artwork using only my limber body as my paintbrush. In efforts to keep this momentum going and having my BIG ARTISTIC BREAK, I am stretching out and asking for your support and financial help!  But first, let me take a moment to tell you a little more about SPLITS ART...

WHAT EXACTLY IS SPLITS ART?

My performance art, I have been told, is something you have to see to believe!  I use my flexible paint covered physique as a paintbrush, while performing choreographed and/or improvised dance, yoga, and contortion upon a canvas to entertain and create vibrant 2D artworks. 

My high energy talents and unique performance style have landed me on America’s Got Talent, The Late Show with David Letterman and at the world renown Art Basel in Miami, Florida 2013, and 2011.  I was most recently awarded Miami’s Best Performing Artist 2013 by RAWartists; was the headlining entertainer, with a full gallery show, at A Splash of Style, during the prestigious Miami Swimwear Week 2014; and I was the main entertainment at YELP’s 10 year Anniversary Party in Miami, 2014! 

My large scale artworks average 5ft x 10ft and have a variety of styles ranging from contemporary, impressionistic, logo’s and precise imagery; many performances are created at lightning fast speeds of 15-30 minutes and my more intricate pieces take hours!

WHY AM I ASKING FOR HELP?

ANSWER 1 (too legit):

I’M A STARVING ARTIST, THAT’S WHY!!!  I’ve literally watched money go down the drain over the years, as I have showered off countless gallons of paint residue after my many performances! 

***side note:  I use non-toxic children’s washable tempera paint and spend extra for biodegradable plastic #GoGreen!***  

PLUS, I am 100% ready for my true potential of success to be here. I'm exhausted of praying to make it to my next paycheck from my 9 to 5,  in order to pay my bills and hopefully have enough money left to buy MORE paint… God forbid, I ever have  to use mustard AGAIN because I ran out of yellow paint( yes, true story, I smelled like a hotdog, it was awful).   S'il vous plait, do NOT pass the Grey Poupon.

ANSWER 2 (the open heart):  

Reminiscing over the past year I have been blessed with many wonderful opportunities to perform and show my art at some truly amazing events.  I am thankful for all the support I have received, the people I have met, connected with, inspired, and made smile.  I am forever grateful to those who have purchased my SPLITS ART paintings and prints and those who visualize doing so one day. I have been performing out of my own pocket because SPLITS ART is what I believe in and am passionate about! Do what you love and you’ll never work a day in your life!

ANSWER 3 (my dream is nearly my reality):  

I am teetering at that BIG BREAK point!  I know in my colorful heart of hearts that what I do is so very special and I am deserving of reaching my BHAG (Big Hairy Audacious Goal) where my artwork is selling next to the masters for its true value of six figures and beyond!  I see myself making my art a profitable career and creating a legacy; I have so many vibrant ideas to share with the world!   

ANSWER 4 (the big picture):

Those of you who have been a part of and/or watched my journey over the years have seen the growth, transformation and dedication to my body of work, I wouldn’t be here without you! I THANK YOU with all my heart! I desperately would love to not only repay you, but someday soon I intend to hire all my talented friends who have lent me their time, kindness and gifts of many forms because they see what I see in SPLITS ART.  I dream of a winning future with my SPLITS ART TEAM by my side!  

To those of you who are new SPLITS ART fans or just reading about me for the first time….First and most importantly, THANK YOU for spending your time on my page.  Second, I ask you, try to imagine what I have invested in time, effort and cost into each 5ft by 10ft painting (AND of course, my practice paintings!!!  It is NOT easy to choreograph and none the less figure out how to paint a ginormous bumblebee, landing on a flower, in only 15 minutes, when you are upside down half the time, and the other half spinning around, trying to look cute and keep on smiling!). 

Luckily, you don't have to imagine because here is the non-exaggerated answer: it has been thousands upon thousands of self-invested dollars and years upon years to have reached this point in my artistic career.  I am beyond excited to have this opportunity to share my art internationally and continue to inspire others to think outside of the coloring book lines of life.  

   

HOW MUCH HELP DO I NEED?

Financially I’m would like to manifest $15,000 USD for this Parisian experience.  Each artwork submission at this exclusive event is €1.800,00 rounding to nearly $2,500.00 per painting (there is a price break for the more paintings you send, apx $6700 for 3 paintings).  My paintings will be greatly cropped to fit within the exhibit requirements.  Ideally, I would like to have 3 pieces on display so it will appear as a triptych of a single artwork of my 'normal' proportions. 

In addition, I will need to cover the cost of my shipping/insurance on my artwork to and from Paris (likely the canvas will be shipped rolled-up to cut down on costs), reframing of the artwork in Paris, flight (apx $1200-1500), hotel stay (granted I will try to find someone to host my stay or budget it out in a hostel, but at max $200/night for 7-9 nights apx $1500 - $2000 ), local travel needs, a lesson or duex to brush up on my high school level 1 francais, and additional expenses such as shipping my SPLITS ART performance supplies for a TBD performance wink, wink, wink.  

Since the Gustave Eiffel Hall is so prestigious I will not be permitted to have a performance within the Eiffle Tower.  Yet, I will surely bend over backwards to find somewhere that will host a SPLITS ART performance.  It is a possibility to do an impromptu painting near the Eiffel Tower or more likely in front of the Louvre (as the following day after the show is the Salon Art Shopping 2014, au Carrousel de Louve Musee, talk about perfect timing!)!  I would love to give the metallic miming robots a little friendly street performance competition!  

OTHER FORMS OF HELP…

A positive thought or intention for SPLITS ART (heck, think of one for yourself too while you are at it)!  Please send some good energy my way (and I'll send some right back to you!) and envision me selling my art for big euros!  

The human connection is the biggest way to share!  Please talk about my story and share the links via your email and social media outlets.  It is a small world out there and I know with your help we can get the word out.  Please help me find people to pitch in and I will be able to be part of this exhibit!  This is truly an experience of a lifetime to be able to show my artwork inside the Eiffel Tower!

WHAT IF I DON’T MAKE MY GOAL? (geeeze Debbie Downer!  Take a hike!)

Your donation will still be going to a great cause!  I will send my art, at minimum, one piece, even if I can’t send myself to Paris.  Getting my name out there in this international show is a true honor!  

POSITIVE POLLY SAYS WITH A SMILE: Anything in-between 2 or 3 paintings or (dreaming bigger!) even above my goal (fingers, arms, legs and toes crossed) it will go to purchasing paint, canvas, supplies and the ‘likewise’ to continue future SPLITS ART performances...and yes, of course you are invited!  

BUT WAIT!  THERE’S MORE THAN JUST A GOOD DOES OF KARMA!:  Check out the right hand side of the page... you get a little special something with each level of donation. Plus my ever-enduring gratitude and knowing that there is a smile on my face and likely a smudge of paint on my chin or nose too! 

*** Please pay via PayPal if possible (*see fine print below) 

IN CLOSING with LOVE, LIGHT and PAINT: 

“All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.” - Pablo Picasso

Always Smiling,

Erin "SPLITS ART" Barylski

SPECIAL THANKS: 

My ever-supportive parents Joanne and Brian who couldn't be prouder of their little girl, Loft 954 Studios - you have always given me the space and time I needed to grow SPLITS ART, Chris "Headshots" Hedlund, Josh Ott Photo and Design, RAWartists.org, MadFlower Creative Group, LMNT Gallery, Nina Torres Fine Art Gallery, TSL Lounge, The Stage, Carousel Gallery, Miaimee Makeup, The Beach Channel, ECOMB, Yelp Miami and The Coral Gables Museum, Koncept Events, my 9-5 job Weatherby Healthcare (for allowing me the time off to follow my BHAG!), PS Yoga Studio, Barkan Method Yoga Studio, The New Times, The Pride Center, The Late Show with David Letterman, America's Got Talent, Home Depot, JoAnn Fabrics, Pearl Arts and Crafts Store, Wix.com, my amazing family, my awesome friends and all my super SPLITS ART FANS!!  I love you all!


THE FINE PRINT:

*Please pay via PayPal if possible!   My first payment for this event due on September 5, 2014 and I need your help to make this happen.  Paying via PayPal puts the money directly into my account, for instant access.  

*If you pay via credit card, I am still very grateful, but I will not receive the money until 15 days after my campaign ends.  This will make it extremely difficult for me to make my 2nd payment which is due on September 25th, 2014.

*Indiegogo's fees:  When I make my goal, Indiegogo, will deduct 4%, at $15,000 that would be -$600's in fees.  Campaigns that do not make their goal will be deducted 9% of the donations acquired (for me that would be at max apx $1200 in fees).

*Please let me know if you have any questions by emailing me at splitsart@gmail.com or visit my website www.splitsart.com MERCI BEAUCOUP!!!

you don't have to imagine because here is the non-exaggerated answer: it has been thousands upon thousands of self-invested dollars and years upon years to have reached this point in my artistic career.  I am beyond excited to have this opportunity to share my art internationally and continue to inspire others to think outside of the coloring book lines of life.      HOW MUCH HELP DO I NEED?Financially I’m would like to manifest $15,000 USD for this Parisian experience.  Each artwork submission at this exclusive event is €1.800,00 rounding to nearly $2,500.00 per painting (there is a price break for the more paintings you send, apx $6700 for 3 paintings).  My paintings will be greatly cropped to fit within the exhibit requirements.  Ideally, I would like to have 3 pieces on display so it will appear as a triptych of a single artwork of my 'normal' proportions. In addition, I will need to cover the cost of my shipping/insurance on my artwork to and from Paris (likely the canvas will be shipped rolled-up to cut down on costs), reframing of the artwork in Paris, flight (apx $1200-1500), hotel stay (granted I will try to find someone to host my stay or budget it out in a hostel, but at max $200/night for 7-9 nights apx $1500 - $2000 ), local travel needs, a lesson or duex to brush up on my high school level 1 francais, and additional expenses such as shipping my SPLITS ART performance supplies for a TBD performance wink, wink, wink.  Since the Gustave Eiffel Hall is so prestigious I will not be permitted to have a performance within the Eiffle Tower.  Yet, I will surely bend over backwards to find somewhere that will host a SPLITS ART performance.  It is a possibility to do an impromptu painting near the Eiffel Tower or more likely in front of the Louvre (as the following day after the show is the Salon Art Shopping 2014, au Carrousel de Louve Musee, talk about perfect timing!)!  I would love to give the metallic miming robots a little friendly street performance competition!  OTHER FORMS OF HELP…A positive thought or intention for SPLITS ART (heck, think of one for yourself too while you are at it)!  Please send some good energy my way (and I'll send some right back to you!) and envision me selling my art for big euros!  The human connection is the biggest way to share!  Please talk about my story and share the links via your email and social media outlets.  It is a small world out there and I know with your help we can get the word out.  Please help me find people to pitch in and I will be able to be part of this exhibit!  This is truly an experience of a lifetime to be able to show my artwork inside the Eiffel Tower!WHAT IF I DON’T MAKE MY GOAL? (geeeze Debbie Downer!  Take a hike!)Your donation will still be going to a great cause!  I will send my art, at minimum, one piece, even if I can’t send myself to Paris.  Getting my name out there in this international show is a true honor!  POSITIVE POLLY SAYS WITH A SMILE: Anything in-between 2 or 3 paintings or (dreaming bigger!) even above my goal (fingers, arms, legs and toes crossed) it will go to purchasing paint, canvas, supplies and the ‘likewise’ to continue future SPLITS ART performances...and yes, of course you are invited!  BUT WAIT!  THERE’S MORE THAN JUST A GOOD DOES OF KARMA!:  Check out the right hand side of the page... you get a little special something with each level of donation. Plus my ever-enduring gratitude and knowing that there is a smile on my face and likely a smudge of paint on my chin or nose too! *** Please pay via PayPal if possible (*see fine print below) IN CLOSING with LOVE, LIGHT and PAINT: “All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.” - Pablo PicassoAlways Smiling,Erin "SPLITS ART" BarylskiSPECIAL THANKS: My ever-supportive parents Joanne and Brian who couldn't be prouder of their little girl, Loft 954 Studios - you have always given me the space and time I needed to grow SPLITS ART, Chris "Headshots" Hedlund, Josh Ott Photo and Design, RAWartists.org, MadFlower Creative Group, LMNT Gallery, Nina Torres Fine Art Gallery, TSL Lounge, The Stage, Carousel Gallery, Miaimee Makeup, The Beach Channel, ECOMB, Yelp Miami and The Coral Gables Museum, Koncept Events, my 9-5 job Weatherby Healthcare (for allowing me the time off to follow my BHAG!), PS Yoga Studio, Barkan Method Yoga Studio, The New Times, The Pride Center, The Late Show with David Letterman, America's Got Talent, Home Depot, JoAnn Fabrics, Pearl Arts and Crafts Store, Wix.com, my amazing family, my awesome friends and all my super SPLITS ART FANS!!  I love you all!THE FINE PRINT:*Please pay via PayPal if possible!   My first payment for this event due on September 5, 2014 and I need your help to make this happen.  Paying via PayPal puts the money directly into my account, for instant access.  *If you pay via credit card, I am still very grateful, but I will not receive the money until 15 days after my campaign ends.  This will make it extremely difficult for me to make my 2nd payment which is due on September 25th, 2014.*Indiegogo's fees:  When I make my goal, Indiegogo, will deduct 4%, at $15,000 that would be -$600's in fees.  Campaigns that do not make their goal will be deducted 9% of the donations acquired (for me that would be at max apx $1200 in fees).*Please let me know if you have any questions by emailing me at splitsart@gmail.com or visit my website www.splitsart.com MERCI BEAUCOUP!!!

story:
Welcome to The Third Annual Trans Calendar Project! We are a collective of artists and activists striving to empower trans* people across North America and the world. Our annual calendar gives us a platform to represent ourselves as trans individuals through our own eyes, making visible a diversity of people and raising awareness about the realities of our lives and communities. 

___________________________________________________________________________


DIVERSITY Representation gives trans people the varied, positive role models they need. It shows the rest of the world that we are just as diverse as everyone else, and we want to celebrate that! One byproduct of this is a nurturing of community amongst trans* people of all ages, identities and walks of life. 

SOLIDARITY We don't do this alone. Without the financial help of people like you, our calendar does not get made. Our team of seven trans* artists have already completed all of the photography, illustration and design and we've begun the process of proofing for print. This Indiegogo campaign allows us to cover the costs of printing and production, and without it- we can't go to press. 

COMMUNITY 100% of our profits support trans* people and communities directly. You help us provide trans* artists with paid work as well as a way to proudly display art which they have full control over. 50% of our profits are used towards our project needs and goals- of which community building is a big one.  

FUNDRAISING In addition, the other 50% of our profits are split up between any of our project members in need to put towards their gender transitions- helping them to significantly improve their quality of life. We take care of each other. 


(We define trans* people as anyone whose gender identity does not match the identity they were assigned at birth.) 

SUPPORT THE TRANS CALENDAR PROJECT! 

____________________________________________________________________________
Make this project happen! 

DONATE. 

Because this project does not happen without your support, to say THANKS we have some special offers just for crowdfunding backers! We are offering our calendar for pre-sale at a special reduced price, and we've got some amazing limited edition perks, too! Check out the panel at right and keep checking back for special new bonus perks, contests and prizes throughout the campaign. 

TALK. 

Tell your friends about us and our campaign! If you make a YouTube video telling people about the project- we'll share it in our campaign's media gallery and on our social media! Just send the link to us via any of our social media pages or e-mail: thetranscalendarproject@gmail.com

SHARE. 

Share this campaign with your friends on your social networks, e-mail and good old fashioned word of mouth. A huge part of our project is visibility, so the more our message gets seen the more we achieve that goal. Be sure to find and follow us on our various social media accounts, linked at the bottom of this page. Stay tuned for details about a contest with prizes for the person with the most referrals!



WHY US? 

__________________________________________________________________________

This is our third year of operation. We've grown and changed over the years, but we are the same team behind both The Trans Calendar Project 2014 and The 2013 YouTube FTM Calendar. To date, we've printed and distributed nearly 1,000 of our calendars across the globe. We've exceeded our campaign goals and made it onto the Indiegogo front page each year. Because of this, we've been able to help eleven trans* identified people pay for their gender transitions- things like legal name changes, gender affirming surgeries and hormone therapy. The remaining profit has gotten us HERE- our third year of production! We're hoping you can help us keep this ball rolling for years to come. 



OUR GOALS. 

____________________________________________________________________________

Our Indiegogo crowd funding goal of $11,000 is to cover our current project essentials- printing of our 2015 calendars and all of the photography, illustration and design work. It also covers the costs of this campaign: manufacture and distribution of all our perks,  as well as taxes and third party fees incurred by indiegogo and paypal. 

STRETCH GOAL #1: $15,000
At this level, we'll be able to fund many of our basic project needs for the coming year- keeping the bills paid. It would also mean starting off with over $1700 to distribute for transition expenses.

MEET THE ARTISTS. 
__________________________________________________________________________

Matisse Verheyden is a Montreal based artist who has worked on various projects such as animated tv-shows, featured-length film and video games. He finished his studies in 2D animation in 2011 and has always had the desire to create art supporting causes dear to his heart. He is grateful for the opportunity to be involved in The Trans Calendar Project as cover illustrator and extremely happy to give back to the community.

Alexander Haney is a Toronto artist and entrepreneur. He has studied photography and visual art at both Mohawk College and Ryerson University. Alex enjoys creating in many forms, and is especially interested in combining art making with community building. In addition to working for the Trans Calendar Project and doing freelance art and consulting, Alex is active in multiple ventures supporting the LGBTQ2S communities. 

Phoenixx is a 23 year-old designer based in the U.S. After getting his Master's in Architecture, he has decided to focus his skills on more artistic projects. Since graduation, he has worked on everything from book covers to branding and more. Phoenixx is excited to be a part of the calendar this year as both a model and designer.


Meredith Talusan did her MFA in Photography at California College of the Arts, and has exhibited in New York, Boston, and San Francisco. These days you can find her photographs and writing about trans issues at aselfmadewoman.com



Wynne Neilly is a Toronto based visual artist working mostly within the queer and trans communities that surround him. Wynne graduated from Ryerson University's Image Arts program in 2012 and since then has had two solo shows and has had feature articles on various news/blog websites such as Xtra!, Huffington Post, Upworthy, Refinery29, and Feature Shoot. He is one of the photographers working on the Trans Calendar Project this year and is motivated to make this successful in order to give back to the trans* community.

Trytten is a self-taught photographer who started their own portrait business at the age of 15. They have been published in magazines such as InPrint and FUZE before the age of 18.  Trytten is the West Coast photographer for TCP 15 and is so delighted to give back and become more involved in the trans community beyond Youtube.


Get introduced to the rest of our team on our website, or check out our video introductions in the gallery at the top of this page!

story:
You are invited to help take part in this photographic journey

My name is Ilan Wittenberg and I am the photographer behind these eye-opening photographs. This campaign endeavours to get a phenomenal project off the ground by raising funds to enable me to exhibit my work and to allow the spark that photography ignites in my spirit to be shared with everyone.
“You don't take a photograph, you make it” - Ansel Adams


The Budget

A project that touches people in a profound way means a lot of passion and enthusiasm is involved. These images were born from a unique perspective. However, to enable individuals to be exposed to my artwork and the ideas behind those creations, I have to raise funds, which will enable the exhibition to happen. Below are the estimated costs.

Item Description

Cost

Venue hire $287.5/day x 11 days

$3,162

Printing 30 A1 size photographs on luster paper, matting and mounting on 40 x 32” foam boards

$3,841

Printing 30 A4 size photographs on luster paper, matting and mounting on 50x40cm foam boards

$1,162

Hire of 36 projectors to light the venue including dimmers, power supply, installation and transport

$3,790

Hire of an audio visual [AV] projector and Box Truss to put it on

$690

Hire assistant to attend the venue during opening hours 12 days, 10am-8pm 12x10x$15

$1,800

Assistants to prepare the exhibition, promote the event and setup the venue 300hrs x $15

$4,500

Printing invitations 3000xDL size and 1500 postcard size

$2,155

Purchasing envelopes x 2000 for invitations

$667

Postage 80c x 200 envelops contain invitations (most will be handed personally)

$160

Opening night catering: wine, cheese, nibbles, etc.

$1,400

30 Velcro Command Strips to attach mount-boards to exhibition walls 30x$29

$870

Printing 150 exhibition guides on four, double-sided colour papers (600 papers total)

$954

Indiegogo commission + fees

$4,200

Total:

$29,353

“The two most important days in your life are the day you were born and the day you find out why” – Mark Twain


What is this project all about?

Photography is a portal into the imagination of the photographer, which can be uniquely interpreted by each individual who sees it. Black, White and Colour explores portraiture, landscape and fine art by delving into classic compositions and abstract creations. With your support I can move, touch and inspire all those who visit the exhibition free of charge.

Not only is Black, White and Colour taking place in one of Auckland City’s most unique and intriguing industrial spaces, it presents a carefully selected array of images that will arouse the viewer’s curiosity. After carrying out my own journey, I became a passionate and enthusiastic photographer. The photographs in Black, White and Colour demonstrate the potential that photography has to change the way we see the world.


What this exhibition aims to achieve is a display of images that lets the audience engage, without any restrictions; breaking down boundaries between people and art. The magic of this photography is that it contains insight into the way I see the world and can be interpreted by the audience regardless of who they are and where they come from. These images will connect people in a unique way based on their own personal perspectives.


Your Chance To Be Part of Something Great

To ignite the magic and enable this exhibition to take flight, it needs your support in preparation for lift off.

The funds raised from this campaign will be the source of life for the exhibition and enable it to travel from the initial venue to other exciting public spaces around the world. It would be an incredible opportunity to be able to bring this vision to life. By making this exhibition available to spectators for free, people can take time out of their busy lives to enjoy, to engage and to be inspired by these photographs through their own eyes.

This exhibition will bring people together and showcase the beauty that our world has to offer.

By contributing to this project, you are bringing change to the way people interact with art and each other. The context of an artwork can dramatically affect the way that creation is interpreted. Silo 6 is a space that commands attention and by exhibiting Black, White and Colour in this setting, I seek to conjure distinct responses to my work. The crisp photographs echo the architectural space of Silo 6.


A Photographer Worth Helping

It is a wonderful sentiment to hear the enthusiasm and joy photography can bring to our lives; here are some of the feelings that my work has brought to others:

“Thank you Ilan for sharing your moving and very timely portraits with me. Your empathy with your subjects and your photographic treatment of them shows not only an understanding of the veterans but also the connection you made with them and the trust they show in you as their photographer. Congratulations on this relevant body of work.”

Clive Bartleet Art (Photography) – Assistant HOD, Rangitoto College

“Ilan skillfully managed to capture precious moments at our special family event, bringing with him not just the camera but passion, sense of humor, patience and love. A true artist with a camera, Ilan created beautiful photos that are joyful to watch again and again!”

Carmit and Shai Aharon

 ”Ilan is an exceptionally talented photographer who maintains a high level of professionalism and customer service. He listens to customer preferences and desired outcomes and applies his skill set with focus and humour to deliver beautiful pictures. His portfolio of work ranges from high art to professional portraits, all handled with care and respect for the customer.”

Thomas Edwardsen – Foreign Service Officer at U.S. Department of State 

“Ilan is the most passionate and artistic photographer I have worked with. He provides an exemplary service in a great studio whilst making you feel completely relaxed. His work is outstanding. Pure talent.”

Hannah Sinden

Awards

I have been lucky enough to be recognized for my passion for photography by winning awards. These have encouraged me to take my photography to the next level, to pursue my dream and to exhibit my work.

2014

•  Gold UPI medal for 'The Boulders' from Danube Photo Club: RTANJ Digital Circuit

•  Champion Image  for the triptych‘Silo Six′at the Nelson National Triptych Salon

•  Gold FIAP medal: the Photo Association of Serbia had 1,344 images submitted for the Nature category by 340 photographer from 56 countries.

•  Awarded the distinction Associate of the Photographic Society of New Zealand after submitting a portfolio of 12 portraits to the PSNZ Honours Board.

•  The Shirley Peverill Memorial Trophy with a Gold medal for the Best Photojournalism Print for my image ‘The Scholar‘

•  Awarded a PSNZ Bronze medal for the image titled ‘Zebra Looking Down’ - Digital Monochrome category

•  Gold PSA medal for ‘The Scholar’. The image came first out of 2,128 photos, submitted by 534 authors from 61 countries in the Monochrome category of the competition: “Ecological Truth 2014”.

•  North Shore National Salon of Photography:  one Highly Commended & seven Acceptance awards

•  Tauranga Audio-Visual Salon – Acceptance award for the AV ‘Lest We Forget’

•  Awarded the International Association of Art Photographers [IAAP] Silver medal from International Salon in Serbia

2013

•  North Shore National Salon of Photography: Two Bronze medals, one Highly Commended & nine Acceptance

•  Natex: Four Selected Awards

•  NZIPP Iris Awards: One Silver Distinction, six Silver and one Bronze award.

•  Awarded the distinction Master of The NZIPP

•  NZIPP: Finalist Portrait Classic Category

•  NZIPP: Finalist Portrait Creative Category

•  AIPP APPA: Two Silver and one Silver Distinction

2012

•  North Shore National Salon of Photography: Two Bronze medals, one Honours & nine Acceptance NZIPP Iris Awards: One Silver Distinction, two Silver and five Bronze awards

•  NZIPP Accredited Member

•  Awarded the distinction Associate of The NZIPP

Association of Serbia had 1,344 images submitted for the Nature category by 340
photographer from 56 countries.
• 
Awarded the
distinction Associate of the Photographic Society of New Zealand after
submitting a portfolio of 12 portraits to the PSNZ Honours
Board. 
• 
The Shirley Peverill
Memorial Trophy with a Gold medal for the Best Photojournalism Print for my
image ‘The Scholar‘
• 
Awarded a PSNZ Bronze
medal for the image titled ‘Zebra Looking Down’ - Digital Monochrome
category
• 
Gold PSA medal for ‘The Scholar’.
The image came first out of 2,128 photos, submitted by 534 authors from 61
countries in the Monochrome category of the competition: “Ecological Truth
2014”.
• 
North Shore National
Salon of Photography:  one Highly Commended & seven Acceptance awards
• 
Tauranga Audio-Visual Salon – Acceptance
award for the AV ‘Lest We Forget’
• 
Awarded the International Association of
Art Photographers [IAAP] Silver medal from International Salon in Serbia



2013
• 
North Shore National Salon of Photography: Two Bronze
medals, one Highly Commended & nine Acceptance
• 
Natex: Four Selected Awards
• 
NZIPP Iris Awards: One Silver Distinction, six Silver
and one Bronze award.
• 
Awarded the distinction Master of The NZIPP
• 
NZIPP: Finalist Portrait Classic Category
• 
NZIPP: Finalist Portrait Creative Category
• 
AIPP APPA: Two Silver and one Silver Distinction
2012
• 
North Shore National Salon of Photography: Two Bronze
medals, one Honours & nine Acceptance NZIPP Iris Awards: One Silver
Distinction, two Silver and five Bronze awards
• 
NZIPP Accredited Member
• 
Awarded the distinction Associate of The NZIPP

story:
Hello! My name is Molly Rossman and I am a recent graduate of Central Michigan University. There I studied Art and Design with two minors in Interior Design and Multimedia Design. I founded and ran a game design club for four years as well as maintained a 3.5 GPA. I chose a path that I am passionate about and I have no regrets about it whatsoever. However, the job market for design positions has been fairly dry over the past several months and so I have to be more creative than ever to fund a trip that is incredibly important to me. 

This campaign is purely for fun - I'm not part of a charity or trying to support an important cause other than my own art and the work of a "starving artist." However, if I make my goal I will donate $200 of it to the H. H. Dow High Art program in Midland, MI - the place where I started my professional artistic journey. 

Absolutely ANY amount helps. ANYTHING you can give I will cherish as an exceptional gift and I truly value even the consideration. The friends I'm meeting with in Chicago have been my lifeline over the past 8 months and kept me in positive spirits as well as fully supported my artistic nature. I want to work hard for the chance to meet up with them and cherish our time together. Thank you so much for taking the time to check this out and I hope you consider donating to my cause.

story:
My name is Abby Heingartner, and I love clay. I first discovered this in a high school ceramics class, and since then I've moved from studio to studio, even traveling as far as West Africa to study and learn about clay.

While each of these studio communities have taught me something valuable, I've longed to have a space all my own. With two day jobs, it can be difficult to squeeze studio time in when I have to account for travel, set up, and clean up time. Furthermore, timing is key in ceramics--I need to monitor my pieces carefully as they dry so that I can intervene at just the right time, and this is challenging when my studio is not close by. 

This has led me to the conclusion that it's time to set up a home studio. I'll be using the screened porch off my apartment to do so (don't worry, there's a heater in there!). Much of my work begins on the potters wheel, and this is the most expensive piece of equipment I'll need to buy. I'll be getting a Shimpo VL-Whisper wheel, which will cost me around $1000. Other more minor costs will include shelving, buckets, and a wedging board. All donations to this campaign will go directly toward these costs. Any money raised beyond the campaign goal will be put towards purchasing clay and paying for firing costs. I will continue to glaze and fire my work at the Potters Shop in Needham, MA, where I have been working since March 2017.

This home studio will allow me to maximize my creative time and continue making hand-crafted pottery to share with people like you! When you back my campaign, you can choose from many different perks, including a mug, serving dish, and private wheel throwing lesson. For a better idea of what my work looks like, check out my website or my etsy page. If you want to support my campaign but don't want a piece of pottery, you can also just click the pink "Back It" button near the top of the page and choose an amount to donate. 

Please help me spread the word by sharing my campaign however you can--through social media, word of mouth, etc. The link to share is: https://igg.me/at/abbyswheel. You can also follow along with what I'm doing on Facebook and on Instagram.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Short Summary

I delved into the world of plants and herbs during my last semester at Massachusetts College of Art + Design in 2012. since then I have worked at Tower Hill Botanic Garden, in Boylston MA then moved on to the Southwest and have been landscaping, studying herbalism, and working in a Nursery since 2015.

while in New Mexico I designed the Tarot of Plants, a tarot deck that had been in the back of my mind since early 2012. in October 2015 i finally made that vision a reality, and with the help of a previous indiegogo fundraiser was able to get the amount in the bank to start off my first order (it's really pricey to get a 78 card deck printed!).

since the deck has been released I've had numerous opportunities open up, allowing me to finally fully immerse myself into the art/retail/mystical world of my dreams. three years later i'm itching to create something new, but i can't do it without your help!

 

What We Need & What You Get

like i said above, printing tarot cards isn't cheap.

right now the black decks, with a hard box and poker-sized cards cost $1385 for 100. this is a smaller sized deck than your standard tarot cards, and it doesn't include any informational booklet (there are two cards included that give a breif description of some of the information on the cards, all the card meanings are online for free, or you can order a $4 PDF or $8 print book for all the information in one spot).

in making this full-color deck i want to have it be more luxurious and ornate compared to the casual nature of the previous cards.

things that will be added to the full-color Tarot of Plants:

  • watercolor plant illustrations
  • full Tarot-sized Deck (2.75"x4.75")
  • informational booklet- will include what the information the 2 instruction cards had on it as well as a brief cheat sheet for the 78 card meanings.
  • gold edging on the cards

with all these editions it easily raises the cost for 100 decks to over $2000

once printed, the decks will go for $59/each or $35 wholesale, and with the success of the previous deck i am confident once they're out in the world i will be able to sustain the cost/demand.

however, in order for me to have the free time to be a creative person, half the year i choose to  have a very minimal lifestyle. Taos is a wonderful place with both the charms of a big city but the feel of rural life- and sadly the job opportunities are often scarce. Without the help of indiegogo to create a pre-sale campaign i don't have the $2100 to invest upfront.

if i do not reach my goal any money raised will go towards buying the decks and i will attempt to find the money for the difference- it will just affect my planned release dates, and cause me to possibly miss the holiday buying season

any additional money will go towards stocking more product for the holiday season (Black/white decks, tarot guides, and hopefully new Totes, and a new crystal guide).

 

The Impact

right now I have sold over 300 decks via etsy, and am in 10+ shops around the country.

Everyday Magic in Durham, NC has been a powerhouse of selling, and 4 shops have signed on this year alone. I have also branched out to do Tarot Reading events and Classes in both Massachusetts & New Mexico and hope to travel to other areas and do the same.

ever since i raised the first $800 needed to release the first deck, i have been keeping the business self-sustaining. in the past year i have gotten better at having the money on hand for the next order, however it is tricky for me to come up with the larger sums to start new projects.

 

Risks & Challenges

the biggest challenge for me is the finances. i haven't looked into (and honestly shy away from) any kind of business loans that could help me get the large sum together that could finance a foundation and variety of products i could have on hand.

the "work two (or three) job" route is one that is quite familiar to me, for years and years i tried this approach. when i moved out to New Mexico i took the opportunity to take a step back, and change this outlook- allowing myself more free time, and being more creative with my income (odd jobs, etsy, etc.) and i have found myself to be more productive.

however i manage to do a lot on very little. even if this campaign doesn't raise the money i need i am confident i have the discipline and drive to make it happen....

....it just might not be until fall 2019

 

Other Ways You Can Help

if you can't financially help there's still plenty you can do!

you can share this campaign, or even my etsy! you can request local shops in your area that my deck would fit in with! you can even just send me a message saying "i support you". follow on instagram or facebook- there's still so much you can do!

story:
Tonie Goes To Africa...

For a couple of years now, I have been a volunteer with Caleb's Hope (CH). Caleb's Hope is a non profit org working with women and children affected by war in Atiak, Uganda. 
An opportunity has been presented to me to travel to Uganda (at the end of November) to meet the wonderful women I have heard SO much about, and train them to use jewelry making tools. This will give them the skills to make more elaborate jewelry with their paper beads. Currently they make beautiful paper bead necklaces. The Paper Bead Campaign is called Nayara meaning "my daughter" in Acholi. 

What is needed...
What is needed is money. The money raised will pay for my travel, food and lodging. The cost will range anywhere from $2500 to $4000 depending on costs of flights etc. I have aimed high and set the goal at $4000. I am doing this with the intention to keep my costs as low possible and have extra money. The extra money will be a donation from my generous friends and family to the women of Caleb's Hope. 

With this money they will be able to buy goats, which not only gives the women and their children nourishment,  but they can also earn extra income by selling goats milk. 

HOPEFULLY  <<fingers crossed>> there will be enough money to also put towards the school, which is the next CH build. Last year, Holly (CH founder) and a group of Architects For Humanity traveled to Atiak, teamed up the the Atiak Technical School and built 20 new homes for the ladies. 

Now they need a school. The children are very proud to go to school. They look at education as a gift and do NOT take it for granted. Currently their school consists of some benches under a tree.

I will also be fundraising in other ways... Speedway 660 has been generous enough to let me run a fundraiser breakfast at their big labour day weekend race. So, if you are there come have breakfast $5 will get you a breakfast sandwich and a coffee. I also am working on some raffles... stay tuned for more details about the raffles.

SO.... Thank you to everyone who took the time to read this.  A huge thank you to anyone who is able to donate.. Please pass the word on to anyone and everyone who would be interested in donating or even just learning about Caleb's Hope and the women of Atiak Uganda. There are share tools attached - share with your Facebook, twitter etc friends...  I encourage you to read more on Caleb's Hope and all of the projects we have going on in Atiak ... find out more at:  calebshope.org 


I will be keeping everyone updated on Indigogo and Facebook until my trip in late November and as much as I can while in Africa.  (and of course once I get back).
