story:
HELP BIG ORBIT GALLERY FUND THEIR NEXT MAJOR MULTI-MEDIA INSTALLATION

BIG ORBIT GALLERY is a registered not-for-profit art gallery located in Buffalo, NY. We are Buffalo's only true experimental art space and we need your support. Help us maintain our tradition of supporting underrepresented artists and the avant-garde. As public funding for the arts continues to dry up, your support becomes increasingly important. Donate now! All contributions, regardless of the goal, will go towards the production of this project. 

THE PROJECT

A STRANGER IN THE STREET AT THE EDGE OF THE EARTH is a large-scale multi-media installation by DAVID MITCHELL, in collaboration with JOSEPH STOCKER of the band SON OF THE SUN, scheduled to debut during SPRING 2014 at BIG ORBIT GALLERY in Buffalo, NY, then travel to the HVCCA in Peekskill for Fall 2014, with two other venues currently in the works. The project is a large-scale sculpture, combined with multiple film based works, and digital programming, that culminates in a performative musical experience.

THE INSTALLATION is a room sized sculptural environment consisting of an instrument called a mellotron, made from MIDI controlled 16mm film projectors, and three life sized wolf sculptures prowling around a car. Inside the car's cockpit there will be a holographic projection of the universe and suspended above the car a large mirror ball. The mellotron will be output through amplifiers that will surround the sculpture. Throughout the course of the exhibition there will be a series of live performances featuring Joseph Stocker playing the 16mm mellotron, accompanied by other guest performers.

CHECK OUT THE GALLERY TAB AT THE TOP OF THE PAGE FOR MOCK-UPS AND VIDEOS.

THE INSTRUMENT is a mellotron type synthesizer constructed out of twelve 16mm optical sound film projectors. Each film will have a tone or sample recorded to its soundtrack representing a single note within the twelve-tone scale. Each film will also contain visual information, short narrative vignettes and scenes, which will loop in various durations. The projectors will be controlled by a MIDI keyboard connected to special MIDI interfaces that will allow the projectors to be powered by corresponding keys on the keyboard. If the note A# is played on the keyboard, the projector containing the film with the A# tone will begin to play, so on and so forth. Chords, rhythms, and/or a variety of samples will form the composition via the triggering of multiple projectors.

The projectors will be output to guitar amplifiers, each outfitted with a set of effects processors. Manipulation of the instrument to create musical compositions will be carried out in two ways: through the physical playing of the MIDI keyboard itself and/or by manipulation of the processors connected to the amplifiers. Since MIDI is programmable, via computer software, the instrument will be capable of playing a pre-recorded musical program without the presence of the composer. This will allow manipulation of the effects processors in real time, as an improvisational tool, or to preset the processors for a variety of compositional possibilities.

JOSEPH STOCKER will write the score for the films using the instrument. His composition will dictate the order in which the films play.

THE FILMS will feature critically acclaimed stage actor TIM NEWELL. They address themes of fear, God, nature, death, and the universe; themes that have been at the forefront of philosophical thought since the beginning of humanity. Though rapid advances in science and technology have heightened our knowledge of the cosmos, these are still times of uncertainty. The intention is to provide a contemporary context, using a visual language akin to the standard movie trailer or music video, to address classical existential themes that are equally relevant today as they were thousands of years ago.

The protagonist (TIM NEWELL) believes that he can hear communications from the moon. The moon communicates through infrasound via the tides. He is unaware of the cause, whether alien, God, or the moon itself as a living entity. This causes an existential dilemma, and what appears to be obsessive and irrational behavior. The protagonist can’t distinguish whether it is real or imagined. The moon begins to affect wolves, dogs, and coyotes. They follow the protagonist but it is unclear whether they are chasing him or if he is leading the pack.

The film is cut into a series of 12 discreet scenes, or shots, with no distinguishable order; it is fractured and nonlinear. This is analogous to the protagonist’s psychological condition.

THE PERFORMANCES will take place throughout the course of the exhibition. JOSEPH STOCKER, along with a variety of invited musicians, will perform with the instrument, either improvisationally or rehearsed. The pre-programmed musical score will be accompanied with live instruments during each performance. Some performances will feature the live manipulation of the instrument. Throughout the course of the exhibition, during normal gallery hours, the pre-programmed score will play so that visitors can experience the installation in a more intimate setting. A schedule of performances and guests will be determined at a later date

FUNDING for the larger elements, in part, will be provided by CEPA and BIG ORBIT GALLERY through NYSCA and other granting agencies. Grants have also been submitted to HARPO FOUNDATION and NYSCA’s INDIVIDUAL ARTISTS PROGRAM for FILM AND INTERACTIVE MEDIA.

YOUR HELP IS NEEDED!

The total budget for equipment, supplies, filming, and production is projected to be over $20,000.The more we can raise through crowd-funding the less we have to rely on grants and the easier it will be to afford additional guest performers, travel expenses, artists fees, and support for the gallery.

SO KEEP GIVING BEYOND THE GOAL!

 

WHAT YOU'LL GET

For supporting the project we have decided to give incentives for certain donation levels. Consider your donations as a pre-release purchase of some really great artwork.

$5 & $10 DONATIONS will receive our deepest gratitude and the satisfaction of knowing that you helped in the production of an independent exhibition.

$25 DONATIONS will receive one 8”x12” stamped and numbered film still print in an edition of 1,000.

$50 DONATIONS will receive a special exhibition catalog. The catalog will be a 10” Vinyl Record picture disc featuring a mirror ball on the A-side and an etched image of the moon on the B-side, packaged in a gatefold album cover with liner notes. The album will include JOSEPH STOCKER’s musical score, liner notes, and a special HD video download of the films. The films will be edited into a single video allowing the record to be played on a record player as musical accompaniment to the video. These will be stamped and numbered in an edition of 500.

CHECK OUT THE GALLERY TAB AT THE TOP OF THE PAGE FOR MOCK-UPS OF THE ALBUM AND BOX SET!

$100 DONATIONS will receive the exhibition catalog plus a hand signed and numbered 8”x12” film still print in an edition of 100.

$250 DONATIONS will receive a special box set edition of the exhibition catalog that will include a custom made hard case containing the exhibition catalog, a DVD of the films, plus (12) film still prints (one for each film). These will be hand signed and numbered in an edition of 100.

$500 DONATIONS will receive the special box set plus a 16”x20” film still print. These will be hand signed and numbered in an edition 20.

$1000 DONATIONS will receive the special box set, a 20”x30” hand signed and numbered film still print in an edition of 10, plus a private viewing of the exhibition with the artistsfor you and a guest. You and a guest will also receive priority seating at all of the Big Orbit performances.

$2500 DONATIONS will receive the special box set, a 30”x40” hand signed film still print in an edition of 5. You and a guest will recieve priority seating at all of the Big Orbit performances, plus a private viewing, and dinner with the artists.

All items will be delivered on or after opening night of the exhibition. The option will be available to have them shipped to your home, or picked up at the gallery.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Get the word out and create some noise about the project. Share this with your friends, family, fellow art enthusiasts, and aquaintances. Use the share buttons! One click goes a long way.

 

THANK YOU! 

 

VISIT US AT:

www.david-mitchell.com

www.cepagallery.org

www.bigorbitgallery.org

www.sonofthesunmusic.com

THE INSTALLATION is a room sized sculptural environment consisting of an instrument called a mellotron, made from MIDI controlled 16mm film projectors, and three life sized wolf sculptures prowling around a car. Inside the car's cockpit there will be a holographic projection of the universe and suspended above the car a large mirror ball. The mellotron will be output through amplifiers that will surround the sculpture. Throughout the course of the exhibition there will be a series of live performances featuring Joseph Stocker playing the 16mm mellotron, accompanied by other guest performers.
CHECK OUT THE GALLERY TAB AT THE TOP OF THE PAGE FOR MOCK-UPS AND VIDEOS.
THE INSTRUMENT is a mellotron type synthesizer constructed out of twelve 16mm optical sound film projectors. Each film will have a tone or sample recorded to its soundtrack representing a single note within the twelve-tone scale. Each film will also contain visual information, short narrative vignettes and scenes, which will loop in various durations. The projectors will be controlled by a MIDI keyboard connected to special MIDI interfaces that will allow the projectors to be powered by corresponding keys on the keyboard. If the note A# is played on the keyboard, the projector containing the film with the A# tone will begin to play, so on and so forth. Chords, rhythms, and/or a variety of samples will form the composition via the triggering of multiple projectors.
The projectors will be output to guitar amplifiers, each outfitted with a set of effects processors. Manipulation of the instrument to create musical compositions will be carried out in two ways: through the physical playing of the MIDI keyboard itself and/or by manipulation of the processors connected to the amplifiers. Since MIDI is programmable, via computer software, the instrument will be capable of playing a pre-recorded musical program without the presence of the composer. This will allow manipulation of the effects processors in real time, as an improvisational tool, or to preset the processors for a variety of compositional possibilities.
JOSEPH STOCKER will write the score for the films using the instrument. His composition will dictate the order in which the films play.
THE FILMS will feature critically acclaimed stage actor TIM NEWELL. They address themes of fear, God, nature, death, and the universe; themes that have been at the forefront of philosophical thought since the beginning of humanity. Though rapid advances in science and technology have heightened our knowledge of the cosmos, these are still times of uncertainty. The intention is to provide a contemporary context, using a visual language akin to the standard movie trailer or music video, to address classical existential themes that are equally relevant today as they were thousands of years ago.
The protagonist (TIM NEWELL) believes that he can hear communications from the moon. The moon communicates through infrasound via the tides. He is unaware of the cause, whether alien, God, or the moon itself as a living entity. This causes an existential dilemma, and what appears to be obsessive and irrational behavior. The protagonist can’t distinguish whether it is real or imagined. The moon begins to affect wolves, dogs, and coyotes. They follow the protagonist but it is unclear whether they are chasing him or if he is leading the pack.
The film is cut into a series of 12 discreet scenes, or shots, with no distinguishable order; it is fractured and nonlinear. This is analogous to the protagonist’s psychological condition.
THE PERFORMANCES will take place throughout the course of the exhibition. JOSEPH STOCKER, along with a variety of invited musicians, will perform with the instrument, either improvisationally or rehearsed. The pre-programmed musical score will be accompanied with live instruments during each performance. Some performances will feature the live manipulation of the instrument. Throughout the course of the exhibition, during normal gallery hours, the pre-programmed score will play so that visitors can experience the installation in a more intimate setting. A schedule of performances and guests will be determined at a later date
FUNDING for the larger elements, in part, will be provided by CEPA and BIG ORBIT GALLERY through NYSCA and other granting agencies. Grants have also been submitted to HARPO FOUNDATION and NYSCA’s INDIVIDUAL ARTISTS PROGRAM for FILM AND INTERACTIVE MEDIA.
YOUR HELP IS NEEDED!
The total budget for equipment, supplies, filming, and production is projected to be over $20,000.The more we can raise through crowd-funding the less we have to rely on grants and the easier it will be to afford additional guest performers, travel expenses, artists fees, and support for the gallery.
SO KEEP GIVING BEYOND THE GOAL! 
 
WHAT YOU'LL GET
For supporting the project we have decided to give incentives for certain donation levels. Consider your donations as a pre-release purchase of some really great artwork.
$5 & $10 DONATIONS will receive our deepest gratitude and the satisfaction of knowing that you helped in the production of an independent exhibition.
$25 DONATIONS will receive one 8”x12” stamped and numbered film still print in an edition of 1,000.
$50 DONATIONS will receive a special exhibition catalog. The catalog will be a 10” Vinyl Record picture disc featuring a mirror ball on the A-side and an etched image of the moon on the B-side, packaged in a gatefold album cover with liner notes. The album will include JOSEPH STOCKER’s musical score, liner notes, and a special HD video download of the films. The films will be edited into a single video allowing the record to be played on a record player as musical accompaniment to the video. These will be stamped and numbered in an edition of 500.
CHECK OUT THE GALLERY TAB AT THE TOP OF THE PAGE FOR MOCK-UPS OF THE ALBUM AND BOX SET!
$100 DONATIONS will receive the exhibition catalog plus a hand signed and numbered 8”x12” film still print in an edition of 100.
$250 DONATIONS will receive a special box set edition of the exhibition catalog that will include a custom made hard case containing the exhibition catalog, a DVD of the films, plus (12) film still prints (one for each film). These will be hand signed and numbered in an edition of 100.
$500 DONATIONS will receive the special box set plus a 16”x20” film still print. These will be hand signed and numbered in an edition 20.
$1000 DONATIONS will receive the special box set, a 20”x30” hand signed and numbered film still print in an edition of 10, plus a private viewing of the exhibition with the artistsfor you and a guest. You and a guest will also receive priority seating at all of the Big Orbit performances.
$2500 DONATIONS will receive the special box set, a 30”x40” hand signed film still print in an edition of 5. You and a guest will recieve priority seating at all of the Big Orbit performances, plus a private viewing, and dinner with the artists.
All items will be delivered on or after opening night of the exhibition. The option will be available to have them shipped to your home, or picked up at the gallery.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Get the word out and create some noise about the project. Share this with your friends, family, fellow art enthusiasts, and aquaintances. Use the share buttons! One click goes a long way.
 

THANK YOU! 

 
VISIT US AT:
www.david-mitchell.com
www.cepagallery.org
www.bigorbitgallery.org
www.sonofthesunmusic.com

story:
FLIP - Fertility Love Inspiration Potential

FLIP will be an 8 foot diameter steel mandala that can be FLIP'd over on a central axis. Primarily composed of hand plasma-cut sheet metal, fabricated and welded to a curved steel frame, the mandala will glisten in the sun. By night it comes alive with bright internal illumination, casting intricate patterns on the surface of the playa.  Embracing sacred geometry, this mandala is a window into the soul, holding space for pARTicipants in the complex universe that surrounds us.  People are encouraged to view the sacred proportions and meditate on their own relationship to the world around them. Step up, create intention, FLIP it, and launch the next season of your personal journey.  FLIP will be an easy to move, interactive, human powered kinetic sculpture.

 

 About the artists

   After meeting at Burning Man in 2009, the team of Ruby Bettencourt and Jeff Howe quickly discovered that they shared not only a common desire to create, but also a similar sense of aesthetics and intentions.

    

 

 

Ruby, a seventeen year veteran burner, has a background in jewelery and fashion design, and Jeff is a building designer.  Meeting in the middle between small scale jewelery and large public school buildings, they decided they would make art that combined thier talents while embracing a sense of the sacred.

 

     For Burning Man 2010 they created thier first steel sculpture together, The Kranok.  Inspired by the Metropolis theme and based on a Thai achitectural motif it represented the burning out of our human passions.   Over the summer it was featured at the SF Decompression, Lighting in a Bottle, and Harmony Festival. 

 

     

 

 

     In 2011 they decided to make larger art and seek Burning Man playa placement for their next piece, the Totem.  Seven recycled steel drums, each animal totem representing a Rite of Passage, it rose 21 feet over the playa with an 8 foot steel wingspan at the top.  The symbolic totem pole was very well recieved and has also been touring festivals.  Weighing half a ton and primarily funded by the artists, both Jeff and Ruby relentlesly worked for more than 500 hours to manifest their dream. 

 

 

    Again, they have dreams to make a large steel piece for Burning Man 2012, but the cost of the materials, transportation, lighting, etc., are quickly growing beyond what they can reasonably contribute. 

     

Your generous donations will help to keep the momentum of their creative dance going strong.  They hope that with enough funding they will be able to offset the cost of materials, transportation, and some of the tools required for their work to continue.

Some of the items that your donations will help provide include:

Nearly 1000 pounds of steel

Pillow block bearings

Lighting system

Deep cell batteries and solar recharge system

Structural welding and custom machining

Plasma cutting and welding consumables

Rented workshop space

Rental of a truck and trailer to transport it to and from Burning Man 2012

And also a ton of other small expenses associated with the creation and delivery of a project of this scope

After you have made your contribution please tell your friends, family, neighbors, that rich uncle you have not spoken to in years... about this endeavor.  Please share this on your facebook or twitter, hand it out in the office, hang a sign in a window, or whatever other creative way you can think of to help get the word out. 

FLIP - Fertility Love Inspiration Potential

story:
Short Summary

For 4 years the BSP has been bringing monthly poetry events to the people of Burlington; giving away ca$h prizes, providing an artistic platform and pushing the bar higher for poetry slam and community.

Each of the 6 members (Truth Is ..., Tomy Bewick, Lip Balm, Dan AKA Dan Murray AKA Dan & The P.O.E. W/ Team Manager Nea Reid) are passionate and dedicated community organizers and performers with a fierce competitive spirit.

The 2012 Burlington Slam Project poetry team are winners of the inaugural 2012 SLAMtario championship and the team has placed in the top 5 each year it was eligible to compete in the Canadian nationals. Our team is a heavy favourite to win this year and we have no intentions of letting you feel like you wasted your donation. 

What We Need & What You Get

Saskatoon is expensive! The cost of travel for 6 is about $3600 for the flight & $1000 for the 6 days in the host hotel, that's about $4,600! To prove we are no slackers we have already raised most of the funds, but we can"t afford to go out of pocket to partake in this amazing opportunity. We are asking for your help to raise the last little bit of change, as it feels we have exhausted most of our funding options. 

Some of the cool perks you can receive from us are:

  • Personalized poems
  • Burlington Slam Project t-shirts
  • Live performances
  • Burlington Slam Project season passes
  • Guest list privileges to our send off show 
  • LOTS OF GRATTITUDE

The Impact

The Burlington Slam Project is more than just an event; it is a testament to the power of community arts, as it seeks to bring a spotlight to the SW Ontario poetry circuit and spread the positive transformative power of performance poetry and live theatre.

Supporting this team in it's effort to compete Nationally sends the message to local youth that the arts are connected across the country. Having placed in the top tier for the past 2 years; this year's team is pursuing the final stage in the ultimate hope of being the 2012 Canadian champions.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that sometimes you just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean we can't use your help. It would mean so much to us if you could get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Indiegogo has got cool share tools!

story:
EL Stories: Art on Track

Working with the Waltzing Mechanics and The Cinema Culture we are presenting the live production and recording of "EL Stories: Art on Track".

Here is where you come in, as an attendee of Art on Track not only do you get to watch the smash hit "El Stories", but you also get a chance to be in the movie.

To offset the costs of event supplies, and make a donation to the Waltzing Mechanics & The Cinema Culture for their work in the production.

In fact, every dollar over our goal will go directly towards the Waltzing Mechanics & The Cinema Culture. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We are looking for 4 Brass POles and 2 Velvet Ropes
  • 2 Steadycams
  • Goto the Art on Track web site - click here - There are several other artists groups that could use your help if you're feeling so inclined.

And that’s all there is to it. Thanks!

story:
Hi,

I will be in Shanghai for the month of August preparing for an art show, working with silkscreened images creating an installation on a large wall. Since this opportunity popped up rather unexpectedly Im looking for funding. For those able to contribute to this project I'm offering, in return, my handmade creations. 

Where the money is going,

the campaign goal of $3500 will fund airfare, living expenses, art supplies and other costs involved with making this show happen.

the perks:

postcards, buttons, digital prints, hand-made artbooks, silkscreened prints, original hand drawings and wallpaper prints.. are a big "THANK YOU!" for supporting this project.

 

developing, taking chances, and asking for help

This is a good opportunity for me to develop as an artist and as a person. I'm looking forward to creating something special and unique during my time in Shanghai. Your support will help make this happen. I have taken opportunities in the recent past to expand my artistic pursuits in more personal ways;  this project marks a change for me in presenting something in a more public setting. Your contributions (10 or 20 dollars or more) will help to make this possble. Thanks for taking the time to read this, and for those able to contribute funding I am looking forward to sending you my art work. 

 

thanks!!!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

perks:

 

postcards!!!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

buttons!!!

hand drawing!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, We are YES Edinburgh West, Our campaigning area stretches over a very large geographical area, 
We cover rural west Edinburgh and the suburbs in the West and North West of the city.
We've done wonders so far but we need a little help to get the most out of our campaign in the final month or so.
We want to set up a publicly accessible office and retail space within the centre of our area that will coordinate our campaign leading up to the 18th of September. We have a shop space on St John's Road (The Main A8) in mind. 
Having a campaign base means that there is a central hub from which activists can operate, especially in the last 4 weeks of the campaign. It can be used as a meeting point for activist activity and a focal point for the general public to drop in to ask questions.

What We Need 

We Need an Office Space

  • Edinburgh has some of the most expensive commercial property rental prices in Scotland. Unfortunately Edinburgh West is one of the worst. Rent here is not cheap and empty retail properties are few and far between
  • We've been trying to avoid getting space unless absolutely necessary. It's now necessary, we need a central base for our activists to converge in and for us to project a high visibility to the people of Edinburgh West.
  • We also have other expenses such as electricity, water and rates to pay. 
  • Indiegogo charges a small percentage to allow us to use their platform, this has been considered in our calculations .
And, if you're donating from outside the UK we ask that you don't exceed £500 in total as that wouldn't be a 'permissable donation'.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cannot contribute then please at least tweet, re-tweet, share, share and share again this fundraiser all over social media, especially on Facebook and Twitter. Tell everyone about it.

story:
Short Summary

The Military Park Partnership is pleased to announce the “Adopt-A-Monument” program – an exciting initiative to preserve Newark’s artistic and cultural heritage by focusing on Military Park’s collection of some of the finest nineteenth- and twentieth-century American sculptures, with major works by Gutzon Borglum, Henry Kirke Brown, Jacques Lipchitz, and Karl Gerhardt. Subjected to pollution, vandalism, neglect, and environmental erosion, these treasures have lost their original splendor. They have been identified as needing immediate attention.

The City cannot undertake this mission alone. 

You can read more about this campaign here, or at MilitaryPark.com


What We Need

Here are summaries of the four monuments to be restored, and the costs associated with cleaning and restoring them:

“Wars of America” by Gutzon Borglum: (John) Gutzon de la Mothe Borglum(March 25, 1867 – March 6, 1941) was a Danish-American artist and sculptor famous for creating the monumental presidents' heads at Mount Rushmore, South Dakota, the famous carving on Stone Mountain near Atlanta (he later destroyed it in protest to the KKK’s involvement), as well as other public works of art including a head of Abraham Lincoln, exhibited in Theodore Roosevelt's White House and held in the United States Capitol Crypt in Washington, D.C. “Wars of America”is a "colossal" bronze sculpturecontaining "forty-two humans and two horses". The sculpture sets on a base of granite fromStone Mountain. The sculpture was erected in 1926, eight years afterWorld War Iended, but its intent was broadened to honor all of America's war dead. In describing it, Borglum said "The design represents a great spearhead. Upon the green field of this spearhead we have placed a Tudor sword, the hilt of which represents the American nation at a crisis, answering the call to arms." The “Wars of America” sculpture was added to the National Register of Historic Places on October 28, 1994.

To repair and clean; submit conservation report with photographic documentation; develop maintenance plan: $753,170


“John F. Kennedy” by Jacques Lipchitz: Jacques Lipchitz (August 22, 1891 – May 16, 1973) was a Cubist sculptor.  In the artistic communities of Montmartre and Montparnasse, he joined a group of artists that included Juan Gris and Pablo Picasso as well as where his friend, Modigliani, painted Jacques and Berthe Lipchitz. Living in this environment, Lipchitz soon began to create Cubist sculpture. In 1922 he was commissioned by the Barnes Foundation in Merion, Pennsylvania to execute five bas-reliefs. With artistic innovation at its height, in the 1920s he experimented with abstract forms he called transparent sculptures. Later he developed a more dynamic style, which he applied with telling effect to bronze compositions. The German occupation of France during World War II, and the deportation of Jews to the Nazi death camps, forced Lipchitz to flee France. With the assistance of the American journalist Varian Fry in Marseille, he escaped the Nazi regime and went to the United States.

To repair and clean; submit conservation report with photographic documentation; develop maintenance plan: $26,482


“Philip Kearny” by Henry Kirke Brown: Brown (February 24, 1814 – July 10, 1886)began to paint portraits while still a boy, studied painting in Boston under Chester Harding, learned a little about modeling, and in 1836-1839 spent his summers working as a railroad engineer to earn enough to enable him to study further. He spent four years in Italy; but was never dominated, as were so many of the early American sculptors, by Italian influence.His equestrian statues are excellent, notably that of George Washington (1856) in Union Square, New York City, which was the second equestrian statue made in the United States, following by three years that of Andrew Jackson in Washington, D.C. by Clark Mills (1815–1883), and of Brevet Lt. General Winfield Scott (1874) in Washington, D.C.. Brown was one of the first in America to cast his own bronzes. In 1847, Brown was elected into the National Academy of Design. Among his other works are: Abraham Lincoln (Union Square, New York City); Nathanael Greene, George Clinton, Philip Kearny, and Richard Stockton (all in the National Statuary Hall, United States Capitol, Washington, D.C.); and De Witt Clinton and The Angel of the Resurrection, both in Green-Wood Cemetery, Brooklyn, New York. DeWitt Clinton was the first American full-length sculpture cast in a single piece.

To repair and clean; submit conservation report with photographic documentation; develop maintenance plan: $29,920

“Frederick Frelinghuysen” by Karl Gerhardt: Gerhardt (January 7, 1853 - May 7, 1940) attendedPhillips Schoolin Boston.  In 1874, he went toCalifornia. By 1880, he had returned east to Hartford, and was married to Harriet Josephine Gerhardt, who came fromDalton, Massachusetts. He worked for a time as chief machinist at thePratt and Whitney Machine Tool Companyin Hartford and pursued sculpting in his leisure hours.  He was so successful at sculpting, that in 1881Mark Twainfinanced a trip to study inParisat theÉcole des Beaux-Arts.

To repair and clean; submit conservation report with photographic documentation; develop maintenance plan: $42,710


The Impact 

Centrally-located, historic Military Park is quickly becoming recognized as a symbol of Newark’s potential as a thriving destination of historical importance with the added benefit of being a pleasurable green space. One of the most crucial aspects of this renewal is to guarantee that the park’s important works of art immediately receive the care and preservation required so they can be enjoyed by generations to come. Sculpture in public places infuses vitality into city life. They testify to important figures and events that describe crucible moments and ideals in our shared history.


Sources of Funding 

While we are also doing more traditional fundraising to repair the monuments, we wanted to give the people who live, work, or play in Newark a way to contribute to the ongoing success of the park and participate in an important public art campaign.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can help by sharing this campaign on social media, or just by coming to the park to help make it an active, vibrant, and diverse space!
story_txt:
Short Summary 
The Military Park Partnership is pleased to announce the “Adopt-A-Monument” program – an exciting initiative to preserve Newark’s artistic and cultural heritage by focusing on Military Park’s collection of some of the finest nineteenth- and twentieth-century American sculptures, with major works by Gutzon Borglum, Henry Kirke Brown, Jacques Lipchitz, and Karl Gerhardt. Subjected to pollution, vandalism, neglect, and environmental erosion, these treasures have lost their original splendor. They have been identified as needing immediate attention.
The City cannot undertake this mission alone. 
You can read more about this campaign here, or at MilitaryPark.com

What We Need
 Here are summaries of the four monuments to be restored, and the costs associated with cleaning and restoring them:




“Wars of America” by Gutzon
Borglum: (John) Gutzon de la Mothe
Borglum(March 25, 1867 – March 6, 1941) was a Danish-American artist and sculptor famous for creating the monumental presidents' heads at Mount Rushmore,
South Dakota, the famous carving on Stone Mountain near Atlanta (he later destroyed it in protest to the KKK’s
involvement), as well as other public works of
art including a head of Abraham Lincoln, exhibited in Theodore Roosevelt's White House and
held in the United States Capitol Crypt in Washington, D.C. “Wars of America”is
a "colossal" bronze sculpturecontaining
"forty-two humans and two horses". The sculpture sets on a base of
granite fromStone Mountain. The
sculpture was erected in 1926, eight years afterWorld War Iended, but its intent was broadened to
honor all of America's war dead. In describing it, Borglum said "The
design represents a great spearhead. Upon the green field of this spearhead we
have placed a Tudor sword, the hilt of which represents the American nation at
a crisis, answering the call to arms." The “Wars of America” sculpture was
added to the National Register of Historic Places on October 28, 1994.

To repair and clean; submit
conservation report with photographic documentation; develop maintenance plan:
$753,170




“John F. Kennedy” by Jacques
Lipchitz:
Jacques Lipchitz (August 22, 1891 – May 16,
1973) was a Cubist sculptor.  In the artistic communities of Montmartre and Montparnasse,
he joined a group of artists that included Juan Gris
and Pablo Picasso as well as where his
friend, Modigliani, painted Jacques and Berthe Lipchitz. Living
in this environment, Lipchitz soon began to create Cubist
sculpture. In 1922 he was commissioned by the Barnes
Foundation in Merion, Pennsylvania to execute five
bas-reliefs. With artistic innovation at its height, in the 1920s he
experimented with abstract forms he called transparent sculptures.
Later he developed a more dynamic style, which he applied with telling effect
to bronze compositions. The German occupation
of France during World War II, and the deportation of Jews to
the Nazi death camps, forced Lipchitz to flee France.
With the assistance of the American journalist Varian Fry in Marseille,
he escaped the Nazi regime and went to the United States.
To repair and clean; submit
conservation report with photographic documentation; develop maintenance plan:
$26,482



“Philip Kearny” by Henry Kirke Brown: Brown (February 24, 1814 –
July 10, 1886)began to
paint portraits while
still a boy, studied painting in Boston under Chester Harding, learned a little about
modeling, and in 1836-1839 spent his summers working as a railroad engineer to
earn enough to enable him to study further. He spent
four years in Italy;
but was never dominated, as were so many of the early American sculptors, by
Italian influence.His equestrian statues are excellent,
notably that of George Washington (1856) in Union
Square, New York City, which was the second equestrian
statue made in the United States, following by three years that
of Andrew Jackson in Washington, D.C.
by Clark Mills (1815–1883), and of Brevet Lt. General Winfield Scott (1874)
in Washington, D.C.. Brown was one of the first in
America to cast his own bronzes.
In 1847, Brown was elected into the National Academy of Design. Among his
other works are: Abraham Lincoln (Union Square, New York
City); Nathanael Greene, George Clinton, Philip Kearny,
and Richard Stockton (all in the National Statuary Hall, United States Capitol, Washington,
D.C.); and De Witt Clinton and The Angel of
the Resurrection, both in Green-Wood Cemetery, Brooklyn, New York. DeWitt
Clinton was the first American full-length sculpture cast in a single
piece.
To repair and clean; submit
conservation report with photographic documentation; develop maintenance plan: $29,920


“Frederick Frelinghuysen” by Karl
Gerhardt:
Gerhardt (January 7, 1853 - May 7, 1940) attendedPhillips
Schoolin Boston.  In 1874, he went toCalifornia.
By 1880, he had returned east to Hartford, and was married to Harriet Josephine
Gerhardt, who came fromDalton, Massachusetts. He worked for a
time as chief machinist at thePratt and Whitney Machine Tool
Companyin Hartford
and pursued sculpting in his leisure hours. 
He was so successful at sculpting, that in 1881Mark Twainfinanced a trip to study inParisat theÉcole des Beaux-Arts.
To repair and clean; submit
conservation report with photographic documentation; develop maintenance plan:
$42,710

The Impact 


Centrally-located, historic Military Park is quickly becoming recognized as a symbol of Newark’s potential as a thriving destination of historical importance with the added benefit of being a pleasurable green space. One of the most crucial aspects of this renewal is to guarantee that the park’s important works of art immediately receive the care and preservation required so they can be enjoyed by generations to come. Sculpture in public places infuses vitality into city life. They testify to important figures and events that describe crucible moments and ideals in our shared history.

Sources of Funding 
 While we are also doing more traditional fundraising to repair the monuments, we wanted to give the people who live, work, or play in Newark a way to contribute to the ongoing success of the park and participate in an important public art campaign.


Other Ways You Can Help
 Even if you can't contribute, you can help by sharing this campaign on social media, or just by coming to the park to help make it an active, vibrant, and diverse space!

story:
Our Story

Gallery 18 and Under, dedicated to empowering children through creativity, was started by Florence Hawkins, a south Dallas resident and public school art teacher. Florence realized that teaching children how to express themselves in a positive and uplifting manner through art was a dream she should take outside the classroom. Students were more focused in class if they were rewarded with an exhibit of their work.  Thus, Gallery 18 and Under emerged.


Gallery 18 and Under, located in the Southside on Lamar Lofts, Loft #223 in Dallas, strives to make a difference in each child’s life through art, mentorship, and community. We do this by creating and developing a venue for Dallas’s emerging young artists to exhibit their work and network with other artists and professionals. Gallery 18 and Under paints a vivid picture of the myriad talents of our young artists that brings a vital and unique cultural vibrancy to our city, to the young artists whose work is exhibited and to those come to experience the artwork.

The Impact

This is a very exciting opportunity to give our youth the chance to explore their love of art and better express themselves through creativity and imagination. Our goals are to create a true art gallery, providing young artists of all backgrounds and communities, 18 and under, a place to be successful; to provide a happening cultural refuge for young artist, a place that allows them to create and share with the community; and to invite youth, 18 and under, from other surrounding areas as well as other cities, states and finally reaching around the planet to exhibit in our gallery. Our motto is Be bold. Be unbound. Be imaginative. Be you. 

  

If we do not reach our goal of raising $3,500 we will not be able to fully support the imagination of our young artists. By not supporting them, we are not teaching our children how to create a new and better world.

What We Need & What You Get 

We know that to manifest our aspirations of an an art gallery, we need supplies (pencils, pens, erasers, pencil sharpeners, crayons,  colored pencils, scissors, markers, watercolor palettes, paintbrushes (a variety of sizes), paint palettes, packs of construction paper, chalk, glue, pastels, canvases (various sizes) and aprons/smocks), continued promotion, marketing and capacity-building for our expanding network of young artists, training, and website development.

For your generosity we will provide "Thank you's" for your support and contribution, an invitation to our official gallery opening, or receive a one of a kind piece of artwork, or 18 and Under gallery paraphernalia, or you could have a section of the gallery named after you. How much you get depends on how much you give. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are ready to embark on this journey fostering creativity in young artists so they can see in themselves the power we see in each of their talented hands.   So please spread the word, give what you can, and celebrate the artists waiting to born in our children. I welcome you to be part of something truly special. Looking forward to seeing you at the opening in late November 2011.

story:
We are a group of artists creating a collaborative art space named Broadhope Art Collective.  Broadhope will enable us to exhibit in a shared gallery space, hold classes and workshops, and create artwork in six private studios.  Our space is located in Cheviot, a community with a small-town feel located just seven miles from downtown Cincinnati, Ohio.  

Cheviot was named for the Cheviot Hills located in Southern Scotland by the Scot who settled the area in the late 1800s.  Broadhope is one of those hills, hence our name.  We feel this is a good symbol of what our space will be to this proud, big-hearted community; one important component to a larger whole.  Our intent is to enrich the area with a wide array of visual arts.  We have painters, textile artists, jewelers, potters, mixed media artists, and so much more.  While Cincinnati has a strong reputation for its love of the arts, the West side of town is hungry for more exposure.  The Broadhope Art Collective will fill this need.

The space we've chosen was formerly a salon and spa, and is located on a busy, high visibility intersection in the heart of Cheviot.  It is ready and waiting!  The studios and gallery spots are already claimed by eager artists, ready to share their talents, it simply needs a bit of love before we can open.  All that's left is a little help from you!  We are raising funds to pay for our deposit, gather materials for free-standing gallery walls, and purchase some basic supplies.  We are moving quickly, with the intent of opening at the beginning of October.  In just a few weeks you can see your contribution come to fruition in a vibrant art space open to the community! 

Please be sure to check out the photos in the gallery to see examples of what you will receive from the reward levels, as well as take a look at the "before" photos of the art space.  With your help we'll have "after" photos to show you very soon!

story:
what is the metamorphosis art project?

The metamorphosis arts project is a multi-disciplinary arts program geared towards inner city youth. Students use a theme to create art from three different perspectives: visual arts, drama, and dance. Led by Pasha Mckenley, an accomplished actor and arts educator with over twelve years of experience with at risk youth, and Charles Logan a visual art teacher who is gifted at reaching students with emotional and behavioral disabilities. The metamorphosis art project is a pilot project that hopes to address the arts education crisis that is affecting most US schools today. It is our goal to to create an ongoing program that supports and suppliments arts education in public schools.

what will the students do?

In stage one, students will be asked to choose a medium (photography, sculpture, painting, drawing, etc) to create visual art piece to express how they feel about their topic. This artwork will make up the Visual Gallery of the project.  In the stage two, the student’s artwork will be used as inspiration for a spoken word, dramatic monologue, or play. This will be a part of the Audio Gallery. How does what they did visually sound like?  Stage three will allow the students to explore how there issues feel in their body as a movement or dance piece for the Flow Gallery. Once all three pieces are completed, the students will be ready to showcase their work in a public performance. The audience will walk through the artistic process along with the student from beginning to end, able to see clearly how each stage of the students work influenced the previous work of art to create a cohesive body of work from three different perspectives. A workflow always in motion, morphing, constantly as it refers back to its previous work for inspiration, and to its the future work for its continuation.

why are we doing this?

The goal of the metamorphosis arts project is to enrich and inspire students, helping them realize the possibilities within the arts whether through performing a dramatic monologue, creating a sculpture, or learning how to choreograph their own dance or movement piece. It is our mission to empower our participants by demonstrating that when time and energy is invested in the arts, young people are able to redirect their lives. The metamorphosis art project will provide participants with an artistic forum to deal with issues surrounding ethnicity, socio-economic class, culture, and gender-inequality.

how can you help?

We’d love for you to sponsor a child so that we can provide this opportunity to as many kids as possible. We are launching the metamorphosis art project this summer at a recreation center in Los Angeles and one of the things we need help with is money for art supplies: paint, canvases, brushes, pastels, crayons, paper, clay for sculptures, kilm rental, photography framing and processing, video editing etc. If it makes art, we will need it to serve about 100 kids for the duration of the 8 weeks of this summer camp. (100 x $25 per child in art material fees= $2,500)

To hire additional professional artists to help the students complete their projects. We have the awesome AMY "CATFOX" CAMPION from the Antic's Dance Crew helping the kids with the dance and movement pieces, but we will love to hire two more professional artists to work with the kids develop their work further. We also believe strongly that mentorship is important for both the child and the artist so they can trade experience and expertise in a creative and nurturing environment. (2 artist for 3 hrs per week @ $50 per hr x 8 weeks = $2,400)

We would like to provide each student with metamorphosis arts project t-shirts for the duration of the program. ($15 per shirt x 100 students= $1,000)

Once we finish the art project, we would like to have a presentation of all the students work. At this presentation, we will have an art exhibition and of the visual artwork, some live performances of the poem and dances. We will need funds for rental space to host the event, promotion for advertising and marketing for the show, and catering for about 50-100 ppl. ($1,000)

We are making a short film of the metamorphosis arts project during the 8 weeks camp and the student presentations the night of the Gala. We’ll need help with the cost of filming, editing and make DVD copies for the children once the film is completed. ($2,000 for filming, editing, and DVD copies for all participants)

how will the metamorphosis art project impact kids?

One of the goals of the metamorphosis art project is to create a grassroots infrastructure where young people can explore their artistic talents, build leadership and capacity within their community.  Through the use of their new artistic vocabulary, the students will be able to see their community with a fresh perspective.

This will benefit the society at large as the youth will be less likely to engage in dangerous activities. The metamorphosis arts project will also expose these students to a wider variety of artistic disciplines, giving them the opportunity to broaden their ability to research, investigate, create, and diversify their knowledge of the arts. Once the initial phase of metamorphosis art project is complete, the students who have gone through the process will become mentors to new students in the next term. Passing on their knowledge and experiences to younger artist as part of the “each one teach one” philosophy.

As professional artists, we are always seeking ways in which to challenge ourselves and more importantly, find amazing opportunities that will allow us to be a positive experience in the communites in which we live. We realize as arts educators that we need more role models for young people wanting to explore their artistic talents. The metamorphosis arts project want to become a catalyst that encourages change, transforms lives and develops cultural artistic literacy.

if i donate to your campaign, what's in it for me?

Aside from donating to a worthy cause and helping some well deserving kids express themselves artistically, here are some perks for you becuase we like you already:

$10 makes you a good friend of the metamorphosis art project. And who doesn't need a good friend.

$25 Young Artist Supporter. Supporting a young artist is a great investment.

$100 sponsors a child for th 8 week program and you get a cool metmorphosis  T-shirt. I promise will make you look thinner.

$250 sponsors a child for the 8 week program, an original piece of artwork from your sponsored child and a cool metmorphosis t-shirt.

$1,000 sponsors a  child for the 8 weeks of the camp, an original piece of their artwork, a DVD of the metamorphosis documentary, which will include the final performance, a poster of the best of art work during the project, and a pen becuase you always need a pen.

 

no money to donate? no problem!

We know times are tough so here are some other ways that you can help us out. Maybe you know of a friend or a organization that might be willing to help us or donate something to the project. So, go tell 10 of your friends, co-workers, people in your community, and your grandmother about our project. We'd really really apprecite that and I'm sure your grandmother would love to hear from you!

Please Please Please Comment, Like, and Share our content with others.

Thanks for your consideration!

 

Warm regards,

 

Charles Logan, Pasha Mckenley, Romy Flores, and the young artists you are inspiring!

story:
Thank you very much for contributing to my campaign.

As you can see I came nowhere close to my goal, so with great sadness I must face the fact I will not be able to manufacture my candles, nor open a small store.. Its literally impossible without investment funds.

Back to the drawing board! My future is a mystery now!

However, after the Indiegogo and Paypal fees and conversion charges have all come out of what was raised thanks to your kindness, I will use the funds remaining to purchase a few perfume oils so I can at least pop these beautiful and extremely expensive perfume oils into some handmade soaps and bath salts and make some rollon perfumes and Eau De parfum, all in teenie weenie quantities. Please visit www.virginiahey.com "Perfumery" to order.

Thank you again for your well wishes and contributions.

I will now be fulfilling the incentives, writing the 100 thank you letters and recording the answer machine message for Jaymes and making some product for Richard. Obviously I will not be able to give Richard a luxury Virginia Hey candle, they will be no more now, gone.. so I will substitute the candle with other products.

Thank you again, and much love

xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

x

_______________________________________________________________________________

 

Hello, my name is Virginia Hey, I'm an Australian actress well known across the globe for my roles in Mad Max 2, James Bond Living Daylights, Prisoner Cellblock H and Farscape. www.imdb.me/virginiahey

I've been designing and hand making perfumed products and candles for eleven years now for friends, private customers, for my personal Appearances and Autograph signings..

In the last 2 years I designed and developed and trialed the best of my designs to date.. the most exquisite objet d'art signature natural soy candle in extraordinarily beautiful luxurious embroidered satin and porcelain packaging. Eco-Couture candles with a Conscience!

 Virginia Hey Couture is a stunning example of art meets commerce and heart!

It's time now to leap forward with your help and jump into professional manufacturing, and in doing so, be able to offer the perfect gift that keeps on giving!

                              Virginia Hey Couture

        The Perfect Gift .. When only the best will do!

Via Indiegogo and with your marvelous help I can outsource manufacturing and have 5,000 candles made for me, and launch my first very own small Virginia Hey Couture store that I will man and operate myself.

             _______________________________________________

I'm sure you're wondering why I don’t fund myself?
Unlike USA actors, Australian actors and actresses do not receive residuals, royalties or merchandizing percentages from their acting work within their own country.

Funds coming in every time one of my films or TV series appearances re-plays anywhere in the world go straight back to the producers, so, unlike US actors, there has never been any ongoing royalties rushing in to push large projects forward.

           _______________________________________________

Be a friend of my project and let's help this beautiful work of art leap forward!

My goal is a minimum of $220,000 (including Indiegogo/paypal fees). Brief financial breakdown at the base of this page.

My Virginia Hey Couture candles will not only create jobs, stimulate the economy, and help farmers, but will also help the environment and lives by being a candle that is eco-friendly, kind, charitable, natural and clean.

The only by-product is that my candles bring beauty and joy into lives and homes and hearts!

Those who have loved my handmade creations in the past will tell you that they make everyone smile, they are so gorgeous in every conceivable way.

 

This Indiegogo campaign will enable the most luxurious objet d'art candle line that is based on all things good and beautiful and conscious to leap forward into its very own, very first signature store!

Most natural candles are sold in jelly jars, mason jars and plain glasses with no box, or a flimsy cheap flip top box. Their inner beauty remains, but their outer appearance almost never reflects the stunning nature of an all natural organic soy wax candle..

For some reason it seems that "natural" has a prerequisite toward dowdiness or lack of style and lack of attractive packaging.. "Natural" seems only for the bare no frills look of a dated simplicity.. until now..

Virginia Hey Couture natural Soy candles will not only show their inner beauty and qualities, like all other natural candles do.. but they will also break free of the stigma of plain basic packaging, and reveal an extraordinary outer beauty and elegance, that equal and match their inner beauty!

My candles delight and ignite all the senses.. They are gorgeous to look at.. sensational to touch.. Heavenly to smell.. simplicity to burn.. and kind to Mother Earth!

 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

 
 
 
 
           

A luxury hand crafted Eco-Couture Soy candle with a conscience..

 

Respect:

The utmost respect for life and the life of our planet is in the entire creation of my exquisite candles: 

  • No animal products or by-products are used, nor is any animal harmed or hurt or tested upon.
  • Ecologically kind and intelligent.
  • 100% organic Kosher soy wax grown on USA farms that use sustainable farming methods.
  • No Paraffin by-products are used.
  • No carcinogenics.
  • Non toxic.
  • Lead Free Cotton wicks.
  • Each candle will be individually handmade in the USA or UK using the finest exquisite luxury ingredients.
  • USA and UK grown ingredients.
  • Jobs are created to assist and generate a more stable economy balance.
  •  We will only use factories that offer special shifts for mothers and single parents.
  • No middle man, candles will only be available at the Virginia Hey Couture store, via direct marketing, and via the www.VirginiaHey.com website. Direct relationship with manufacturers and suppliers.

 

Virginia Hey Couture offers a unique sensual experience for the connoisseur of finest perfumed candles and fragrances! Exquisite luxury soy candles with all important natural and ecologically intelligent qualities we crave.

Virginia Hey Couture .. Aromatherapy for mind body soul

  • 8oz net.
  • 6 candle fragrances to begin.
  • 64-72 hours burn time.
  • Each candle contains extravagant exclusive perfumes designed and blended by candle designer/perfumer Virginia Hey.
 

_______________________________________________________________

Video:

Good friends Tom Konkle & Thor Melsted shot this video for me to show you a detailed overview of the candles: 

Virginia Hey Couture candle video

________________________________________________________________

 

“It has been a longtime passion and fever of mine to launch luxury decor products that are respectful of life, body and soul, whilst providing sensual elegance and well-being to inner and outer environments. This makes perfect sense, after all, I come from the world of intelligent beauty.” Virginia Hey

 

             
 
 
Virginia Hey Couture candles and perfumes are designed by Australian ex model, actress, fashion editor, natural therapist Virginia Hey. 

Virginia's designs have been compared to a marriage between Alchemy and Elegance!

One is born with the gift to alight all senses via the magic of creation.. Pure art!  Virginia's couture fragrance designs are crafted and infused with delicious blends of fresh, opulent blossoms, magical resins and jewels from Mother Earth!

Virginia Hey's signature line is a reflection of who she is.. Regal in stature, stately, quirky, creative, sensual, elegant, exotic and romantic with a love for all things Mother Earth!..  

 

Figures Brief Breakdow

Retail candle $58 USD Luxury packaging. 

No middle man, so I can keep prices as low as possible considering the very exclusive expensive packaging and fragrance oils.  (This candle would sell for double at any luxury department store).

The Virginia Hey Couture store will act as a showroom and retail space and as a marketing tool to attract press. Worldwide web sales and direct catalogue marketing will be a strong tool.

Indiegogo Goal $220,000.00

$220,000.00 is the absolute minimum possible, really I need double that.

$ 8,800,00 +   Indiegogo Fees 4% (19,800 9%  if I dont meet goal)
   8,800,00 +   Indiegogo 4% Merchant Transaction Fees
   6,600.00 +   Paypal 3% fees                                                                                
=$24,200.00

$220,000.00  
    24,200.00 -
=$195,800.00  

36,000.00+ store lease. 3000 x 12
20,000.00+ minimal store fittings and decor
12,000.00+ Publicist $1000 x 12
5,000.00+ PR giveaways (handouts to press, TV and celebs etc)                                           42,000.00+ Indiegogo Incentive candles 
=$115,000.00

$195,800.00   
  115,000.00 -
= $80,800.00 for manufacturing 5,000 candles, direct sale catalogues and building a website for the candles.
5,000 embroidered satin pouches, 5,000 embroidered satin boxes, 5,000 embossed porcelain candle containers, perfume oils, soy wax, cotton wicks, labels, shipping cartons and packaging. 5,000 candles hand poured and assembled.

I will manufacture 2500 candles now and 2500 at restock time.

(6 candle fragrances = 406 candles of each fragrance only for each manufacture run) (Not enough, but the minimum to begin with)

 

  Let's all band together to finally get these gorgeous candles into a Virginia Hey Couture store, publicized and selling!!

Virginia Hey Couture is a stunning example of commerce meets art and heart!

   

 There's a saying.. "Good things come to those who wait".. Shouldn't it be "Good things come to those who work DAMN HARD and NEVER GIVE UP!!  :)

Thank you so much for believing in me all these years!
Virginia

_____________________________________________________________________

 

What happenss if I dont meet the $220,000 goal!

If I dont meet my goal I wont be able to manufacture the candles or purchase their very expensive packaging, containers and oils. It all has to be bought in bulk. So the candles will have to go on hold.

If I dont meet my goal of course there will be no tiny store either, I will just retail from my website and complete the cart so I can do so.

If I dont meet my goal I will use any investment funds raised from Indiegogo to engage a publicist if there is sufficient, to promote my current handmade soaps and perfumes, and hopefully be able to purchase small amounts of generic packaging for those products so that I can generate sales and work my way slowly toward being able to get the candles manufactured.

www.virginiahey.com (cart coming)

______________________________________________________________________
story_txt:
Thank you very much for contributing to my campaign.As you can see I came nowhere close to my goal, so with great sadness I must face the fact I will not be able to manufacture my candles, nor open a small store.. Its literally impossible without investment funds.Back to the drawing board! My future is a mystery now!However, after the Indiegogo and Paypal fees and conversion charges have all come out of what was raised thanks to your kindness, I will use the funds remaining to purchase a few perfume oils so I can at least pop these beautiful and extremely expensive perfume oils into some handmade soaps and bath salts and make some rollon perfumes and Eau De parfum, all in teenie weenie quantities. Please visit www.virginiahey.com "Perfumery" to order.Thank you again for your well wishes and contributions.I will now be fulfilling the incentives, writing the 100 thank you letters and recording the answer machine message for Jaymes and making some product for Richard. Obviously I will not be able to give Richard a luxury Virginia Hey candle, they will be no more now, gone.. so I will substitute the candle with other products.Thank you again, and much lovexxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
x

story:
Short Summary:

Hello and thanks for your time! My name is John "Kaskets" Boerrigter, I am a spray paint artist (spacepainter) and apart of several other forms of various arts. I've been a painter for 6 years and have keyed in on several methods to ensure a style all my own as well as excepting all challenges to rise to the chance and learn from every piece. I have performed live at festivals including the trapper creek spectrum festival and the Alaska state fair focusing on live work and technical info from the great Charles Oakley of Anchorage Alaska (www.yosprayme.com) which has prepared me for touring. I have performed, customized and sold more then 100 paintings just since march of 2013 which is why I believe it's time to go on tour! But I'll need your help! I moved to the windy city of Chicago on October 1st to start Project Space Paint and social network to the max with as many artists and fellow painters as possible and with enough support, funding and love from all of my great fans worldwide we can take this to a new level!! This is critical for a new art pilgrimage and adventure and lets not forget I'M FILMING EVERYTHING TO MAKE A DOCUMENTARY ON SPACE PAINTING AS AN EXPANDING ART FORM!!!

What We Need & What You Get:

The funding is necessary for building a down draft table to control fumes at 100% (potentially at indoor shows!), filters and cleaners as well as designing and acquiring a booth for live painting in the festivals across the nation. Proceeds raised will also go towards tour transportation, website design and maintenance, several racks of paints, tools and supplies, a light table, stock of material that I paint on, drying racks, lighting, safety equipment (including masks, mask filters, gloves and gloves in a bottle) for the painter and for the family's watching the performance. Any partial funding achieved (in the event of not reaching our Indiegogo funding goal) will be utilized on safety and supply's at least and we'll just keep on painting as long as possible.

LET'S TALK PERKS!!! (Free insured shipping!)

5$ contribution - A special thanks on FaceBook expressing our gratitude for your contribution to the arts and this campaign.

20$ contribution - Special thanks to you in the Youtube fund raiser success video, Kaskets spray art website and the documentary credits!

50$ contribution - An original John Kaskets 14x22 inch scenery painting of your color choices and a special thanks to you in the YouTube fund raiser success video, website and the documentary credits!!

100$ contribution - An original 22x28 inch John Kaskets scenery painting with your choice of colors and series type! Plus a big thanks in the YouTube video, website and the documentary credits!!!

200$ contribution - An original 22x28 inch custom John Kaskets piece depicting your favorite movie or band! Plus a big thanks in the YouTube video, website and the documentary credits!!!!

500$ contribution - And go big!!! You get: An original 22x28 inch custom John Kaskets piece depicting what ever you like! Free unlimited design consultation included of course! Plus! A limited edition black "Kaskets Spray Art" baseball hat! A special thanks in the YouTube video and website PLUS you'll be labeled as one of the producers in the documentary credits!!!!!

5000$ Maximum contribution!!! - You get a personal live show at your house as we hit your area along the national tour, 3 full sized paintings of your choice and style, 2 limited edition black John kaskets baseball hats, "executive producer' status on the credits of the Spacepainting documentary as well as 'the big thanks' level perk thrown in!!!!!!



The Impact:

With your help I can inspire the creative side in hundreds and thousands of people just waiting to try something fresh. I love my work and I would be touring across the nation over the next two years to help others to see just how easy it really is to become a great artist and bring some color to our lives in a fun and new way and put original works in the hands of everyone because everyone deserves an original! :) You've seen my work now let's show the world!!!

Other Ways You Can Help:

I fully understand how hard it is sometimes to contribute cash to the cause, I appreciate everything you've done for me through my growth as an artist. Please feel free to utilize the Indiegogo share tools and lets raise the volume on this shindig!!! Thanks for everything!!!! -John Kaskets

story:
Milka Ramirez and I, Maritza Nazario founded EnLas Tablas Performing Arts NFP 7 years ago. It was my life long dream to open a community arts program in order to offer arts education at affordable prices for people living in low income neighborhoods where arts education programs were limited. 

A few months ago part of my dream became a reality when we received a grant for renovations. Our studio is small and the physical space limits our enrollment. The grant will create more room, by removing some walls and maximizing the use of the space. A most needed new dance floor will be installed. 

We are very excited about the grant! However, we are also concern because we are responsible for 25% of the total cost. Also, there are various items that we cannot include in the grant expenses and for which we have no money; items such as mirrors, light fixtures, fans, table & chairs, utility sink and a closet to balance the lost of most of our storage space. Additionally, we need about $3,000 in order to make at least two payments to our construction balance of 25% and complete the renovation. We do not have the funds for any of this! We are small and do not receive any grants to help with the program expenses. It is for this reason that we are inviting you to donate to our cause.

Please know that your support, in any amount is tax deductible and will help us to continue to provide quality arts education programing to children and adults who cannot afford them. After the renovation concludes, our space will be able to accomodate more children thus allowing more families to join our program. Please visit our website enlastablas.org for more information about our organization.          

As a token of our appreciation we will gift our donors the following items: personalized thank you letters with photos, dance classes, acting classes, recital tickets and the use of our space foa a small event approved by us.
Also, if you are not able to donate at this time, please know that by helping us
spread the word, you can help us reach our goal.

Thank you in advace for your support and attention!

Maritza Nazario 

Director, Bookeeper, Janitress, Enrollment Specialist &                                           Jane of all Trades                    

( I don't mind to do  it! I love the Arts and I love my community!)

story:
I,Nadia Buyse, have currently been selected to participate in the HOMEBASE PROJECT residency program in Berlin Germany. 

I am trying to collect a total of 7000$ to cover my travel , cost of the residency, materials, and some living expenses so that I am able to go participate in this once in a life time opportunity. Regardless if I reach my 7000$ goal or not I will be going to Berlin so every contribution helps so much… I have planned some fabulous Perks for my contributors! Even though going to Berlin is such an exciting opportunity it does not overshadow the exciting opportunity to appreciate the people who make it possible!

Going to Berlin to create this Popera and to participate in this festival will not only be a chance for me to develop professionally, but will also be a chance to create global connections within the art and music world. I have been fortunate enough to work and perform internationally a multitude of times in the past but I feel that the longevity of this program will allow me to develop work in a different way and it will also allow me the time to create strong relationships with my fellow residents and other artists in the Berlin community.

If you cannot contribute, that is ok! But please spread the word if you can and I thank you so much for your time and consideration.

 

Nadia Buyse is a trans-disciplinary visual artist and musician living in Portland. As a musician, she has been in at least 30 bands she can remember. Nadia has toured the United States and Europe, playing in a range of spaces from music festivals, punk clubs, house shows, and discotheques. She has also exhibited work internationally and nationally, including the MDW Art Fair in Chicago, Beta Spaces in New York, and dOCUMENTA (13). She has recently received an MFA in Visual Studies from Pacific Northwest College of Art and shortly after participated at the ART STAYS residency program in Slovenia, went on a European tour with her multimedia music project DUBAIS, and performed in the Free the Word Tour in the Republic of Georgia.

 

DUBAISPDX.TUMBLR.COM
story_txt:
I,Nadia Buyse, have currently been selected to participate in the HOMEBASE PROJECT residency program in Berlin Germany. 


I am trying to collect a total of 7000$ to cover my travel , cost of the residency, materials, and some living expenses so that I am able to go participate in this once in a life time opportunity. Regardless if I reach my 7000$ goal or not I will be going to Berlin so every contribution helps so much… I have planned some fabulous Perks for my contributors! Even though going to Berlin is such an exciting opportunity it does not overshadow the exciting opportunity to appreciate the people who make it possible!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Philo Northrup and I’m asking you to support a very special road trip, ArtCar Fest visits Reno, Nevada!

ArtCar Fest is an all-volunteer, artist-run event. We're 100% reliant on donations. ArtCar Fest was founded by myself and Harrod Blank 16 years ago, and is directed by Emily Duffy.  All of us are also ArtCar artists.

I’m excited to bring the shared history of ArtCars and Burning Man to Reno, a town that has been integral to this art form’s creation and growth. I need your help to bridge these two ends of the automotive art spectrum together for this one special event.

Harrod curated “Mutant Rides”, an exhibition about the vehicles of Burning Man, at the National Automobile Museum in Reno. ArtCar Fest has been invited to bring ArtCars from around the country to celebrate the “Mutant Rides” closing party on Friday night, July 20, 2012, from 7-10pm.

Additionally, as part of the road trip, ArtCar Fest will be exhibiting at the Nevada Museum of Art, in Reno. At 2PM, Saturday, July 21, 2012  the Museum will present Harrod Blank’s award-winning documentary about ArtCars, “Automorphosis.”

ArtCars bring radical, free expression to the world 365 days per year! This July we want to bring that spirit to Reno. ArtCar Fest is the only event in the world that focuses exclusively on ArtCars, which are street-legal, permanently modified mobile sculptures. ArtCar artists actually drive their mobile sculptures thousands of miles to attend our event, and it’s up to ArtCar Fest to help the artists cover their fuel, lodging, and food costs.

This year, as we visit a brand new city, we especially need ArtCar lovers to help us fund the artists traveling to Reno. Every penny received by ArtCar Fest goes towards the care and support of our artists, and helps bring them together for this popular event. 

Please join us!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $3700 to pay for fuel, food, and beds for ArtCar artists who drive their mobile sculptures from all over the country to join the festival.  Every year we raise what money we can and spend it all on the artists. ArtCar Fest is an all-volunteer, artist-run event.  Founded by Philo Northrup & Harrod Blank 16 years ago, and is directed by Emily Duffy - all of whom are ArtCar artists. 

The only administrative costs will be for taxes, xerox/printing, and the fees charged by Indigogo. 

All donations help keep ArtCars on the road where they bring joy and amazement to millions of people every year.

Donors receive our thanks and a selection of rare ArtCar swag, books, movies and perks.

And for generous donations over $500 contact us about custom perks including ArtCar visits, flying banners on the ArtCars, and being the official sponsor of ArtCar school & hospital visits or even the festival itself.

The Impact

ArtCar Fest is the only event in the world devoted exclusively to ArtCars.

I’ve driven my six ArtCars all over North America and drive them every day to the job and to the store. So I feel qualified to agree with Harvard’s John Beardsley in stating that "ArtCars are the quintessential public art of our time." 

ArtCar Fest will bring international exposure to Reno via press coverage, as our exhibitions have been featured by the Smithsonian and National Geographic channels, The NY times, Washington Post, Wall St. Journal, LA Times, Artweek, Juxtapoz, Wired, Stern and many others.

Our 2003 ArtCar tour was the SF Weekly cover story.  Our 2007 ArtCar tour to Arizona’s Art Car World Museum (founded by Harrod Blank) earned a National Endowment for the Arts award.

Now we want to bring ArtCar Fest to Reno, Nevada and bring ArtCars from around the country to witness Reno’s renaissance. 

The Reno recipe? Combine Burning Man, Silicon Valley, dingbat signage, gambling, Gay Rodeos, Cowboy Poetry and world-class thrift shopping and stir vigorously. Add to the mix the National Automobile Museum (voted one of the world’s best) and the ascendant Nevada Museum of Art (internationally known for its Art & Environment Center), and you’ve looking at the "Biggest Little City in the World."

All you need is ArtCars!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to support ArtCar Artists!

If you have a local Reno business that can help the artists with in-kind donations, please contact me at philo(at)artcarfest.com
