story:
Hello my name is Darren Boerckel

I am a self-taught freelance artist. I have been given the rare opportunity of participating in one of the most prestigious art event of the year called Art Basel. It takes place in Miami, Florida.  Art Basel collectively brings together some of the worlds most talented artists. I am extremely excited about this but need additional funds to make this happen.


Photo Brooklyn Circa 1997 Frank Cirabisi

I have always wanted to be part of Art Basel.  It has been a dream of mine for years. If I can come up with the additional funds, I will be able to turn my dream into a reality.  To be able to show my work during this event will greatly impact my career as a free-lance artist.  Being part of this event will enable me to engage and network with other top artists and buyers, so that I may continue to create new art and make a living at what it is I love to do. 

What I Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise about 1,500 USD to help me bring myself there in a professional realm.

  1. Frame art. 
  2. Ship (UPS) art to the Miami event.
  3. Postcards and flyers for promotion
  4.  Body suits to paint for models to wear.  
  5. Air fare. 
  6. and of course the unseen things that pop up inevitably.

With your donation you will receive Postcards, Art tees, Signed prints from the show. A fully painted body suit. or original piece of art. And a gigantic Thank you filled with love and gratitude.

        "Fear"

Any funding I receive, will go to making this event complete, as well as making a statement. in the space that has been offered to me. I will keep everyone updated daily, regarding my experience as well as behind the scenes footage. Feel free to ask me any questions you may have during the show.

Making a lasting impression

My intention is to show the world my unique artistic style and sell sell sell.  My goal is to get as many people as I can to my space and spread my name. I plan on having 2 people walking around in a full art suit like the images below.



Photo circa 2013, NY Makeup show. Photo Reiner Freese, model Alley,Veronica pinup 


Photo circa 2013 Veronica pin up. Model Katie Chaos.

All this is to help further my career as an artist.  Spread the love, bring joy and keep Art alive in Franklin Square.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like my work and think it should be seen, please forward to your friends. 

They have share tools connected to the indiegogo site to make it easy. Please feel free to share with your friends.

story:
My name is Polly Shindler and I have been painting for 15 years.  I painted for my own enjoyment for years and finally decided to take it seriously and go to Pratt Institute. I got spoiled in graduate school.  They say that 2 years in graduate school is equivalent to about 8 years on "the outside".  The experience granted me time to grow as a painter and I was in heaven.  Nothing to do but paint, paint, paint. 

2 years out, I'm waiting tables and painting in my spare time.  For those of you who know me, I paint better than I do anything else (sadly discounting waiting tables).  To have even a month free to paint at the Vermont Studio Center, I would gain a better understanding of what I'm doing it all for.  Why I have sacrificed health care, a living wage and nice feet.

The funds I raise will, of course, go to residency fees-I did get a small grant and I will work at the Center while I attend to offset some more of the amount.  Then there are supplies, because if I attend, I plan on making A LOT of work.  Then I'll be back on here raising funds for a storage unit.

story:
The Detroit Portrait Series: Writing Our Own History Through Art

The Contemporary Art Institute of Detroit and the Detroit Broadcasting Company seeks your support for a large-scale painting project that provides an artistic medium for the people of Detroit to tell the history of their city.

Howard Zinn’s book, A People's History of the United States, inspired this public outdoor art project which tells Detroit history from the "ground up", honoring leaders and everyday heroes from the city's past and present through large-scale portraiture. Completed panels will be used to board up windows in historic abandoned buildings throughout the city, beginning with the 3-story warehouse on the city's west side.

Painted by Detroit-based mural artist Nicole Macdonald in a bold Fauvist style, portraits will be made on inch-thick recycled wood panels, coated with sealer to withstand the elements, and drilled into window moldings -- framing the portraits and securing the building. This project will serve to invigorate the community by providing thought-provoking art, disseminating local history and eliminating blight.  

Who is featured?

Many great leaders and pioneers of justice, artists and inventors hail from Southeast Michigan and Detroit. The Detroit Portrait Series will bring these faces to life -- large-scale, for the public, and for free -- giving recognition to many great citizens of Detroit, and educating current residents and visitors about the city's rich history.

People of various ethnicities and occupations will be portrayed in this series: Native Americans significant in Detroit prior to French arrival, European missionaries, African-American civil rights leaders, Hispanic labor organizers and current cultural, social and political activists of all genders and persuasions. Part of the allure of the project is that a number of portraits will be instantly recognizable, like high-profile Detroit social-activist politicians John Conyers and Maryann Mahaffey. These more well-known faces will be positioned beside less well-known individuals currently working for justice in today in the city, such as Yusef Shakur and Rev. James Meyer. This combination of faces will provide discovery and revelation for viewers. The idea is that certain faces will draw attention, like Rosa Parks or Malcolm X, who will lend their fame to the equally important faces of Father Clement Kern and homeless-advocate Mother Waddles. 

Where will the portraits be installed?

The site of the first installation is the abandoned historic three-story warehouse at 5729 Grand River, located at the busy intersection of I-94 freeway and Grand River Boulevard. Each painting will be inserted into one of the building’s 16 empty windows, each 10' x 7'. Additional buildings will be chosen based on viewer access, the need for historic preservation and blight removal. Consent will be obtained from each building owner, and funding from building owners or community groups will be sought; a number of buildings and sites are currently under consideration for this project.

Your support:

The portraits are painted, we need your support for installation! $3,000 will pay for cherry picker and generator rental, labor, materials and insurance costs to secure these portraits in the outdoor Grand River gallery site!

Bio of Artist, Nicole Macdonald

Nicole paints and collages her Detroit environment in miniatures and maximums, portraits and landscapes, with brush and camera. Her intimate video portraits of the city range from the award-winning A City to Yourself  to her current project, Last Days of Chinatown, about the history of change in her Cass Corridor neighborhood. 

Why does this project matter?

Art brings life to a neighborhood. The Detroit Portrait Series will bring vitality and energy to a depressed strip on Grand River & I-94, and will board-up a 3-story building that is currently open and a neighborhood eye-sore. The area will be revitalized with portraits, art and history on view for both passing pedestrians and motorists.

A sense of pride will be generated by the outdoor portrait series, as audiences witness their local heroes coming to life on the three-story and nearly 100 ft wall. The portraits should serve as a stimulant for exploration as well -- as viewers will be encouraged to investigate 'the heroes' with whom they are unfamiliar. An awareness of Detroit’s rich cultural heritage will be seen through the variety of ethnicities, backgrounds and struggles of the portrayed individuals.  

EVERY DONATED DOLLAR TO THE DETROIT PORTRAIT SERIES WILL BE GENEROUSLY MATCHED BY THE CHALFONTE FOUNDATION OF MICHIGAN!  For more information about the Chalfonte Foundation please visit:  www.chalfonte.org

story:
Hello!

We are the graduating class of BFA Sculpture students at SUNY Purchase in New York.  We are comprised of 15 sculptors with diverse interest and styles, but with a shared goal of showing our work at Abrons Art Center in the city. (http://www.abronsartscenter.org/about/) 

Our opening is May 20, 2014 from 6pm-8pm.  

We want to use this opportunity to bridge the gap between our undergraduate career and our careers in art.  With this campaign, we are trying to share what we've been working so hard on developing for the last four years to a broad audience, rather than exclusively to our campus community.  We want to put on a show that reflects the amount of effort and consideration we have put into our work, but we need help to make it possible.

We can't afford to mount the show on our own, so we have turned to this campaign in order to make this ambition possible.

Help us launch!

Budget Breakdown:

To mount a show the expenses include:

Installation/transportation: $1,100

Space: Donated

Curator: $500

Beverages: $200

Equipment rental: $600

Postcards: $250

Catalog design: $200

Catalog printing: $500

Wall text: $150

Extras: $250

Total: $3,750

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute financially to our campaign, don't worry!  We, of all demographics, understand!

Indiegogo features campaigns that have the most social media response, so you can help us by tweeting, facebooking, or sharing this link in as many varieties as you can!

You can also come to our opening!  That'd be great too!  Thank you for your support.

story:
Hello out there,

we are the 2014 Urban Legends Poetry Slam Team. A lovable ragamuffin crew of Ottawa Spoken Word Artists selected via competition to represent the good old 613 at the 2014 Canadian Festival of Spoken Word in Victoria. The main event at the Festival is the Spoken Word Poetry Slam Team Nationals held annually at a different city across Canada. Each of us has put in multiple years of work and dedication to get to this point.

The most important thing for a donor to realize is that for us Poetry isn't a hobby it is a way of life. The opportunity to compete, never mind win a National Championship opens so many poetry related doors which may have otherwise stayed closed. It also gives us an opportunity to represent our city on a Nationwide level, and showcase the diversity of the voices within its arts scene. This campaign, will cover just a fraction of the costs required to fly the Team from Ottawa to Victoria, never mind the price for lodging, food and other expenses.

The cost for plane tickets alone is almost $3000, the price of our stay is close to 2000 and the cost of team merchandise and personal expenses raises the total funds needed to around $6000. Currently we have almost half of that. This campaign is just one small step in what is truly a communal effort. We appreciate any support, no amount too large or small in helping us represent Ottawa, and bringing support and recognition to the city and the vibrant arts community.

In return for your support we are excited to share our art with you via the various perks offered for different levels of support. Once again there is no contribution too small, or too big. We would love to exceed these campaign goals as this is only one step in a larger fundraising process. Every dollar raised will go to help this team reach Victoria and compete to bring the National Championship back to Ottawa.

If you are unable to contribute we would appreciate any help you could give us by word of mouth, and/or by sharing with your social media circles. Much love to those who took the time to read this and thank you in advance for your generosity. 

The 2014 Urban Legends Poetry Slam Team
story_txt:
Hello out there,
we are the 2014 Urban Legends Poetry Slam Team. A lovable ragamuffin crew of Ottawa Spoken Word Artists selected via competition to represent the good old 613 at the 2014 Canadian Festival of Spoken Word in Victoria. The main event at the Festival is the Spoken Word Poetry Slam Team Nationals held annually at a different city across Canada. Each of us has put in multiple years of work and dedication to get to this point.
The most important thing for a donor to realize is that for us Poetry isn't a hobby it is a way of life. The opportunity to compete, never mind win a National Championship opens so many poetry related doors which may have otherwise stayed closed. It also gives us an opportunity to represent our city on a Nationwide level, and showcase the diversity of the voices within its arts scene. This campaign, will cover just a fraction of the costs required to fly the Team from Ottawa to Victoria, never mind the price for lodging, food and other expenses.
The cost for plane tickets alone is almost $3000, the price of our stay is close to 2000 and the cost of team merchandise and personal expenses raises the total funds needed to around $6000. Currently we have almost half of that. This campaign is just one small step in what is truly a communal effort. We appreciate any support, no amount too large or small in helping us represent Ottawa, and bringing support and recognition to the city and the vibrant arts community.
In return for your support we are excited to share our art with you via the various perks offered for different levels of support. Once again there is no contribution too small, or too big. We would love to exceed these campaign goals as this is only one step in a larger fundraising process. Every dollar raised will go to help this team reach Victoria and compete to bring the National Championship back to Ottawa.
If you are unable to contribute we would appreciate any help you could give us by word of mouth, and/or by sharing with your social media circles. Much love to those who took the time to read this and thank you in advance for your generosity. 
  The 2014 Urban Legends Poetry Slam Team

story:
Our Story

We met in Armenia while serving in the Peace Corps from 2008 - 2010.   We became good friends and I  managed to convince John to accompany me on a six-month backpacking trip along the famous Appalachian Trail by plying him with baked goods and promises of impending glory.

 

 We are starting our hike in Georgia, at Springer Mt., on April 10th, and will faithfully hike the entire length of the Trail, approximately 2,170 miles, to the Northern terminus, Mt. Katahdin.  Along the way, we will be documenting the experience and our trials and joys through journaling, blogging, sketching, and photography.

The Impact

We would like to both use the hike to inspire our creative output and use our artistic and creative skills to reflect on our experiences, thoughts, and feelings during the trip.  Having recently returned from living abroad for more than two years, we are still re-adjusting to everything we've learned while living and working in Armenia, as well as getting used to living in American society again.  This is a turning point for us in our lives, and we are looking forward to the challenge of long-distance backpacking and the opportunity for reflection.

 

We're excited to share our experience with those who will never get the chance to thru-hike the Appalachian Trail.  Live vicariously through us!

What We Need & What You Get

Hiking the Trail is said to cost about $1.00 - $2.00 a mile, which works out to over $1000 - $2000, per person.  We're hoping to raise money to help us fund this journey : food, other supplies, gear, travel to and from the Trail, showers and laundry in town, and any unexpected expenses, like doctor's visits (but we hope we won't need those!).  Of course, some of the funds we raise will go towards art supplies and working on our reflections after the hike, as well as the perks that all you generous people will be receiving. 

 

For perks, we'll be sharing our reflections and artistic output with you all, in the form of postcards, sketches, photos, paintings, and, in the end, a book, collecting all these things together in a meaningful narrative. 

If you're unable to give money at this time, you can still help us by getting the word out!  Tweet about this or add a link to our project on your Facebook page!  The more the word gets out, the more successful we'll be. 

 

You can follow us on our blog at www.awayfromtheclank.blogspot.com, and you're welcome to support our trip in other ways, such as sending us care packages.  Thru-hikers are always hungry!  Information on sending us food can be found on our blog.

story:
LE OFFTA

Depuis 7 ans, la relève en arts vivants a son événement bien à elle : le Festival OFFTA. Du 24 mai au 2 juin, plus de 90 artistes prendront part aux 26 représentations de l’édition 2013 du OFFTA et, Montréal sera envahie par une vague d'artistes émergents et prometteurs.

Événement devenu incontournable, le Festival est une plateforme indispensable pour la relève des arts vivants en théâtre, danse et performance. Tribune structurante en création, production et diffusion, le OFFTA épaule les jeunes créateurs leur permettant, de plus, de diffuser des premières étapes de travail et des laboratoires.

Le Festival décloisonne les publics et les pratiques. Il diffuse et produit des événements métissés qui bousculent les pratiques établies et questionnent les modes de représentation.

 

LE OFFTA A BESOIN DE VOUS !

Après cinq ans de soutien de Patrimoine canadien, le OFFTA a appris que ce partenaire essentiel se désengage. Le Festival approche et cette nouvelle fait sonner l’alarme.

Au OFFTA on est téméraires et on fonce, on a décidé de maintenir l'intégralité de la programmation du festival sur laquelle notre communauté d’artistes s’appuie pour présenter le fruit de son travail !

On besoin de vous. De vos bidous. De votre change, vos sous noirs, de votre réseau pour soutenir les artistes de la relève montréalaise et pour permettre au OFFTA d’être encore présent, incorruptible….

Lundi 15 avril dernier, nous étions près de 200 personnes réunies à la Buvette chez Simone, à l’occasion de la soirée de lancement où l’on a pu mesurer toute la force vive de la jeune créativité montréalaise mais aussi l’engouement du public et des artistes pour le Festival.

Nous souhaitons vivement que le succès du OFFTA devienne une réussite commune. Partagez cette campagne sur les médias sociaux et parlez- en autour de vous… Soutenons le OFFTA ensemble!!

Pour simplement faire un don au OFFTA et recevoir un reçu de charité (dons de 100$ et plus) veuillez imprimer et remplir le formulaire prévu à cet effet.

C'est AUSSI le temps des impôts et des retours inespérés...alors pourquoi pas ne pas les investir dans un beau projet comme le nôtre ?

 

THE OFFTA NEEDS YOU !

After 5 years of financial support from Heritage Canada, this vital partner has withdrawn its funding. The festival is nearing and this bad piece of news has put us in a state of emergency. 

But, at the OFFTA, we're daring and not afraid to charge forward, so we've maintained the entire program which the artists of our community counts on to present their work!

We need you. Your small change, your pennies, your network to support montreal emerging artists and to ensure that the OFFTA will carry on, incorruptible...

 

PROGRAMMATION 2013

story:
Our Shared Story

The fishing tradition has touched everyone’s lives in Provincetown in some way, from the men and women of Provincetown's fishing past to the "wash ashore" today. We all realize that the town we know and love, would not be the place it is, were it not for the generations of fishermen and the safe harbor they created here, not just for themselves, but for one of the most remarkable and diverse communities in America. The time is more than past due that this proud history be honored with a public monument that echoes all the individualism and spirit of Provincetown's fishing legacy.

Provincetown native, and career sculptor, Romolo Del Deo, has been selected by the Provincetown Fishermen's Memorial Committee to create a fitting tribute in monumental lost wax bronze, a medium he has mastered for over 30 years, with publics works world wide. HIs scale model has been unanimously approved with acclamation by all the governing boards of Provincetown: the Art Commission, the Pier Corporation and the Board of Selectmen. The model will be unveiled in a public reception on June 28th, 7PM at Berta Walker Gallery, as part of the Blessing of the Fleet Celebration. ( See attached info)

The Provincetown Fishermen's Memorial Committee is asking for your tax deductible donation (through our fiscal sponsor, The Provincetown Community Compact, a 501(c)(3) organization incubating creative non-profit projects) to help fund the first phase of the work to create a Provincetown Fishermen's Memorial in monumental bronze, to be sited on Macmillan Wharf in Provincetown, MA. Gifts of any amount are appreciated, no amount is insignificant, everything helps. Please give generously in whatever amount you can afford, to help the Fishermen’s Memorial Committee rise to this challenge of creating something lasting that speaks not just to our storied past but to our future.

Our Goals and Your Rewards

  • This first phase of the funding campaign is designed to underwrite the startup costs of engineering and structural enlargement, in preparation for sculpting the monument in full scale and fabricating its armature. 
  • This project is targeted to take at least two years, and will require funding at various stages. All monies donated will be administered by the Fishermen's Memorial Committee and any unspent funds will be retained in the nonprofit's account and applied to the next phase of the project.
  • Donors will be rewarded with a beautiful selection of recognition gifts, according to the level of their giving, including limited edition original graphics, bronzes editions by Romolo Del Deo. The limited edition items will be available throughout all phases of the project until the editions are complete. No additional copies will be allowed and every copy will be an authentic signed artwork by the artist.

The Impact

This project is long overdue, Provincetown's sister towns of Gloucester and New Bedford, both have famous monuments honoring their seamen, how ironic that Provincetown, America's first art colony, and the home to artists for generations, has until now, lacked a monument to outshine her rivals.

The artist we have chosen, Romolo Del Deo,(exhibition resume attached) not only knows and loves the town of Provincetown where he was raised and is the son of a fisherman (his father, the renown painter Salvatore Del Deo, fished with Manny Zora on the Sea Fox) but he is also an accomplished professional in his field, with numerous monumental public works and museum exhibits. Recently, he was the youngest sculptor featured in the national touring exhibit, "Tides of Provincetown". This historic survey exhibit presented the 80 most important area artists of the last 200 years, organized by the New Britain Museum of American Art.

The Fishermen's Memorial Committee is comprised of Provincetown residents who know and love the town. They are dedicated to this cause:


Carol Peters - Chairperson

Kerry Adams - Treasurer

 Peter Robert Cook - Secretary

Luis Ribas - Harbormaster's Office

Chris King - Fishermen /Portugese Festival Coordinator

Kevin McLaughlin - Fundraising

Silvie Newman 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute that doesn’t mean you can’t help, everything is appreciated:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, share the link.

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools on their social media too.

And Thank you.

 The fiscal sponsor of the Provincetown Fishermen’s Memorial  is the Provincetown Community Compact, a 501 (c) 3, tax deductible organization. All proceeds from the funds maintained by the Provincetown Fishermen’s Memorial will be disbursed for the creation and maintenance of a Provincetown Fishermen’s Memorial Monument for the Town of Provincetown, Massachusetts. for more information or to contact the Provincetown Fishermen’s Memorial Committee, please contact us at info@provincetownfishermensmemorial.org

HTTP://PROVINCETOWNFISHERMENSMEMORIAL.ORG

story:
Welcome to LEGIT the UAS' 18th Birthday Bash & Fundraiser!

We're working hard to make this event our most sucessful fundraiser yet! Please support our organization by helping us reach our Indiegogo goal of 1,000.00 by November 17th!

Come dressed in your party rock/hipster/gang-star best!

A night bringing more mind blowing ART & MUSIC to the Calgary stage. The night will consist of a DJ Dance Party (featuring Chicks on Deck and Dustin Wolfe), a themed Photo-Booth (hosted by Aran Wilkenson-Blanc) and a rad showing of Art and a super-sized Raffle, plus OH so much more! 

The last time we go together for a Party like this Calgary, it was Sparkle Mania... This time the UAS is turning EIGHTEEN!! And we want YOU to JOIN US and be apart of our sweet sweet eighteen. We would like to OFFICIALLY invite you to come down to the UAS and help us create local history and celebrate this momentous occasion.

The UAS is dedicated to creating a safe venue for you to party, art, and mingle in. This event is inspired by every eighteenth birthday party you wish you had, so come and crush a cupcake or two, show your support for our organization and get that second chance at your most epic eighteen! ;) 

This event is (PWYC) Pay What You Can at the door, or pick up a rad-tastic VIP pass in advance. Balla! 

The vast majority of UAS's Funds come from fundraising events and the support of our members and the general public! Thank you!

About UAS: A Contemporary Art and Education Facility

Vision:
UAS envisions a space where members from various corners of the arts community can gather, exhibit work, produce work, increase artistic knowledge through workshops, and access dialogue and discourse through access to others in the community, in a casual and supportive atmosphere.  UAS is interested in supporting parallel activities such as curatorial practices, art review and critical writing, performance, and off-site art projects.  UAS is an open and inclusive society that is not discriminatory towards any artistic practice, but is simply focused on creating an environment that encourages growth and excellence in art.

Mission:
UAS showcases and provides production facilities to professionals, and occasionally students in the emerging stage of their artistic development for the purpose that their work be considered and recognized by the arts community and the general public. 

Mandate:
UAS is a non-profit, artist-run organization that provides infrastructure and peer-juried exhibition space to Calgary's pre-emerging artists and showcases visual arts and artists from diverse cultures and communities within the city.  UAS functions as a community for artists just finishing their arts education and acts as a meeting place for artists, arts administrators and the public.

 

UAS is supported by the Alberta Foundation for the Arts, the Calgary Arts Development Authority and the Alberta Foundation for the Arts.

story:
Short Summary

Former Blue Man and lifelong actor/artist Alexis Savino has come under legal and physcical attack for an absurdits portrayal of characters on Twitter as a part of his experiential film as a part of a branded cinema campaign for the W Hotel Residences in Hollywood Clifornia. Currently involved in 2 court cases in New York City, Alexis has been beaten in his home by uniformed officers of the city, and accused of personal harassment of public figures for outrageous farcical statements by his characters.

 

Savino lives and works humbly in New York City and Los Angeles as an actor, filmmaker, and healing food consuiltant for community members in health crisis (Cancer, HIV, digestive failure, extreme stress, anxiety, drug addiction). He has no funds available fo rhis legal defense, and has been wrongly accused of harassment and assault (when HE was the one assaulted). 

 

He is appealing for your support, for the right to remain free, safe, and protected under the Constitution, and recognized as an ARTIST (not an ideologue) for his PORTRAYALS in film and new media in character as a New Wave filmmaker.

What We Need & What You Get

Savino, a lifelong painter who has studied with artists Blue Man Group, Mary Azarian, Giovanni Guarcello, Don Sinceri, Larry Golden, Ryan & Trevor Oakes, and many more, offers original drawings, paintings, custom-written poetry read on camera, DVD's of his unreleased new films, in exchange for your gracious and generous support of his legal defense of ART and SATIRICAL PERFORMANCE and OPEN PROCESS/SHARED WRITING online.

The Impact

The first ammendment right to create art, farec, satire, and engage politcal, social, cultural, and artistic morays and events stands under attack while Alexis is under attack. The impact your support will have on civil rights in America, and hundreds more artists and loving human beings involved in all of SAvino's current work load of films, theatrical productions, and artworks, all stand to be impacted fo rhte vast positive with your support. Savino stands accused of outrageous charges that could even see him caged or hurt. He has lived under extreme stress for over a year, and under hazing and assault since mid-February 2013 for his portrayals of underdog-supporting superhero's on the internet as the "1st person narrative" open source interactive theater as a part of "Life, in Hollywood—homevideo." 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help by offering support directly to his lagal assitance, please contact him via www.alexissavino.com/contact

for more ways to do so, in the event you would prefer to offer financial assistance directly where it is in need.

 

THANK YOU!!!

The impact your support will have on civil rights in America, and hundreds more artists and loving human beings involved in all of SAvino's current work load of films, theatrical productions, and artworks, all stand to be impacted fo rhte vast positive with your support. Savino stands accused of outrageous charges that could even see him caged or hurt. He has lived under extreme stress for over a year, and under hazing and assault since mid-February 2013 for his portrayals of underdog-supporting superhero's on the internet as the "1st person narrative" open source interactive theater as a part of "Life, in Hollywood—homevideo." 


Other Ways You Can Help
You can also help by offering support directly to his lagal assitance, please contact him via www.alexissavino.com/contact 
for more ways to do so, in the event you would prefer to offer financial assistance directly where it is in need.
 
THANK YOU!!!

story:
Bending the Arc by Jennifer Wen Ma

 "The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice." MLK, Jr.

A site-specific public art project created by Jennifer Wen Ma with collaborators:
- Creative Technology Director: Guillermo Acevedo
- Interactive Sound Designers: Jason Freeman, Gerard Roma, Anna Xambó 
- Recording Artist/Record Producer/Composer: Jeryl Bright, featuring a performance by Nathaniel 'RDK' Williams
- Georgia Tech Chorale and Chamber Choir directed by Timothy Hsu

For Flux Night 2015: Dream in Atlanta's Old Fourth Ward, October 3, 7pm until midnight. 

  • Since 2010, Flux Projects has been transforming the way Atlantans interact with everyday spaces through innovative public art installations at no charge. Now, as we embark on our most ambitious project yet, we need your help.
  • Bending the Arc aims to exemplify the process of affecting change in collaboration with the Flux Night audience; their individual and collective voices become the vehicle for a visible transformation, emphasizing the powerful tide of change that occurs when we come together. 

What We Need | What You Get 

We need $27,500 to make this project a reality for our Flux Night audience. All the money we raise goes directly into the production of Bending the Arc. Your dollars will help support:

  • The work of Jennifer Wen Ma and her key collaborators: 
    - Jeryl Bright + 'RDK'
    - Guillermo Acevdo 
    - Jason Freeman, Anna Xambó, and Gerard Roma 
    - Georgia Tech Chorale and Chamber Choir directed by Timothy Hsu.
  • The creation of a new open source software for interactive sound design and voice animation.
  • This new software will be making its debut on Flux Night for Bending the Arc and capturing every voice that speaks, shouts, growls, groans or whispers into the microphones to help us change the flat-line into an arc. These voices - your voices - will then become the accompaniment for the live performance of 'Bending the Arc,' by Jeryl Bright, featuring 'RDK' and the Georgia Tech Chorale and Chamber Choir.  Every voice will count at midnight for the finale as we sing to bend the arc.
  • The live recording of 'Bending the Arc,' an original song by Jeryl Bright. This record will include the voices of our Flux Night 2015 audience and will continue across the airwaves and into the future. 

In return we will share with you items that commemorate Flux Night 2015: Dream. Depending on how much you give, you will get:
  • A shout out on our website.
  • Your name on the limited edition record jacket.
  • The cool Flux Night 2015: Dream magnet.
  • The coolest Flux Night 2015: Dream T-shirt.
  • Limited edition postcard of the artist's concept rendering, with a special thank you signed by Jennifer Wen Ma.
  • Limited edition 12" vinyl recording of the original song 'Bending the Arc,' by Jeryl Bright featuring 'RDK' | A-side, the studio recording | B-side, the live recording - your voice could be in the chorus!
  • A ticket to the VIP Party on Flux Night.
  • You and a friend will join Jennifer Wen Ma for a cocktail and a chat about art and life at the Flux Night VIP Party.

The Impact

  • Bending the Arc brings a world-class public art project to the city of Atlanta - to be experienced on the streets of the historic Old Fourth Ward, free and open to everyone who shows up.
  • This project will bring us together out in the world, shoulder to shoulder, face to face to experience through a work of art how we can all make a difference.
  • In the spirit of Bending the Arc where every voice counts, the software being created for this project will become open-source, further creating an ongoing global community of people using voices to effect change.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute $s, that's okay, you can still help:

  • Share this campaign with your family, friends and colleagues.  Tell people about it via email, Facebook, Twitter, telegram, postcard, message in bottle, or turn around and tell the person behind you!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools, they make it easy.

story:
Hey, there!

Just this year, I graduated with my MFA from Florida State University in Studio Art.  I'm living in the lovely city of Tallahassee, full-time, with university classes to teach in the fall along with my new co-director position at 621 Gallery ( 621 Gallery! ) with my partner in crime Haley Lauw.  

My work:

I make objects that are rooted in painting.  Translucent textiles stretched over frames offer delicate surfaces with peeking, assertive supports underneath.  The paint applied is nuanced in some areas and clumsy others, shifting back and forth between ethereal stains, loud color, and material textural.  Shapes shift between organic and geometric, non-representational and the slightly familiar.  Moments in these works call on something specific, but avoid it at the same time.  These things or images feel discernable and ambiguous all at once, revealing hidden secrets in crevices and behind layers when the viewer explores what is concealed. 

What now?

I feel more empowered about my work ( check me out! ) than ever after three intensive years of study, but going to school isn't enough.  New perspectives and learning experiences are the most important things we forget to keep having when academia comes to a close and work life begins again.

Post-graduate school is tough!  

I applied to The Vermont Studio Center's summer artist residency ( check it out on this top 20 list! )  as a way to keep my practice going (and was accepted, yesssss).  

Here, I can focus on my work as a visual artist for a concentrated, uninterrupted time away from my jobs and my normal schedule.  I'll meet artists, writers, and other creatives from around the world who I wouldn't meet anywhere else.  I can't wait to feel that sense of community and exchange we artists need to keep going!

Why do I need your help?

I never ask others for help, but attending a residency for my career as an emerging creative is so important.  I have small grants on my side for some of my fees, but I still haven't made ends meet to make this residency happen!

  • I'm asking for $2000, which will go towards my travel to Vermont (not very close to Tallahassee :( !), my tuition for the program, shipping my studio supplies to The Vermont Studio Center, and shipping for any supplies and artwork I've made back.  There's so much to move between two places!
  • I want to give back to you, too!  I'm offering sweet perks and works of art in exchange for your generosity to my cause.
  • If I do not reach my goal, I will try to make ends meet somehow, but I really can't do it without you!  Plus, who am I going to give all of those sweet perks and works of art..

Why Is This Important?

Not only is post-graduation tough, being an artist is one of the hardest jobs (keep reading).  Often, no one is rooting for us but our peers and ourselves.  Many question why we consider fine arts as professional avenue or lifestyle.  Are we crazy?!  

Yes.  Crazy in love. (halp)

We're the passionate facilitators of our own path in the arts, and sometimes that requires a lot of creative thinking.  

"How do I make this work?" 

Asking friends, loved ones, and everyone else is really hard.  Such as the life of an independent, "I can do it on my own!" type A, confusingly often type B, type of person in the world.

  • By supporting me here, you support not just an artist, but a friend.  (If we aren't all ready friends, LOOK OUT.)
  • Nothing makes me happier than giving other artists a boost with their own projects.  I've supported other campaigns in the past, and it really makes a difference in that artist's endeavor!  I bet you'll like it, too.  I'm really good at betting (but not slot machines).
  • Art isn't just a hobby for me, despite how I have to file it for tax purposes (hobby..).  I've dedicated my undergraduate education and my terminal masters degree to studio art, and now my career.

How Else Can I Help?

Money is tight for everyone!  There are more ways to help than shaking your wallet upside down and hoping for the best.  I did this the other day, and a bunch of old receipts (I wish I could forget) fell out detailing studio expenses, groceries, you name it:

  • Share my campaign on social media!  It's the fastest and easiest way to get the word out.  Get loud.
  • Indiegogo makes it easy to share!  Share your heart out!  (But be careful:  replacement hearts are hard to come by.)

story:
English version below

Vous pouvez aider Quercy Golsse, Potier-ceramiste dans le Tarn,  à reconstruire son four endommagé par des intempéries. 

Merci de votre soutien !"


 VERSION FRANÇAIS


Je m’appelle Quercy GOLSSE et je suis un artiste céramiste, spécialisé dans la cuisson à bois. D’origine Canadien et Français, je suis actuellement basé dans le Sud-Ouest de la France, dans le village médiéval de Puycelsi. Revenu ici depuis plusieurs années pour (réhabiliter, rétablir, occuper) restaurer et occuper les terrain terrassés, en contre-bas de Puycelsi, de mes arrières grands-parents, abandonnés depuis les années 1940. Je me suis donc installé et créé un espace de travail.


Ma pratique artistique céramique tourne autour de l'utilisation d'un four à bois. Ceci exige un type de four spécifique, comme celui que j’ai construit en 2009. Un petit four de 3 mètre cube, conçu le plus écologiquement possible sans sacrifier les résultats souhaités. Un four approprié pour le travail d’une seule personne. A ce moment là, je ne pouvais me permettre d’acheter que des briques réfractaires bas de gamme mais qui m’ont permis cependant de démarrer mon activité. Après sept ans de cuisson, ces briques de mauvaise qualité tombent en miette et la voute du four menace de tomber. Cela est dû au manque d’un toit pour protéger le four des diverses intempéries. Il a subi les phases de gel et de dégel ainsi que les dégradations dûent aux tempêtes.  j'ai pu construire le toit finalement mais le détérioration été déjà trop avancer. A ce moment précis, je ne peux plus faire de cuissons, cela met mon activité professionnelle en danger.




Comme le four entier tombe en morceaux, je n’ose plus cuire à des températures élevées (jusqu’à 1350°C). Un écroulement soudain à ces températures serait catastrophique, tant sur l’équipe de la cuisson que sur l’environnement local.

Je dois reconstruire mon four en utilisant des briques de qualité, à 2€ la brique. Cela dépasse le budget prévu initialement. Ajouté à ça le besoin d’outils adéquats pour la réalisation du four, le futur four sera plus petit et plus résistant qui résistera aux 20 prochaines années voir d’avantage.

La construction d’un four à bois prévu pour cuire de la céramique est très onéreuse, même pour un petit comme celui là. Un four de 2x3 m coûterait environ 4000€ uniquement pour les éléments fondamentaux, ce qui comprend les briques réfractaires et leur livraison (1 brique = 3,2kg). Le projet global coûtera entre 5000€ et 6000€. Ce qui inclut également, des étagères pour l’intérieur du four et des matériaux nécessaires à la construction. Je construirai le four moi-même avec l'aide d'amis et de volontaires et j’utiliserai les éléments réutilisables du 1er four.

En échange de votre aide, suivant votre don je peux vous offrir des tasses faites par mes soins et des bowls avec émaillage naturels, des ateliers pour apprendre à cuire au four à bois et des œuvres d'art.

Ce four est mon outil de travail nécessaire à la réalisation de mes œuvres. Sans lui je ne peux continuer l’activité que j’ai développé et affiné durant ces 12 dernières années, utilisant le technique spécifique de la cuisson à bois. C’est également pour moi une manière de continuer à participer à la vie active du village et continuer la présence de ma famille ici depuis plus de cinq générations. Ce petit village rural compte 80 habitants l’hiver et se développer ici à l’année est un parcours semé d’embuches. L’économie des activités de ce village se limite à la saison estivale.

Ma présence et mon implication dans le village sont en parti une tentative d'empêcher le village de ne vivre uniquement avec les touristes l’été. Ce village a besoin de toutes les générations pour rester dynamique. Village où vivent les jeunes et leurs ainés, les permanents et les temporaires, les actifs et les retraités mais la chose la plus importante est qu'il doit continuer à vivre.

Si vous pouvez participer ou m'aider à faire passer le mot de ce projet sur les lieux médiatiques, sociaux ou à des personnes susceptibles d’aider. Re-construisons ce four ensemble et qu’il dure pendant les nombreuses années à venir.


===========================================================
======================================================================================================================


ENGLISH VERSION 

============================================================

========================================================================================================================

Please help me rebuild my ceramic wood kiln.  

My name is Quercy Golsse and I am a Canadian/French ceramic wood fire artist based in the south west of France in the historic medieval village of Puycelsi.  I moved back here to re-invest my great grandfather’s farming terraces abandoned since the 1940’s and create a working life for myself.

My practice revolves around the use of a wood fired kiln and natural glazing. This requires a specific type of kiln, like the one I built back in 2009, a small 3 cubic m cross draft kiln suitable for one person's work. At the time, I was only able to get used refractory bricks of questionable quality, which did allow me to get started. However, after seven years of great firings, those poor quality bricks are crumbling apart and the arch is falling in. As such, I can no longer make and fire work, putting my artistic practice in jeopardy.

      As the whole kiln is falling apart, I don't dare fire again as the inside of the kiln gets to above 1300 degrees Centigrade, and sudden collapse at this temperature would be catastrophic to both the people firing the kiln and the local environment.

I need to rebuild my kiln using better quality bricks but at minimum 2 Euros a brick for about 1500 bricks, this falls outside my potential budget, especially as I have no tool with which to fire new work. Taking advantage of this unfortunate situation, I plan to make a new slightly smaller and refined design kiln that is more efficient and that will hopefully last for the next twenty years, if not more.

What I Need

Building a wood fired kiln is a very expensive undertaking, even a small one like this one at about 2 cubic metres will cost about 4000 Euros for just the basics i.e. new refractory bricks and delivery (each brick weighs about 3.2kg) . The overall project will cost 5000 to 6000 Euros including new kiln shelves (needed to load pieces on for optimized space usage) and accessory materials (metal for bracing, wood for formwork, mortar). I will be building the kiln myself with the help of friends and volunteers and using whatever elements that I can salvage from my first kiln as materials to increase insulation and structure.  


In exchange for helping me, I'm offering specially made cups and natural ash bowls, workshops to learn how to fire a wood kiln and art works by well generous contributing artists and friends.  


This kiln is, as I've mentioned, a critical part of my own artistic practice, without it I cannot continue to make the work in the specific world of wood fired ceramics that I have been developing and refining for the past 12 years. But it’s not only that, it is also for me a way of participating in a long active family presence in this village going back at least five generations . A small rural village of about 80 people in winter, it is hard for younger people to stay and live in this village as potential work is limited to seasonal work during the tourist season and rare during the rest of the year. The village is a classified historic site which means all renovations must go through extensive paperwork and meet an aesthetic standard making any work expensive. It took me several years to get permission to build my kiln shed and happily built it in the required post and beam style with antique tiles for the roof.  My presence and implication in the village is my small attempt to prevent the village from become Disneyland type tourist trap, inactive and lifeless for most of the year. This village needs all sorts to live in it, both young and old, permanent and secondary, working and retired but the most important thing is that it needs to keep on living.


With your help, I hope to keep participating in the life of this village and to keep making and sharing my art.

Please help if you can or help me get the word out about this project. Please share this page on your social media channels and let’s get this kiln rebuilt and firing strong for many years to come.


My goal:

To raise 4000 Euros for the very basics needed to build the kiln.


Stretch goal :

After raising the basic 4000 Euros to get the basic building materials, any additional funds raised up to 6000 Euros will go to getting new kiln shelves (about 900 Euros for a full set) new refractory pillars, metal for bracing and new kiln tools (used during the firings) and other building material wood for the arch forms.

===========================================================

====================================================================================================================== 
ENGLISH VERSION 
============================================================
========================================================================================================================

Please help me rebuild my ceramic wood kiln.  
My name is Quercy Golsse and I am a Canadian/French ceramic wood fire artist based in the south west of France in the historic medieval village of Puycelsi.  I moved back here to re-invest my great grandfather’s farming terraces abandoned since the 1940’s and create a working life for myself. 
My practice revolves around the use of a wood fired kiln and natural glazing. This requires a specific type of kiln, like the one I built back in 2009, a small 3 cubic m cross draft kiln suitable for one person's work. At the time, I was only able to get used refractory bricks of questionable quality, which did allow me to get started. However, after seven years of great firings, those poor quality bricks are crumbling apart and the arch is falling in. As such, I can no longer make and fire work, putting my artistic practice in jeopardy.
      As the whole kiln is falling apart, I don't dare fire again as the inside of the kiln gets to above 1300 degrees Centigrade, and sudden collapse at this temperature would be catastrophic to both the people firing the kiln and the local environment.I need to rebuild my kiln using better quality bricks but at minimum 2 Euros a brick for about 1500 bricks, this falls outside my potential budget, especially as I have no tool with which to fire new work. Taking advantage of this unfortunate situation, I plan to make a new slightly smaller and refined design kiln that is more efficient and that will hopefully last for the next twenty years, if not more. 



What I NeedBuilding a wood fired kiln is a very expensive undertaking, even a small one like this one at about 2 cubic metres will cost about 4000 Euros for just the basics i.e. new refractory bricks and delivery (each brick weighs about 3.2kg) . The overall project will cost 5000 to 6000 Euros including new kiln shelves (needed to load pieces on for optimized space usage) and accessory materials (metal for bracing, wood for formwork, mortar). I will be building the kiln myself with the help of friends and volunteers and using whatever elements that I can salvage from my first kiln as materials to increase insulation and structure.  In exchange for helping me, I'm offering specially made cups and natural ash bowls, workshops to learn how to fire a wood kiln and art works by well generous contributing artists and friends.  This kiln is, as I've mentioned, a critical part of my own artistic practice, without it I cannot continue to make the work in the specific world of wood fired ceramics that I have been developing and refining for the past 12 years. But it’s not only that, it is also for me a way of participating in a long active family presence in this village going back at least five generations . A small rural village of about 80 people in winter, it is hard for younger people to stay and live in this village as potential work is limited to seasonal work during the tourist season and rare during the rest of the year. The village is a classified historic site which means all renovations must go through extensive paperwork and meet an aesthetic standard making any work expensive. It took me several years to get permission to build my kiln shed and happily built it in the required post and beam style with antique tiles for the roof.  My presence and implication in the village is my small attempt to prevent the village from become Disneyland type tourist trap, inactive and lifeless for most of the year. This village needs all sorts to live in it, both young and old, permanent and secondary, working and retired but the most important thing is that it needs to keep on living.With your help, I hope to keep participating in the life of this village and to keep making and sharing my art.




Please help if you can or help me get the word out about this project. Please share this page on your social media channels and let’s get this kiln rebuilt and firing strong for many years to come. My goal:To raise 4000 Euros for the very basics needed to build the kiln.Stretch goal :After raising the basic 4000 Euros to get the basic building materials, any additional funds raised up to 6000 Euros will go to getting new kiln shelves (about 900 Euros for a full set) new refractory pillars, metal for bracing and new kiln tools (used during the firings) and other building material wood for the arch forms.

story:
Patchwork Village celebrates the 40th anniversary of the site-plan approval of The Esplanade (1976-2016). This storytelling project highlights the important role that each neighbour plays in making what this downtown Toronto neighbourhood is today.

Under artistic leadership, Esplanadians of all ages and cultures are creating and performing solos to share stories of their fellow neighbors. With more than 100 people engaged in this creative process, the night of October 1st in Crombie Park promises to be remembered. 

Patchwork Village is a journey into our intangible cultural heritage, weaving the stories that form our collective sense of identity and belonging.

Walk the path with us and be part of the journey: donate to bring this endeavor to life.

A project co-produced by Jamii and dance-theatre company CORPUS, a common initiative to bring community-arts to The Esplanade neighbourhood.

www.jamiiesplanade.org
www.corpus.ca

story:
Our Story

I'm passionate about many things- Art, dance, Music, Acting-  Although something  draws me to the art of Pin up- but not just any pin up- the styles from WWII. Although Pin up art has been around for a much longer time, this style, I think, is the most popular from history and most people think of this kind when the word "pin up" is mentioned. I have been involved in recreating the world and lives of people during WWII- as a performer and artist. Pin up modeling has become a passion of mine and something I want to share more with the world.


The Impact

By creating this calendar- yes one will have the opportunity to look at pretty girls (and I don't think anyone is complaining on that), but in doing so, we are also creating a part of history that I think can get overlooked sometimes. This project also allows not only models and a photographer to come together, but artists from all backgrounds. Hair artists, Make-up artist, even film makers, singers and actors will be involved. Isn't our job as artists to strive and make something beautiful? It's even more productive when we can combine more fields of creation in the process. By creating these calendars, the sale of each one will have a percentage of the funds donated to the Alzheimers Association. This is something that personally affects me as I have a grandmother currently suffering from it and a deceased grandmother who had dementia. So many WWII vets are now at the age also where these terrible diseases are inflicting on their lives more and more. We will also be giving a percentage to Wounded Warriors for those vets who have served courageously and endured injury. 


What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $5000- yes I know this does sound like a lot for just some pictures- but these are NOT just some pictures. We are seeking out the perfect places and that cost time and money. Printing up the final calendars cost money. Paying professional models and a photographer cost money. There are more than enough places for our money to go for this project. Other funding includes costumes, set ups, break downs, and on set food and drink ( as we don't want our models to get cranky and to stay hydrated and look gorgeous). Please check out the perks to see what you can take home for being a part of this amazing project. 


Other Ways You Can Help

How can you help? Spreading the word and this link will be our best attribute to our goal. Simply by asking people to donate any amount (and trust me, ANY amount helps)  they can afford will help get us closer. Please note, this project is not done in vanity and we are not wanting to just look at ourselves. As I stated before, we are wanting to create an image of history and having our proceeds go to a greater cause is the biggest goal here. Thank you for taking the time to check out this project. We appreciate your support.

story:
When an opportunity presents itself...

I am Fn Vegas (aka Natalie Vegas), a mixed media artist based out of Montréal, Canada. I have been working as a full-time artist for the past three years, filling homes and hearts with my art. Because of YOU, I have been able to live off my work - at fairs, monthly group exhibits and, most recently, university - and have been privileged to develop my voice as an artist.

The time has come to push my career to the next level with an incredible opportunity that life has placed in my path: I have been invited to participate in a month-long Artist Residency in Mayurbhanj, India focusing on the culture, rituals and superstitions of ancient tribes in the region.

This an amazing opportunity for the obvious reasons, but also because it happens to reflect the direction that my art is taking. Unfortunately, I am not illegible for grants of any kind and with my artist salary it is a stretch to make this happen.

Which is why I am reaching out to you because, with your help, however, anything is possible! Not least is the opportunity to make my fans, friends and family an integral part of the most important experience of my career to date. I have prepared a series of really fun perks that will allow YOU to travel with me to India and allow ME to take the next big step in my career.

This trip to India is only the beginning of the Fn Vegas Majurbanhj Project, but certainly the most important part. During the month-long trip beginning January 6, 2016, I will be travelling to the Odisha region and studying some of the 52  local tribes found there -  their music, relationships, lifestyle, art and crafts, deities, folktales and rituals . I will be collecting a vast library of images, videos and papers that will form the foundation of my first SOLO exhibit as a professional artist. 

This is the next big step in my career and I am humbly reaching out to YOU - fans, friends and family - for help me make this one in a lifetime opportunity a reality. 


What I Need & What You Get

The Fn Vegas Mayurbhanj Project will span little over a year and will cost approximately $12,000  which not only includes the costs associated with the trip itself, but also the material and time to create the show.  I am looking to raise only a fraction of that amount $3,200 CAN which will ONLY cover the trip to Mayurbhanj:
  • $1380 CAN for the residency (food and lodging)
  • $1450 CAN round trip flight 
  • $200 CAN travel insurance 
  • $80 CAN for my travel VISA
  • $200 to update travel vaccines 
  • $40 for 2 night stay at Bhubaneswar airport
The Fn Vegas Mayurbhanj Project will result in a beautifully crafted exhibition taking place early 2017, hopefully to be followed by a multi-city tour TBA. The entire process will be documented and all contributors to this campaign will receive a special mention at the exhibition's "Wall of Gratitude'', a full wall dedicated in thanks to those who support me in this stage of my career. 
For every donation, I have prepared a series a unique perks directly related to my process in India. I want to invite you to live the experience with me and to be able to say that you directly contributed to pushing my career to the next level!

PERSONAL POSTCARDS

(Not actual postcard. Sample postcard by Larry Fulton)
The Postcard: Receive a personalized postcard from me sent from Majurbanhj, India to personally thank you for your contribution!
The Electronic Postcard: receive a personalized Thank You Video from me, filmed and sent to you from Majurbanhj, India. The video will be posted on my YouTube Channel and available for you to share as you wish. 

PERSONALIZED PRINTS FROM INDIA 

(This is just an example, yours will be better and insprired IN INDIA!)
I have decided to make my piece, titled Le Monde, the official print of this journey. Taken from my Tarot de Berlin Noir series, Le Monde represents the end of a phase and the beginning of a new one. This card is also about giving back to the world, and sharing what we have learned and gained.
Inspired by the surroundings in Mayurbhanj, I will add designs directly to prints of Le Monde with a golden pen. Each print will be unique with modifications inspired from my stay in India and shipped upon my return to Canada.
The Small Print: A 8.5  x 11 -inch print of Le Monde with gold designs.
The Large Print: A 12' x 18-inch Limited Edition print of Le Monde with gold designs. Only 15 of these will ever be printed, exclusive to this project!
Transfer on Cork: A 11' x 14-inch image transfer on cork of Le Monde with gold designs and writing on the back explaining the inspiration of the moment.

TATTOO FROM FN VEGAS


Make your appreciation a part of you with this design created and tattooed by me! Most of you know that my background is in tattooing and my heart is in symbolism. It's only natural that I would jump on the occasion to design something specifically for the project: a flower mandala blooming from my eye. Help make my project blossom.
Appointments will be about a week after the trip (week of February 22, 2016) so participants will also receive a first-hand account of my adventures!
This tattoo design measures 3 x 3 inches and will be your choice of color. It may be tattooed on you personally or be given as a gift to someone else. 
LE MONDE FRAMED 15'' x 22''

SOLD OUT!                        

(this one is ready to ship!)
Ready to ship and ready to hang! This is the original piece that I presented at Morbido in Mexico for the opening of my ''Tarot de Berlin Noir''. It was hung at my house until now, I decorated it and I am ready to part with it as a symbol of the new beginning. 
ORIGINAL PAPER COLLAGE

I am an absolute sucker for hand-made paper from India and plan on bringing back lots to include in my final collection. This is your chance to PRE-BUY a piece from the final exhibit!
These pieces will be inspired and sketched in India and created upon my return to my studio in Canada. They will be created on wood panel, ready to hang and will include a hand-written note on the reverse, explaining what each piece was inspired from.
The Abstract: This is a 8 x 10-inch' mixed media abstraction  made from papers collected during the trip. 
The Elephant: This is a 8 x 10-inch mixed media representation of an elephant made from papers collected during the trip. 
The Peacock: This is a 10 x 12-inch mixed media representation of a peacock made from papers collected during the trip.
The Portrait: This is a 12 x 16-inch mixed media portrait based on a picture you provide and made with papers collected during the trip
You can choose a cold or warm palette but you must contact me before January 5th, 2016 with your selection.



LE MONDE - INDIA EDITION

SOLD OUT!


This is a 24 x 36-inch mixed media on cork of my piece, Le Monde, taken from my Tarot de Berlin Noir series, Le Monde represents the end of a journey and, inevitably, the beginning of another.  It is about opening to new possibilities, giving back to the world by sharing knowledge and experiences. Because of its meaning, it has always been my all-time favorite Tarot card and have decided to make it the official piece of this journey.
This framed piece is modified with a golden paint and ready to ship!

WHO IS THE BEST?? YOU ARE THE BEST!!!
If you even consider for a second investing $1000 to my campaign then you rock and are my rock! <3 Thank you so much for believing in me, words cannot express how much your faith in my art and process means to me!
For this most generous gift, you will receive a personalized video from India with a million kisses attached to it, an exclusive access to my India video blog documenting the ups and downs of my visit, and personal mention in gold lettering everywhere possible! Additionally, I will carefully pick papers in the palette of your choice for an 16 x 20-inch mixed media piece on wood panel on which I will also incorporate pieces of my personal India journal. Choose between an Abstraction, Elephant, Peacock or Portrait and the piece will be presented dead center of the "Wall of gratitude"... because you ROCK!!!


Additionally, on the night of the opening, it will be my pleasure to treat you to a one on one dinner and arrive at the gallery together because... you rock! And you are my Guest of Honor :)
Merci!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
I am a full-time artist. As such, 90% of my revenue goes right back into buying supplies and making more art. The tightly calculated goal for my Artist Residency in Mayurbhanj is $3200.
As a tax payer, you automatically contribute to the grant system but these grants are very difficult to get. If you like my art and you like what I do, this is the best way to show it!
If you happen to read all of these perks but are not in a position to participate, you can still show your support by sharing this campaign. 
Whatever your contribution is, I thank you from the bottom of my paint-stained heart! Merci!
With love,
Fn Vegas

story:
"Natürlich Jeans! Oder kann sich einer ein Leben ohne Jeans vorstellen?"
Ulrich Plenzdorf " Die neuen Leiden des jungen W." 1973

Ein bisschen Hintergrund...

Es ist inzwischen 7 Jahre her als ich auf die Schnapsidee kam eine spezielle
Berliner Jeans hier produzieren zu lassen.
Die Grundidee kam von meinem Faible für den blauen Stoff, mit dem ich mich besonders durch meinen Laden Rock-A-Tiki seit fast 20 Jahren intensiv beschäftige und natürlich die Stadt aller Städte. Und wie Berlin sollte auch die Jeans sein:
rauh, dickhäutig, abseits aller Mainstream-Modeströmungen und quasi unkaputtbar. Nach langer Suche fand ich eine kleine Näherei im Wedding welche das Know-How und das Equipment für die Produktion hatte.
Die erste Edition von 50 Stück war innerhalb von 4 Wochen verkauft.
Selbst ich als Optimist war überrascht stellte ich mir doch insgeheim die Frage "Wieviel Jeans-Label braucht die Welt noch?".  

Der eigentliche Star: die Nietenhose!

Wie bei einem guten Essen sind bei einer Jeans die Zutaten die wichtigste Grundlage.

DENIM:  16oz Indigo Dyed Sanforized Selvage Denim von Cone Mills U.S.A. 
Klingt jetzt für viele erstmal kryptisch, nur soviel dazu: Cone Mills war seit 1915 der Denim Produzent für die Levi´s 501, 16oz ist die Dicke des Stoffes (sprich sehr dick, "normale" Jeans liegen bei 8-10oz) und Sanforizing ein Verfahren zum schrumpfen des Stoffes, sprich die Jeans läuft nicht mehr groß ein.
Wer mehr wissen will schaut einfach mal bei den Perks nach.
Dort biete ich eine Einführung in die wundersame Welt der Nietenhosen an. 
TASCHENSTOFF, NAHTGARN & LABEL: natürlich Made in Germany!
NIETEN & KNÖPFE: ganz oldschool aus Kupfer Made in U.S.A
.

Und was unterscheidet Berlin Denim nun von anderen Jeans?
Im Gegensatz zu den gerade modernen engen Beinkleidern hat unsere Jeans ein gerades etwas weiteres Bein. Dazu werden die Berlin Denim in 2 Längen angeboten 34inches und 38inches. Letztere ermöglicht es auch großen Menschen die Jeans mit Umschlag zu tragen.
Ein weiterer  mir wichtiger Punkt war die sogenannte Watchpocket.
Das ist die kleine Tasche vorne welche man bei jeder Jeans findet. Vor über 100 Jahren dazu gedacht die Taschenuhr (oder später das Kleingeld) unterzubringen.
Das fand ich 2008 nicht mehr zeitgemäß und habe diese vergrößert, so das man auch bequem einen MP3-Player (oder Taschenmesser, Feuerzeuge etc.) darin unterbringen kann. Auch die hinteren Taschen bieten genug Stauraum, was gerade im Sommer, wenn man nicht mehr als Jeans & T-Shirt tragen will, sehr praktisch ist.
Bei der Farbwahl der Garne hab ich mich gegen das gängige Orange für die Farben Berlins entschieden: Rot & Weiß.


Ein ebenso wichtiger Punkt ist, das die Berlin Denim einzig und allein nur bei 
Rock-A-Tiki erhältlich ist. Der Grund ist mehr als simpel.
Wir produzieren mit den besten Materialien und in sehr kleiner Stückzahl, d.h. die Produktionskosten sind sehr hoch. Nur dadurch, das zwischen Endkunde und Produzent kein Großhändler/Wiederverkäufer steht, können wir trotz gestiegener Weltmarktpreise für Baumwolle den Preis von 139,- Euro seit 2008 halten. 
Auch wenn wir Einschnitte machen mussten: bis zur 4. Edition wurde der Jeans ein T-Shirt beigelegt, auf welcher die Waschanleitung in den beiden Weltsprachen berlinerisch und englisch gedruckt war. Dieses fiel aus Kostengründen leider, leider weg.
Unter den Perks ist dieses T-Shirt als Re-Issue erhältlich. 

Die Frage aller Fragen: warum Crowdfunding?

Bislang konnte ich die vorherigen Editionen mit Hilfe von Freunden und Familie vorfinanzieren . Bei der letzten Edition wurde ein guter Teil der Produktion mit dieser Aktie gedeckt:

Inzwischen ist Crowdfunding ein großes Thema und man kann ein vielfaches mehr an Unterstützern erreichen als über eine Aktie welche man nur im Laden anbietet.
Und (Achtung! Wortspiel!) wo wäre eine Indigo-gefärbte Buxe besser aufgehoben als bei Indiegogo?

UND Ihr spart bares Geld: hier bekommt Ihr eine Berlin Denim für 100,- Euro statt Ladenpreis 139,-. Wat für ein Schnäppchen!

Du willst eine Berlin Denim?

Hier der Größenschlüssel. Wir bieten 7 Weiten in 2 Längen an:

Größen-Update!!!! Da vermehrt Anfragen vom schönen Geschlecht kommen bieten wir ab sofort auch die Weiten 28 & 29 in 34er Länge an.
Plus Weite 40 für große Männer.
Alle Größen sind in Inches. Solltet Ihr Eure Jeansgröße bei z.B. Levi`s wissen liegt Ihr genau richtig.
Falls die Größe nicht passt tauschen wir diese natürlich um.
Sollte die Jeans absolut nicht passen gibt es das Geld zurück.
Denn wenn ich eins gelernt habe in 15 Jahren als Nietenhosenfachverkäufer 
dann ist es dieses:
Nicht jede Jeans passt auf jeden Arsch. Da kann sie noch so toll sein.

Wir freuen uns über jeden Cent. Und sollte der nicht locker sitzen 

dann erzählt es weiter und shared es auf auf allen Kanälen.
Wir sagen schon mal DANKE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
ACHTUNG! NOCH EIN UPDATE!
Da Indiegogo nur PayPal akzeptiert und natürlich nicht jeder einen PayPal Account besitzt bieten wir im Laden ganz Old-School die bewährte Aktie an.
Bezahlt werde kann bar, per Geldkarte oder Überweisung.
Bei Fragen, Anregungen oder Kritik mailen, telefonieren
oder einfach im Laden vorbei kommen:

Rock-A-Tiki @ Class of Berlin
Große Hamburger Straße 19a
10115 Berlin / Mitte
Dienstag - Samstag 12-20 Uhr
Fon: 030-43739760
story_txt:
"Natürlich Jeans! Oder kann sich einer ein Leben ohne Jeans vorstellen?"Ulrich Plenzdorf " Die neuen Leiden des jungen W." 1973
   Ein bisschen Hintergrund... Es ist inzwischen 7 Jahre her als ich auf die Schnapsidee kam eine spezielleBerliner Jeans hier produzieren zu lassen.Die Grundidee kam von meinem Faible für den blauen Stoff, mit dem ich mich besonders durch meinen Laden Rock-A-Tiki seit fast 20 Jahren intensiv beschäftige und natürlich die Stadt aller Städte. Und wie Berlin sollte auch die Jeans sein:rauh, dickhäutig, abseits aller Mainstream-Modeströmungen und quasi unkaputtbar. Nach langer Suche fand ich eine kleine Näherei im Wedding welche das Know-How und das Equipment für die Produktion hatte.Die erste Edition von 50 Stück war innerhalb von 4 Wochen verkauft.Selbst ich als Optimist war überrascht stellte ich mir doch insgeheim die Frage "Wieviel Jeans-Label braucht die Welt noch?".  Der eigentliche Star: die Nietenhose!
 Wie bei einem guten Essen sind bei einer Jeans die Zutaten die wichtigste Grundlage.

DENIM:  16oz Indigo Dyed Sanforized Selvage Denim von Cone Mills U.S.A. 
Klingt jetzt für viele erstmal kryptisch, nur soviel dazu: Cone Mills war seit 1915 der Denim Produzent für die Levi´s 501, 16oz ist die Dicke des Stoffes (sprich sehr dick, "normale" Jeans liegen bei 8-10oz) und Sanforizing ein Verfahren zum schrumpfen des Stoffes, sprich die Jeans läuft nicht mehr groß ein.Wer mehr wissen will schaut einfach mal bei den Perks nach. Dort biete ich eine Einführung in die wundersame Welt der Nietenhosen an. TASCHENSTOFF, NAHTGARN & LABEL: natürlich Made in Germany!NIETEN & KNÖPFE: ganz oldschool aus Kupfer Made in U.S.A.
Und was unterscheidet Berlin Denim nun von anderen Jeans?Im Gegensatz zu den gerade modernen engen Beinkleidern hat unsere Jeans ein gerades etwas weiteres Bein. Dazu werden die Berlin Denim in 2 Längen angeboten 34inches und 38inches. Letztere ermöglicht es auch großen Menschen die Jeans mit Umschlag zu tragen.Ein weiterer  mir wichtiger Punkt war die sogenannte Watchpocket.Das ist die kleine Tasche vorne welche man bei jeder Jeans findet. Vor über 100 Jahren dazu gedacht die Taschenuhr (oder später das Kleingeld) unterzubringen.Das fand ich 2008 nicht mehr zeitgemäß und habe diese vergrößert, so das man auch bequem einen MP3-Player (oder Taschenmesser, Feuerzeuge etc.) darin unterbringen kann. Auch die hinteren Taschen bieten genug Stauraum, was gerade im Sommer, wenn man nicht mehr als Jeans & T-Shirt tragen will, sehr praktisch ist.Bei der Farbwahl der Garne hab ich mich gegen das gängige Orange für die Farben Berlins entschieden: Rot & Weiß.




Ein ebenso wichtiger Punkt ist, das die Berlin Denim einzig und allein nur bei Rock-A-Tiki erhältlich ist. Der Grund ist mehr als simpel. Wir produzieren mit den besten Materialien und in sehr kleiner Stückzahl, d.h. die Produktionskosten sind sehr hoch. Nur dadurch, das zwischen Endkunde und Produzent kein Großhändler/Wiederverkäufer steht, können wir trotz gestiegener Weltmarktpreise für Baumwolle den Preis von 139,- Euro seit 2008 halten. Auch wenn wir Einschnitte machen mussten: bis zur 4. Edition wurde der Jeans ein T-Shirt beigelegt, auf welcher die Waschanleitung in den beiden Weltsprachen berlinerisch und englisch gedruckt war. Dieses fiel aus Kostengründen leider, leider weg.Unter den Perks ist dieses T-Shirt als Re-Issue erhältlich. 
Die Frage aller Fragen: warum Crowdfunding?
 Bislang konnte ich die vorherigen Editionen mit Hilfe von Freunden und Familie vorfinanzieren . Bei der letzten Edition wurde ein guter Teil der Produktion mit dieser Aktie gedeckt:
Inzwischen ist Crowdfunding ein großes Thema und man kann ein vielfaches mehr an Unterstützern erreichen als über eine Aktie welche man nur im Laden anbietet.Und (Achtung! Wortspiel!) wo wäre eine Indigo-gefärbte Buxe besser aufgehoben als bei Indiegogo?

Levi`s wissen liegt Ihr genau richtig.Falls die Größe nicht passt tauschen wir diese natürlich um.Sollte die Jeans absolut nicht passen gibt es das Geld zurück.Denn wenn ich eins gelernt habe in 15 Jahren als Nietenhosenfachverkäufer dann ist es dieses:Nicht jede Jeans passt auf jeden Arsch. story:
Greetings ! i am an artist in Victoria , b.c. trying to run a small independent art gallery that specializes in weird ,wacky and horror art made by myself and other local artists . i have designed the space much like a cartoon version of Dr Frankenstein's laboratory which makes it stand apart from your typical galleries. robot paintings,weird rubber toys,puppets and oddities decorate the walls . It's like pee wee's playhouse meet a carnival's house of horrors !!

i have been open for only a few months working on zero budget and have realized that in order to make it work , i have to expand my operations ,and in order to do that,i need more money for supplies .i am a working artist , devoting all my free time to creating art for my gallery. Since funding for the arts in British Columbia has been severely cut in the last few years , i feel my best hope is indie gogo . the gallery can only be an inferior version of what i know it can be without a little help from others.

I need your help to expand my gallery and ensure that outsider and lowbrow art has a voice in Victoria, a town who's existing galleries cater mostly to contemporary mainstream tastes. the art in my gallery appeals to a margin of people that are not necessarily rich art collectors looking for a painting simply because it matches their living room furniture. with a taste for the nostalgic and innocent, the d.i.y approach to art and toy making appeals to kids as well as adults." Monster party " is a venue for this kind of art that is not only hard to come by but is also a very niche market.
